reply gentle reader abundantly proueth primacy bishop rome againste othe directly tendeth horne auoucheth euidently proued dere countrie englande well conquest sythens also christened countres west churche italy spaine fraunce germany reste east churche also yea amonge aethyopians armenian witness authours horne selfe hath builded proufes vpon contrary practise first general councelles many national councelles beside spaine fraunce germanye hath pronounced euidently pope bishoppes supremacy nothing prince matter ecclesiasticall thy parte christe reader shutte thy eye truthe clerely shining thy face againste truthe bicause horne whole answer vayne blaste confutation answer auoide confusion reply whereof many diuers haue late come forthe haue termed distinctio sake counterblaste nowe gentle reader earnestly beseche thee article day ouer christendo controuersious great temerite selfe willed heretiks raised vp diligently labour trauaile supremacy suche say truthe effecte al depende vpon protestantes lutheran zwinglians anabaptistes trinitaries sectes otherwise mutuall mortall enemitie emonge themselues conspire againste primacy see apostolike good resolution one pointe staieth setleth conscience sure stronge anker insurgies tempestes foresaide rablemet sectes schismes contrary wise one circumuented deceaued article caried tossed raging whaues flouddes euery errour heresy without staie settling euen owne errours reporte grecian forsaking vnitie romaine churche first arrians defying popesozo lib cap socrat li cap may appeare letter eusebius greate arrian felowes iulius pope fell macedonian nestorian eutychians monothelites iconomaches diuers greate heresy eche heresy breeding great number sectes conspiring see apostolike vntil last proceding heresy heresie diuers reco ciliations romaine see comming betwene staied longe time god highe vengeaunce ensewed fel turkish captiuitie lamentable case remayne day reporte african falling vnitie romaine seeopta li first donatistes despising iudgemente pope melchiades first springe heresy might haue bene stopped geuen eare chiefe pastour falling pelagiansvictor de persequut vandal soone arrians conqueste wandalles became time infidelles daie continue reporte laste heresy northe bohemian fyrstein parua confessio de coena domini nowe luther scholers whiche wythin fewe yeares maister yet liuing flourisshing wente farre hym pronounced open writyng heretiques archeheretiques yet nowe meane sacramentaries whome luther defyed beare greatest swaye sectes ende heresy wyll except abandonne tyme hungarie lifelande maye lesson vnto vsstaphylus apolo part whiche luther heresye bothe fallen awaye romaine churche romaine empire one turkes handes moscouites leaue forayne countres triall separat selues see apostolike owne domesticall affayres maye serue v sufficient example time kinge henry first banisshed pope authoritie englande kinge parliament thought though erroneously imported schisme heresy thought likewise suche sorte prouide people shoulde fall errours newe lutheran sacramentary religion kinge parliament lesse abhorred turkery issewe worlde knoweth england pitie greuously feeleth immediatly bookes came thicke abrode well lutheran zwinglian secte people fell fast contentation liking king fayne make diuers streight lawes actes parliament repressing heresy actes ad monumentes fol yea forbidde common people reading bible sate owne person iudgement vpon lamberte sacramentary neither lutheran zwinglians onely swarmed realme anabaptistes also twelue sayed anabaptistes burned aboute one tyme nowe thoughe king henrye altered matter fayth sauing primacie onely kepte constantlye catholike fayth otherwise though suppressing abbey would suffer religiouse men vowed chastitye marie yet hys death minoritye hys sonne kinge edwarde lawes made towching matter religion sauing supremacie repelled abolisshed new religion realme set forthe though religion nowe vsed much conformable yet many thinges muche diuersit e among mariage priestes colour king edwardes day acte parliament nowe haue church lawe lawe realme verie lawe godpsalm saieth vouete reddite make vowe perfourme paule saieth habentes damnationem quia primam fidem irritam fecerunt tim incurring damnation haue broken first promise againe first yeare gratious queene acte parliament making consecrating bisshoppes made kinge henrye reuiued yet bisshoppes ordered accordinge acte according acte made kinge edwarde dayes repelled quene marye reuiued sayde first yeare yf say defecte nowe supplied let yet remember parliament churche bisshoppes catholike bisshoppes ordered manner fasshion catholike church euer vsed thys considered lamented thinges wheras acte parliament geue anye sufficient warrant discharge man catholike faythe wheras yt aswel king heries dayes acte parliament euer church christendome sithens christened taken playne open heresie denie reall presence christes bodye sacramente aulter maynteining heresie acte parliamet god thancked neither king edwardes tyme tyme graciouse soueraygne ladie quene nowe yet doe men teache preache writing defend maynteine saied greate abhominable heresie many shewe warrante anye temporall spirituall lawe euer hath bene made englande countrey christendome acknovvledgeth prince supreame head beside englande lutherus contra art louauienses tom magdeb praefat cent caluinus osee et amos iacob acontius stratage satanae lib see leafe andreas modre de ecclesia lib c haue spoken shewe true haue saied neuer redresse errour heresie staie men gone vnitie see apostolike welspring fountaine vnitie catholike faith touching question supremacie haue hand wel consider shall find doe agree either protestantes selues pointe make prince supreme head churche neither agree luther selfe scholers denie primacie caluin scholers sacramentaries caluin saieth blasphemer called king henrie head church one scholers iacobus acontius booke dedicated queenes mai blameth openly ciuil magistrate maketh selfe iudge controuersies aduise commaundeth doctrine published suppressed nowe caluins scholers owne countriemen haue taken forth lesson haue auouched bookes printed publisshed world woman neither head church realme againe manie protestant though pope haue chiefe gouernement like true doctrine yet thinke meete conuenient one person ecclesiasticall maie haue supreme gouernement matter church also considered wordes othe nowe tendered mainteining prince supremacie king henry king edwardes day certaine addition greatest importance ciuil prince specially person woman wise conuenient sense applied meane wordes supreme gouernour aswell spirituall ecclesiasticall thinges cause temporall large ample wordes neither foresaied king time put othe yet bene tolerable person men capable spiritual gouernmet fro woman expresly nature scripture excluded nowe wordes saie colourable pretext excused neither inough saie iniunctions doe scripture good doctrine ecclesiastical sufficient satisfie conscience refuse especially othe doth exclude apostolical see generall councelles also though plaine wordes yet effect excluding friend standing hearing declared honorable comedacion shortly vntruth vvas suche reporte made reporte vnto seemed much mislike doubting confederate vnderstand reuolt vntruth sladerous euer feared also goe agreed vnto reason vvhereof vvhen debating betvvixt v vsinge manye shiftes amongst continuallie quarell sophistication vvordes vvill ende vve might certainlye goe forvvarde pointes materiall vvoulde vvryte position assertion fourme proposition vvhiche coulde cause doe anye vvise yee vvoulde still stande vncertainelye graunting deniyng pleasure yea althoughe better agreemente dravve suche fourme assertion gaue vvrittng vnto gathered ovvne mouthe opinion yet vvoulde yee vvise stande reste one certainelye vsed still accustomed vvrangling wadring large vvhiche behauiour muche misliked mee coulde earnestly charge vvith inconstancie yee woulde sometimes denie yee graunted also graunte yee denyed muche pressed herevvith perceiuing frovvarde quarelling vvith plaine vvoordes statute coulde lenger couer euill meaning length require vvoulde put vvri ing vvoordes othe vvith sence interpretation added thereunto considering thereuppon might deuise fourme proposition vvhereuppon might afterwarde debate may appeare bothe vntrue hitherto deliuered vnto e suche scruple writing pretende title needed haue sought proposition assertion also vntrue interpretation othe whiche wrote requeste euer sawe anye writing answere scruple stay deliuered mee writing seconde chapiter declaring way order late disputation westmynster matter effectual may seme already former answere sufficiently discharged sauing serueth accumulate increase heap horn vntruths shedule made without helpe rest proue horn may gathered ye say yea haue sone forgotte late lesso circumstance enforced yow gather according owne rule specified againe ye say fekenham answered hand nothing obiecte semed resolued maner satisfied syr cal vpon yow yet ons againe remember former rule ye straitly vaynly charged fekenham yet ye seame somwhat better aduised mollifying matter wordes maner satisfied wise yt passed al good maner honesty vntruly make reporte cotrary wel knowen neuer yelded vnto one pointe religio neither courte yet manour else haue heape vntruthes packed vp together horne haue good meaning towards fekenham making within six line vntrue slanderouse report reuolte relligion receiued professed baptisme reuolte fayth christes catholike churche reuolte al blessed sacrament vnity saide churche thereby become starke schismatike heretike horne selfe y horne good frendly meaninge towards fekenham thaketh yow nawght none hath espyed yow ye proferre muche wronge like sorte saying fekenhams frende stande yow made relation hope ye fekenhams conformity fekenha vpo reporte frend repugnant seemeth made owne head furnishe forged tale withal bene true yow according owne rule set forthe truthe thereof obseruing dewe circumstance matter person tyme place incomparably passeth farre excedeth al forsayde vntruthes ye say fekenham shrinke cofederats yow terme maliciously truely conferece made westminster euer since conceiue feare constancy religion beseach yow good syr one point religion shrinke company coference westminster matter wherin dissented whereas also hadde agreed vppon booke towching question controuersie betwene yow right honorable lord keaper great seale commaunded quene highnes name beginne reade booke first refused doe yet parte thought good disobey quenes highnes commaundemente therein thervppon offered himselfe beginne disputation lord keper would permit doe offence beseache yow hath fekenham comitted herein great worthy dashe penne shrynkinge religio cal yow defence thereof openly proferre self put forthe first argumente booke set forth sayd conference disgracing depressing catholiks dothe yet geue commendation fekenham cause aboue sayde nothing towcheth suspicion inconstancy mambring religion ye vniustly doe fyne singular inuention ons againe must plucke yow horne cal yow home owne rule demaude yow sir know yow towre fellowes haue conceiued feare proufe ye able make thereof ye haue spoken word ye haue writen ye haue set forth printe vewe sight worlde trowe good meaninge towardes fekenha yea forsothe seeth withal honorable prelate yow thus stuff farse booke heape ouersights open vntruthes might passe forth residewe horne book sauing metio noble countreymans greate constantine albeit knowe quod non sit tutum scribere contra eos qui possunt praescribere vvhye catholiks shuld borne vvithal yet matter conscience relligion wherein onely title defender faith worthy title style yet remayning highnes defendour faith disobedience matter yf thing v worthy name wherein haue said first principal obedience must wayt vpon god catholik church vniuersall churche god bothe nowe euer hath bene fonde nowe peuish owne congregation wicked blasphemous whole churche god haue preached withe chayne golde abowte neckes steade typpet preache euen highnes presence crucifixe grace hathe chappelle idoll withe red face pray yow write sint sane ipsi magistratus membra partes magdeb pref cet ciues ecclesiae dei imo vt ex toto corde sint omnes precari decet flagrent quoque ipsi zelo pietatis sed non sint caput ecclesiae quia ipsis non competit iste primatus let magistrate also member partes cytizens churche godthe lutheraa germany deny supremacie yea may behoueth v al al harte pray let feruente godly zeale religion may head churche case supremacy doth appertayne papistes trowe maister horne youre owne deare brethern magdeburge newe storie ecclesiastical would haue al worlde directed yea story whereof one parcel illiricus fellowes haue dedicated quenes maiestycent beare worlde hand true zelouse schollers luther case ye thinke testimony haue weight enowgh herke apostle luther writeth office king prince cofirme cotra artic lou tom true doctrine subiecte serue perhaps ye wil refuse reiecte bothe magdeburgenses luther mortal enemy yow sacramentarye take yow fellowes stark heretiks hard straunge case luther ca take place amoge nober euagelical brethernandreas modreuius de ecclesia lib c say yow andreas modreuiu surely one best lerned al sect lyke yow saieth ought one taken chiefe supreame head whole churche al cause ecclesiastical wel suppose wil challenge lutherane yf muste neades trust caluin greatest apostle shal beare sway yow know ye ignorante calleth blasphemer zvvinglians deny supremacy caluin c amos call kinge henry eight supreme heade churche englande handleth kinge hi selfe vilany spitefull woords neuer handled pope spitefully al title supremacy key noble booke ye blame catholikes horne yf deny supremacy head owne religion aswel lutheran zwinglias doe deny refuse nevve secte engl nd contrary al vvorlde beside vvel papistes protestant may called nonlatin alphabet laicocephali ye vvold say layheads laiehead makerso straunge kinde religion englande onely catholikes patriarch new euangelical protestant co treis v lutheran zwinglias finde frendes accompany wel point contente self horne thinke ye alredy either self many brethern like quenes supremacy neuer deale hart euer ye preted reigne also openly sharply writen brother geneua especially one anthonie gilbie whose wordes wil wel discharge matter somewhat large recite also shew iudgement whole religion well vnder king henrie procedings king homily church god woorde onelie haue ben preached made king god beleuing nothing allowed shame name turned wonte write wickednesse time murder without measure adultery incestes king lordes commones c loe maister horne howe well protestante fellowe beste race euen geneua lyketh supremacie plaine woordes saiynge title whiche stoutlye booke auouche displaceth christe owghte onely enioye whereas ye moste vntruely saye heere make pope god earth maister gilbie saieth make prince god attributing wrong title wherin christ wil haue copartener surely make god pope sometimes perhappes good man neyther yet reuerence office authoritie christe amplie honorablie gaue preseruation vnitie quietnes church wisedome like truth also appeareth call pope archeretike rome naming man woordes liberallie wantonly cast doe wel comprehend peter clement holy martyr bishop anye promise wel blowen blast hansomly handeled like finenesse call archeretike supreme iudge ouer heretikes heresy hath already iudged patriarch archeritikes wisse well might fellon barre westmynster hall saue life mighte call iudge strongest theef doubtles prince side plea good youres ye say would haue pope raigne quenes place procedeth fro lik truth ad wisedom albeit pope autority euer chief matter eccleastical yet neuer much noddie say ad beleue pope raigned pope king beig euer two distinct person farre different one seueral function administration yet wel concurrant coincident togeather without imminution one others authoritie wel ye wil perhap say albeit gilbie misliketh title prince yet liketh wel meaning restreyning supreme gouernment queenes maiesty onely cause temporal cause thing ecclesiasticall th distinction commeth late vvil doe ease kindes cause haue already graunted vnto supreme gouernmet verily think persuaded conscience vvheruppon offer receiue corporal othe vpon euangelistes graunt passed fro vvords ouer al maner persones borne vvithin dominion vvhat estate either ecclesiastical temporal euer graunt vnto highnes thouly supreme rule ouer lay ecclesiastical personnes haue also concluded therevvith cause ecclesiastical temporal vvhich plainly firmely proued argument follovving supreme gouernour ruler one vvho hath ouersee guyde care prouide order directe thing vnder gouernment rule ende vntruthe actios belongig properly thing gouerned belo ging properly gouernour end action vvhich appointed doe properly belonge subiect thing gouerned euery gouernment rule thre thing necessarely cocurrat gouernor subiect mattier gouerned obiect mattier vvherabout vvherein gouernement occupied doth consiste quenes highnes ovvne confession supreme gouernour ouer al manner persones ecclesiastical borne vvithin dominion ergo highnes thonely supreme gouernour ouer vvhich appointed doe properly belong ecclesiastical persones vvhich thing cause ecclesiastical chapter prince supreme gouernours ouer al ecclesiastical person subiects yet al ecclesiastical matter first worshipfull reason cause marueyle fekenham shoulde writing presently offer selfe receiue othe neuer made mention anie suche othe neither suche anye tyme required surelye greate cause wonder see gose goe barefote nowe hee playe worthye logician fekenham wil nil shalbe driuen fyne force logical definition graunte quene supreme head al cause ecclesiasticall graunteth supreame heade al person bothe ecclesiastical temporal saieth supreame gouernour ruler ordereth directeth al action belonging appointed subiects ad therby inferreth quenes maiesty supreame onely gouernour euen action belonge chief gouermente thig gouerned action may way properly belong subiect thing gouerned horn saith action belonge ende whereunto gouernour tendeth may wel althowgh haue chief gouerment al action thing father maister dwel city maior also father maisters cheif gouernour thing concerning ciuil gouernment city al prince chief supreame gouernour subiects otherwise prince doth intermedle father office respect subiect price ad lawes true price supream gouernour al person aswel spiritual teporal therfore also supreame gouernour al action wil follow action rehersed yea much lesse better vnderstanding end final respect ciuil commewelth vnder regimet one moe person multitude comitteh theself ordered ruled preserue theselues al inward outwarde iniuries oppression enimies prouide saftie ad quietnes effectually take place supreame gouernement haue onlesse selfe spirituall man man master shippe neuer mariner maior neuer citizen principall gouernemente reasteth ciuill matter respecte haue sayed supreame gouernour person realme al action suche sense haue specified least action spirituall men especially appropriate onlesse selfe spiritual wherfore haue two vntruths one vntrue definitio saiyng prince supreme gouernour al cause spiritual yea eue peculiarly belonging spiritual men beside plaine cotradiction horne directly ouerthrowing assertion herefol bisshoply rule gouernement god churche saith horne consisteth three point feed church god woord minister christes sacramets ad bind lose gouern church saith sort belogeth oly office bishop ad church minister ad king quenes prince lyke hath warde owne confession action properly belog ecclesiastical person price said cofessio hauing nothing therwith true prince supreme head ad gouernor cause ecclesiastical ye properly belog person offence augustine witnes thereof saith ille qui hominem prouocat ad iuratione c doth prouoke man swere knoweth shal forswere selfe worse murderer murderer sleeth body sleeth soule one soule two soule prouoketh periurie owne soule also ministring occasion therof point othe whereunto presently swere without plaine manifest periurie foure following horne mutato nomine de te fabula narraturas whiche goeth couertlie vttered manie vntruthes althoughe sometime yee stoumble trueth againste youre rest fal plaine manifest vntruths least men shuld perceiue neuer required svvere therfore impudent kind dealing saie vvherunto presently required swere c none authoritie comission require othe neither might tender vnto without peril mie selfe comitted vnto honorable coucel without whose order could attempt suche mattier haue alreadie shevved plaine matter although plainnesse speache thinke persvvaded coscience highnes supreme gouernour well cause ecclesiastical temporal hauing supremacie ouer ecclesiastical person othervvise person ecclesiastical respect ecclesiastical function thing cause annexed proprelie beloging ecclesiastical person shee hath supremacie ouer person ecclesiastical function thing cause matter obiect wherabout wherein rule ouer ecclesiasticall persone occupied dothe consiste seemeth glorie amongst friendes make mee offer receiue parte othe shall able declare meanes maie svvere without committing plain manifeste periurie abilitie better apeareth none al mine abilitie herein shal appeare mine ansvvere foure point god make readie perform duty sake ye wil seme readie offer wherbie purchase selfe glorious estimation wherfore make offer vnto either woord writing al time aboad mee pla e novve returne vntruth tovver fekenhas hold holdeth holde parliament came oute tovver vvhen savve end parliament vnderstood right well othe like tendred vnto sent copy booke deuised aunsvvere touching othe abroad friendes declare constancie readines refuse othe wherebie thei might rather enduced continue good opinion conceiued also paie charge weekelie tovver sent vnto vntruth quenes highnes vvordes tovver testifie contrary euerie saturdaie seruaunt wrote deliuered copy abroade tolde selfe nowe returned againe tower perceiuing friend gaue iust cause haue heape slaunderous railing vntrute mistrust reuolte wauering inconstancie whereby estimation fame seruice god bellie decaied haue deuised set abroade selfe booke againe selfe ende altering chaunging nothing sauing haue geuen nevve name title seeme place though yee spake mee woordes l c vvhen deed neuer suche woorde spoken writen mee booke deliuered mee speache directed commissioner word vvhen ye quenes highnes comissioners shalbe able c fifth chapter priuate doings betwene fekenham horne yet one againe horne taketh hande fekenhas graut may wel grauted ad great cuning skilfulnes wil thereof inferre may graunted nowe spitteth hande taketh faster holde thinketh seing lightnes former reason would geue greater weight newe fetch yet light weake employing manifest contradiction answered albeit man called ecclesiasticall person respecte churche cause function freely graunt horne yet neuer whit nearer purposehovve spirituall man vnderneath prince ad hovv vnlesse ca proue also respecte shoulde vnder prince cause ecclesiastical haue said subiect also laie men member beside ciuil common welth consideration whereof prince hath doe properlie spirituall man though bothe respectes cocurrant one person named worthyer robert horne laie man painter queene properlye hathe dooe painter vnlesse lawe order concerninge painter robert horne highnes subiecte borne vnder obeisance queene haue also doe yea case yee true bishop winchester proprely bishop bishoply function whiche ye immediatlye vnder archebishop pope considering subiect otherwise bishop either touching temporalty farder true bishop also doe prince homage reason man haue saied hathe remoued prince superioritie concerninge mere bishoply priestly function notable contradiction hath full worshipfully cocluded selfe eased fekenham also taking othe quene supreame head al cause temporal spiritual remayneth residew nothing greatlye answered shew horn doth accumulate huge heap vntruths notig fekeha impudent kind dealing writing whereunto presently required sweare may truely verefied seing horne self confesseth yt write copy haue bene deliuered commissioner tyme haue presently tendred fekenham othe forme fasshion delyuered hornean heap vntruthes vvherevvith fekenham falslie charged nothing altred later copy worde commissioner turned lorde bisshop winchester neither doth fekenham saye whereunto required presently sweare l saieth afterward l shalbe able c therefore maner impudency vntruthe matter euer yt matter nothing apperteyning state principal questio smal importaunce nothing deseruing noted impudet dealig rather kind speach agreeth horn dealing folowig speaketh fekenha without regarde loosely lewdely saye maketh belly god freds mistrusted reuolting wauering incostacy sent foorth copy book horn termeth shedule sawe othe tendred lyke nowe false tale dewe circustaces ye nedelessely required fekenha necessarie haue bene obserued yow suerly rest true ye write seruante charge wekely defrayde freds brought seruate farre vnderstande stark false doe ye pray blinde fonde folishe false ghesses surmise make tale apparate cowlorable clothing couenient dew circumstance ye much harpe vppon fekenham ye blindly lewdly harping vpo revolte slaunder deface ye say sent copy vnderstode right wel othe like tendered proue ye good sir catholiks made certain accompte end parliament othe haue ben offred cause exacted certainly know great plague immediatly reigned raged london pray god plague punish straunge procedings parliament holy church put v remembraunce greater plague imminete hanging ouer v world onlesse repent special order goodnes mercy quenes maiesty tel well woteafter god plague horne beganne plage gramercy sir sore thirsted loged catholiks bloud therfore sone god plague ceased thought haue self plaged catholiks exactig othe doctour bonner bisshop lodon lo began fellowes protestant bisshops wonderful plague scourge throwgh seking calling man othe matter meruelously fel ye felowes ye church bisshops whose authority ye forsaken defied also parliament bisshops vpo pitiful case state honour worship bisshoply authority yea faith al restethe dependeth meruelouse prouidence god ye could contente spoile true bisshops wordly estate honor must nedes haue poore lyfe al self founde bisshops statute realme lette thinges passe herken maister horne blaste diuision pag b fekenham first must booke othe vtterlye testifie queenes highnes onely supreme gouernour realme aswell spirituall ecclesiasticall thinges cause temporall testifie thinge vppon booke othe man may possiblye therein auoide periury except doe first know thing doth testifie whereof beareth witnesse geueth testimonye touching knowledge queenes maiesty onely supreme gouernour aswell spirituall ecclesiastical cause teporal besides haue knowledge know way meane whereby shoulde haue knowledge thereof therefore part testifie vppon booke othe beinge without deede al knowledge cannot without committinge plaine manifest periury herein shal ioyne issue l whe l shalbe able either order gouernment sauiour christe left behinde gospel new testament either writing learned doctours olde new haue age age witnessed order ecclesiastical gouernmente christes churche either general councels wherein righte order ecclesiastical gouernement christes church hath beene faithfully declared shewed time time elles continual practise like ecclesiasticall gouernment one church part christendom vvhan lordshippe shal able fower meanes make proufe vnto emperour empresse king quene may claym take vpon gouernmet spiritual ecclesiastical cause shal herein yelde humble thankes reken selfe well satisfied shal take vppon knowledge thereof ready testifie vppon booke othe horne reason argument moueth testifie vpon book othe q supremacy cause ecclesiastical man may testifie othe thing vvhereof ignorant knovveth nothig vvithout committig periury neither knovv q highnes onely supreme gouernour asvvel cause ecclesiasticall temporall neither yet knovv vvay meane vvhereby haue knovvledge thereof therefore testifie vppon booke othe vvithout committing plaine manifest periury ansvveare minor seconde proposition argument although might plainly deny vvithout knovvledge vtterly ignoraunt matter vvay meane hovv come knovvledge therof put prouf vvherein knovv must needes faile yet vvil ansvveare plain negatiue thom aquin quaest de malo distinctio diuisio ignorace better excuse declare vvhat sort ignoraut vvithout al knovvledge three kind ignorates one simplicity vvilfulnes thirde malice first sort canot haue longe time good oportunity much occasio many vvaies vvhereby come knovvledge hereof yea haue knovve profest openly deede vvorde knovvledge hereof many yeers together vntruthe man knovv vvhich true knovv acknovvledge confesse supreme authority cause ecclesiastical king hery eight heyres vvha abbay euesha como cosent moks vnder couent seale vvas ovvn good vvilles vvithout compulsion surrendred handes authority refourmed forsooke rablement vntruth folishe vovve many vntruth slaunderous reprochful horrible errours superstition monkery became secular priest chaplaine bell aftervvarde bonner duringe life king henry eight agnise professe teach opely sermos king supremacy cause ecclesiastical knovvledge remained stedfastly al time kinge edvvard also although vvere tovver time vvas doubt made supremacy stil agnised point religio vntruth cause enprisonment shall appeare touchig ministratio sacramets vvhervnto also agreed last promised professe preach ope auditory whersoeuer apointed vntruthe sladerous vvas deliuered vpon promise recantatio disputed vvithal vvherupo right vvorshipful gentleman procured deliuerace forth tovver vvere liberty neuer mecioning dout matter agnising pri ce supremacy cause ecclesiastical vvherfore may safly say ignorace vvat knovvledge vvhich pretend minor propositio siplicity therfore must nedes vvilfulnes malice mixt vvay meane vvherby haue ignorauce remoued assigne vvith issue vvhe proue vnto fovver meanes emperour empresse king quene may take vpo gouernmet spiritual ecclesiastical cause vvil yeelde take vpo knovvledge thereof ready testifie booke othe truely haue often many time proued require self meanes sort vnto nothing saye contrarie yet neuerthelesse continue still vvilfull malicious ignorance vntruthe mere slau derous may vvel appere booke sapien vvhich causeth feare sentence holy ghost vvilbe verified maleuolam animam non introibit sapientia yet vvil one proue desire euen vvere putting remembraunce thing vvhich occasion conference often many time reported vnto vvhereof knovv simply ignoraunt chapter defending fekenham others wilful malitious ignorance taking othe fekenham horne come cople ioyne together principal matter fekenham first saieth neither knoweth kid supremacy horn auowcheth yet way achiue obtain knowledge horne saith might well put fekenham prouf ignorat way trow meritoriouse supererogation one fearing ieberdy aduentureth prouf fekenham ignorant supremacy binde fekenham deaper exceding kindnesthe getle louig ha te horn wil shew fekenhams better excuse gentle louing hart fekenham ignorat simplicity wilfulnes plain malice touching threfolde ignorance horne alleaged bookes thomas tho aqui de malo quast wil stycke distinction onlesse proue thomas otherwise ignorace surmised supremacy includeth wilfulnes malice fekenham like parson distinction may true cause neuer deale furthered suerly yf ther ignorance point thomas cal inuincicle ignorance study diligence able put away therfore pardonable authour brought forth horn fully effectually dischargeth fekenham al thre chargeth horne worste three wilfulnes malice shal winne smal worship alleaging thomas opusc contra errores graecorum osteditur etia quod subesse romano po tifici sit de necessitate salutis thomas saieth plainly obliged bound vpon paine euerlasting damnation belieue pope supreme head whole church leaste horne may reiecte authority wel doe vsing yt late latin writer much affectioned pope thomas proueth assertion cyrill maximus two notable auncient writer amonge grecian wherfore foloweth neither fekenham horn christia man know contrary euident daungerouse falshod importeth eternal damnation nay saith horn fekenha pretende ignorance herein aswel king henry king edward dayes set forth open sermon supremacy doe yow good horne yet none ignorant farder knowledge amog also maister fekenham caried away violence comon storm tempest first many couocation grated agnise king supremacy quatenus de iure diuino far thei might god law knowen clearly stand itthough iustlye abrogate act parliament whereas ye insult vpon fekenham one entangled wrapped common error would thereof enforce vpon knowledge said error woulde haue perseuere one againe fall quite ouer eares dirtie dong filthie schisme heresie ye worke vnskilfully vngodlye good counsaile might finde place harde stony hart would pray god mollifie ye would fekenham hartilie repet great offence schisme heresie doubt doth hath done followe peter denyed christluc exiuit fleuit amare went wepte ful bitterlie surely whereas ye imagine ye haue coference proued matter fekenha nothing saye contrarye nothing lowde lewde lye vppon easelye appeareth seeinge long trauaile wherein yee haue moste vttered skill ye farre full answering scruple staiesm feke ha cofirmed vvas euen horne booke seeme plainlye vnaunswerable selfe quite ouerborne ouerthrowen owne argument induction shal hereafter euidently declare nowe fekenham may seeme haue good cause much rest sayed stayes scruple may let passe horne cal ecclesiastical mat euen christ sauiour vntruth place matth maketh nothing prince supreme gouernement ecclesiasticall thing matth confirmed authoritie commaunding men attribute geue vnto caesar vvhich belongeth vnto admonishing notvvithstanding al prince people caesar authority infinit vvithout limit authority belogeth king al king bounded circumscribed vvithin boundes assigned god vvorde vvill vvorde vnderstanded vvhen euer speake povver prince stapleton horne goeth yet nedelessely foreward proue christ destroy rule prince churche cause figured olde lawe length catcheth one testimonie new ecclesiasticall authoritye prince doth much inferre ought pay much tribute prince may paie question framed captious iewes whether ought whether might lawfully paie tribute caesar whiche externall infidell prince horne say woordes importe precise necessitie shall haue muche doe excuse italian frenchman spaniardes nation many hundred yeares haue paid tribute caesar pray horne haue defalked curtailed christes aunswere haue set forth whole entier sentencethe place mat maketh rather quite horn fol geue caesar belongeth caesar god belongeth god later clause assured doth much take away supreme regiment al cause ecclesiastical necessarily force wordes binde v paie yea tribute prince wil ye see happeneth hosius great learned godly bishoppe spaine horne selfe calleth euen verye place proueth emperour constantius telleth face nothing doe matter ecclesiasticall whose woordes shall haue occasion hereafter rehearse yea ambrose also vseth authoritie represse like vsurped authoritie valentinian yonger amb li ep ill happe hath horne euen first authoritie new testament extraordinarie impertinentlie tell howe chopped cause leaues boke lie make mouster shew nowe whereas place serueth nothing authoritie ecclesiasticall prince least preeminent peerlesse authoritie cause ecclesiasticall horne fansieth yet least man borne doune great weight mightie proufe thinke prince power infinite horne amende inconuenience greate gentlenes thought good preuent mischief admonish reader therof meaning place geaue infinite authoritie without limites onely bounded circumscribed within boundes god worde least ye mistake would vnderstanded al solemnitie foolish friuolous admonitio without cause groud ad grouded vpo horn fantistical imaginatio vpon christ surmiseth willeth geauen caesar caesar god god determineth expresseth nothing geuen caesar paiement money yet consider haue saied question demaunded doth determine neither though thing selfe moste true howe admonition serueth maister horne brother manye necessarye purpose rule maister prince pleasure often doings like may freely disobey say god word wherof interpretation referre selues farre serueth moste zealouse nowe prince though supreme gouernour iudge al cause ecclesiastical may god worde appointe much surplesse cope worne churche priestlike decent apparell worne otherwise yea haue already spoken haue found way god woorde doctrine correct church bishop faile duetie yea consider doctrine selfe yet afterward writeth matter either recanteth better aduised el writeth plaine contrary selfe thus saieth ciuile magistrate ciuile power hath passed bound limites one bishop leontius said constantius emperour thou set gouerne one matter takest vpon thee matter function magistrate confounded woordes see horne melanchthon taketh away authoritie prince iudging determining doctrine wil haue function magistrate spiritual temporal confoundednovvel fol yea nowel himselfe great stomach biddeth v shew deny godly learned priestes might according god woorde iudge sincerity doctrine though prince successours made supreme gouernours without limitation fal often bisshop neuer lerned godly shall one admitted iudge true doctrine except doctrine please prince though ben statute made declaring enacting quenes yea highnes successours without exception limitation godly vngodly yet trowe bisshops supreme gouernour thinges cause well spiritual temporal though horne writen bothe table prince hath authority erect correct farther restrayne allow punishe vertues vice thereto appertayning though gouernour al cause also iudge cause though commonly taken vnderstanded thousand englande haue taken othe g eat damnation repet therefore horne talke confusely generally prince authority table doe yet say nothing proue nothing general absolute authority al thinges cause lustely without exception othe expresseth therefore bring dede nothig proue principal purpose al proufes directed againe alleage augustin worde godlynes metioned paule timothe shoulde meane true chief proper worship god though prince hauing charg therof also haue authority appoint worship yet paule speaketh authority al prince onely peasible gouernmet subiects minister vnto augmenting common weale might say seruaunts subiects al thing may liue godly religious conuersation becommeth godly one garnish common weale honour hauing care co uenient diligently prouiding one care like sorte also trauaile earnestly thing aboue reast ecclesiasticall state may remaine sure bothe suche sort seemely god honour fitte time may continue tranquilitie general counsayles vvherein ye affirme right order ecclesiastical gouernment christ church hath faithfully declared shevved tyme tyme stapleton hitherto haue brought one thing substantial prouf purpose worth good strawe neither scripture doctour emperour among fowre emperours named ye haue iugled one stark heretik subtily ye thought ye hadled matter ye haue craftely coueyed galles ye espied yet one thing ye comended ye would seame frame certain fixed state matter debated vpo ad ye would seme direct proufs ye wil bring therin deale v better hitherto ye haue done seaming seke dark generality corner luske lurke neither yet walke ye plainly ad truely ye woulde seme great darknes scose dymme light reader haue clere vew sight right way ye walke dark sconse ye leade farre awrie thus obscurely shewed farre reader concealing maner thing concerneth bishop authoritie matter first tell v eusebius constantine councell nice sate seat golde placed first beginning rowes euseb li cap de vita constant theodor li c leaue modica small seate theodoret also calleth nonlatin alphabet sitting middest low seate conceale also whiche eusebius alleaged author place addeth non prius ea sedit quam annu ssent episcopi sate downe bishop geauen leaue importeth word nonlatin alphabet vsed eusebius theodoret also declareth well bishop superioritie councell matter faithe treated nowe adde theodoret emperoure geue bisshops leaue consult c theodoret place alleaged hath wordes imagine like bishop emperoure suche licence english statute require conuocation shall make ecclesiasticall lawe without king consent constantine demeaned selfe stately haue heard behauiour shal heare yet farder next vntruth say themperour prescribed rule whereby shoulde measure trye discusse disputation c say vntruely immediately wordes alleaged shew therby emperours rule prescription theodoret addeth thing like vttered naturall louing child priestes father child prescribe rule father geue good counsail also constantine prescribe rule bishop say childish consider horne like babe ye haue reasoned authority blessed father father holy learned councell verely ambrose knew trow better done nicene councel horne doth somewhat credite reporteth farre otherwise costantines doings horne couterfeiteth thus saith ambros lib epist pray horne marke saiyng wel si co ferendu de fide saderdotum debet esse ista collatio sicut factu est sub costantino augustae memoriae principe qui nullas leges ante praemisit sed liberum ded iudiciu sacerdotibus conferece must faith coference ought kept priest done time costantine prince noble memory whe cotrouersy faith sprog vp prescribe lawes left priestes free iudgemet determination yet saith horne costantine prescribed bisshops rule wherby measure trye discusse controuersie hande wherin obserue diligently gentle reader ambrose direct contrary horne touching particular fact constantine one saiyng tha prescribed hand lawes left bishop triall controuersie free auouching prescribed rule trie discusse matter also touching whole estate question betwene horne fekenham ambrose wil haue conference trial faith appertain priest chiefly onely wordes spake yong valentinian seduced minoritie late soueraine king edwarde would haue matter faith tried palaice benche matter faithe nowe parliamente concluded contrarywise horne haue supreme iudgement matter faith ecclesiasticall sixth chapter valentinian emperour stapleton valentinian emperour commeth good time meane proue primacy horne quite ouerthrowe made expresse lawe ecclesiastical matter ecclesiasticall men iudge ambrose witnesseth expressely epistle wrote younge valentinian man sonne forme law causa fidei vel ecclesiastici alicutus ordinis eum iudicare debere ambr lib epist qui nec munere impar sit nec iure dissimilis haec enim verba rescripti sunt hoc est sacerdotes de sacerdotibus voluit iudicare cause faith ecclesiastical order iudge neither office vnequall neither right vnlike word rescript wil haue priestes iudge ouer priestes thus ambrose plainely expressely one sentence quyte ouerturneth al horne supremacy yea farre emperour al gouernment ouer priestes matter ecclesiastical euen matter ciuil temporal woulde suffer priestes called ciuil court thus foloweth immediatlye ambrose quinetiam si alias quoque argueretur episcopus morum esset examinanda causa ibidem etiam hanc voluit ad episcopale iudicium pertinere yea farder bisshop otherwise accused matter behauyour outwarde demeanor examined matter also would belong iudgement bisshops beholde gentle reader supreme gouernor al cause spiritual temporal ouer priest bisshops horne hath brought forth verily one ciuil cause refuseth gouernment ouer comm unded ambrose consecrated bisshop millayn saieth horne election prescribed themselues liking misliking emperours purpose done commaundeth eche sect vntruthe reasoning al proueth vvhit spiritual supremacy theodosius declare faieth vvritinge bringe vnto appointeth daye vvhereat came emperoure commaunded deliuered vnto fourmes faieth vvritinge vvhen emperoure sedules handes maketh earneste praier vnto god assistace holy spirite may discern truth iudge rightly redde al condemneth heresy arians eunomians renting sedules sundre alovveth confirmeth faith homousians heretiks departed ashamed dasht countenance chapter theodosius first dealing cause ecclesiasticall stapleton theodosius greater care true religio ye haue slader hinder ita heap lie gathered together one story theosius notable lying al thing set parte appere heape lye story one emperour ye gather together first ye call flauian godly bisshop antioche albeit stode stowtly defence catholike faith suffred much yet respecte alleaged godly one came bisshoprike againste canon contrarye othe taken woulde neuer take vppon bisshop antioche paulinus lyuing ministring meanes occasio greate schisme church continued many yeares cause arabian cyprian aegiptians theophilus patriarche alexandria west churche pope damasus socra lib cap theo li cap sozo li cap vide amb epist tripart li cap siricius anastasius would receiue hi comunio neither could setled quietly ad receiued bisshop vntil recociled hiself pope fault forgeue purpose sente rome solepne ambassade appereth lyne ye adioyne freshe lie bisshop rome falsly accuse many crime layde lesse crime al world beside periury schisme though ye would droppe lie lie whetstone ye adde supreame authority set peace quietnes church matter shufflig supreame lyig authority word supreame authority theod lib cap pope primacy proued euen horne ovvne storye reconciliation pope neither author theodoretus hath yea directly contrary declaratio theodoretus verye chapter alleaged reciteth ambassade speake good argumet pope supremacy may added exaples doctor harding myne return c agaist iewel matter recociliatio fauorable themperour al emperours supremacy emperour commauded hi go rome recociled one foure patriarch flauianus fayn also desire theophilus bisshop alexandria sende body pope damasus pacifie ad mollifie anger ad pardo hi sent isidorus purpose haue said flauianus hiself afterward sent acatius others ambassadours acatius pacified schismes cotinued yeres restored author theodoret saith peace church pace saith ecclesiis restituit word though theodoretus doth speake theperor theodo yet speaketh like acati ye guilefully apply theodosi oly ad falsely conclude therof theodosi therfore supreme head church reason acati also supreme head church foloweth horn narratio certain coucels holde vnder theodosi disorderly cofusely vnperfectly lyingly hadled may wel woder maketh two coucels kepte costatinople three wheras ad al one beig secod famouse general coucel ad properly cal coucell third none rather conference talke first coucel telleth v called saith electe ad order bisshop sea costantinople socra lib cap theod lib cap gre ni vita greg nazianzen nicep lib cap case ca proue distincted councels cou cel general secode lengthe sette bisshoply see worthy meletius bisshop antioche whole nober bisshops assebled general cucell though dede longe enioye voluntarily much good emperours mynde gaue ouer auoyde schisme grewe vppon election whome nectarius horne speaketh chosen sozom li cap nonlatin alphabet theod lib cap nonlatin alphabet tyme vnbaptized chosen emperour horne saieth bisshops though meruailed emperours needes make vppe heape yea therefore might lawfullye haue infringed annichilated election sauing bore good graciouse emperour tendred christes church faith tenderlye euen melchiades rehearsed bore good constantin may adde also heape ye woulde inferre soueraynety theodosius father general councel desired confirme decree canon mighty great copiouse argumente throughout booke fewe word easie answered auoyded kind confirmation euer requiredvvhye end emperours confirme lawes churche though ordinaunces voyde frustrate without al ye doe haue shal doe synodes conuocations without ratification quenes maiesty thig decree churche ye doe ye haue euer shal able proue ende emperours required confirme councels willing towarde people might haue better lyking allured carefully exactly obserue vpon good lyking prince withal frowarde malignate people make great accompte censure churche yt doth presently touche body temporal losse might feare ciuil temporall punishement brought soner keepe obserue litle short true answere ye shal neuer al cuning honestly shift may suffice euacuate emptye great part boke resting point shew place one alhovve emperor haue may deale generall coucels emperor haue deny iustly vnto proue graunte shewe selfe slender scholer weake aduersary take vpon confute practise limites condition knowe altogether fight darkenesse owne shadowe proue deny lette truthe goe side neither haue booke neither shall euer able proue auoyde therefore hereafter superfluyte vnfruteful talke well myne reader ease al like obiections emperours calling confirming councels wil referre answeres distinction presently made returne nowe theodosius horne haue one vntruthe charge withal would establishe peerlesse supreme authority theodosius hauing receiued writinge faith wel catholikes eunomians arians heretiks reading rented shedules sauing deliuered catholiks whereupon heretikes departed ashamed dashte countenauce whome ye also write examined faith sorte astonyed began fall amoges themselues lyking mislykig emperours purpose ala good horne whie ye self nowe ye seame sodenly dasshed countenance yea whiche maruayle harde metall thinketh somwhat asshamed wonderfullye astonied withall man pluck vp harte good cowrage wil perchaunce say borde yowe sette vpon mery pynnes woulde god matter suche yt myght better lawghed pitied might serue democrytus one euer lawhed euer wepte heraclytus yet say truth cause muche bothe perchaunce nowe wil think doe ieste speake shame would god yt myght ons truelye sayde youe yt goodly sparcle grace growing wel put me iudgement ye dashed countenance yea ye wonderfully astonied horne lesse astonied telling storie aria heretiks vvere vvhe thing vvas euen cause maner arians heretikes dare say proue yt arians asshamed dasshed countenaunce vpo doinges theodosius onely much yowe asshamed dasshed countenaunce whose heresy codemned many king catholyke emperours yf ye say ye asshamed must replie shamelesse fellowe impudente arians nowe adde ye astonied arrians heretikes facte theodosius therfore full slylie wylilye doinges emperour ye haue ouerhipped whyche yf ye put would haue serued aswel againste yowe yt againste therfore memorie yt astonied yowe ye durst shame name matter yet folly coulde ye forbeare patche yt speciall matter aduauncyng supreamacy first vvhy horne hath lefte principal matter ovvn storye tanquam cauis bibes nil chapter theodosius second ephesine councell third generall stapleton followeth emperour supreme head churche well calling firste general councell ephesus also ordering gouerning lieutenaunt yf horne shew decree determination matter faithe ecclesiastical matter made theodosius deputy somewhat sheweth thing shew matter al ordering gouerning concerning externall outward matter see al thing done quietly orderly ciuile punishment correct disobey councel matter spirituall gouernement let v consider particularity calling ephesine councel emperour theodosius yet request cyrillus patriarch alexandria niceph li c emperours owne authoritie horne setteth foorth word geuing streight commaudement al bi hop wheresoeuer faile appeare though emperour peremptorily cited summoned prince ciuile magistrate doe cite subiectes ciuil matter whereas history nicephorus alleaged geueth forth token peremptory comma dement rather contrary emperour letter whereby summoned niceph li c addeth reason threat would draw backe qui enim vocatus non alacriter accurrit non bonae conscientiae esse apparet whosoeuer called hasteneth verely appereth haue euill conscience woordes rather chargeth conscience god loyal obedience iosaphat priestes leuits olde law hath ben shewed2 paral neither vseth threat force commaundement expresse much ynckling gloriouse supremacye horne would faine finde againe vide cyril epist tom ordering gouerning call councell ioannes come emperours lieutenaunte suche cyrillus al catholique bishoppes councell complained firste made true relatio emperour councel done laboured haue iohn antioche confederate reduced communion holy councel hauing broke canon request councell resisted plainlye saiyng possible force v hereto except haue done canon disanulled also become humble suppliauntes councell suche whiche haue offended iohn lieutenant could winne purpose way force authority whiche bishop acknowledged none matter synodicall concluded decreed went sleight compasse desired geue writing confession faith saied cause subscribe therevnto agree saieth councel might make vaunte say haue brought bisshops attonement conciliaui eos ad amicitia humanis inter se offensis dissidentes exponimus no contumeliae variaunce among selues vpon worldly displeasure councell espiyng replied againe woulde geue world occasion reproche shame co fession faithe required answered called hither heretikes come hither restore faith hath bene despised also restore emperour hath nede nowe lerne faith knoweth wel enough hath bene baptised thus see ordering gouerninge whiche horne cause dependeth vpon lieutenat emperour mere tyranical violece godly emperours accustomed vse horne auoucheth constantine nicene coucel theodosius man grandfather councell aquileia cyrill vbi supra tyrannicall gouernment cyrillus whole synod writeth thereof thus greate vexation kept guardes souldiars yea hauing beddes side slepe specially saith cyrillus whole councell beside much weried vexed many dead many also hauing spent doe sell necessary lo honorable gouernement horne supreame headm horne groudeth primacye vpon doeings iohn schismatical bisshop force armes extort cosent gouernour would great turke souldan ruled againe suche rough paterns please verye well rough rude prelate simile habent labra lactuca wheras therfore calleth emperour theodosius verie godlie emperour seing calleth godly place respect action hereafter rehearsed lewd naught hathe shall yet better appeare plaine vntruth donec poenitetia agatis et anathematisetis haeretica capitulum quae cyrillo alexadrino episcopo exposita sunt cotra euangelicam catholicam doctrinam liberatus cap euer thinges therefore either shoulde haue forborne call least place shoulde haue founde better matter haue practised supremacie vpon al maister horne declaration resteth defended iohn bishoppe antiochia fewe confederate fautours nestorius councell condemned whoe made cyrillus residew ephesine father two hundred number heretiks called doings hereticall euidentlye appeareth selfe authour chapter horne taketh helpe ayde sweete vnsauery declaration wythall calleth thys ihon godlye man wandering circumstaunces leaueth owte thys least godlye reader might sone suspecte thys primacye standynge vppon better grounde yet horne saye theodosius practised supremacy first earle candidianus deputiethe cause vvhy horn taketh theodosius supreme head emperours behalfe inhibited cyril procede til comming iohn patriarche antiochia said iohn condemned cyril memnon deposed bishopriks emperour confirmed iohns sentence thirdly seing dissension betwixt cyril iohn grow comaunded agree otherwise would depose banish last iohn cited answere pope legate would come said looked prince answere said cause ansvveredbut thing neither seuerally iointly force first candidianus doings ye see goe externall moderation disposition order councels doings whiche haue saide one point emperours dealing councelles church best sonne supreme gouernour thereof secondarily emperoure deposed cyrill schismaticall assemble iohn cosociates nu ber liberatus writeth cap contrary minde al residue whose sentence though wrongfully geuen theodosius sinistrally affected seduced doth confirme wherein principall worker executour sentence thirdly emperour threatned deposition depriuation banishment spirituall ciuile punishment impertinente matter therefore adde would depose ye glosar liberatus cap good glosar pope brother molineus liberatus author hath word saieth threatened sende nicomedia banishment last al iohn beinge ad vpholde emperour meruaile yf woulde appeare pope legatproufes pope primacy taken ephesine councell horne ovvne author prosper chronic euang li cap nicep lib cap con lorses et chal syn act pagina le ine confe sed presidente ephsine cou cel tvvo emperours pro mar vide act coc chal thought codemned felo good wil would appere king bech would refuse yf might assisted therin yet ordinary ad lawful cowrt withstading though hundred refuse wel sir ye haue spet empted proufs vpholding theodosius primacy wherin ye work lyke one taking vppon guyde night woulde put candle torch conducte lanterne let v syde see yf fetche better light aswel euen owne author doings owne councell owne emperour bishop pope ecclesiastical primacy say head presidete councel celestinus pope steade foresayde ciril emperour deputie vpo certayne truthe ecclesiastical writer aswel latin greke vniformely agree yea whole councel yt self ephesus agniseth coelestine theire presidente head appeareth nexte general councel chalcedo shortly folowing ephesin coucels letter emperour theodosius self emperour valentinian least ye thinke spirituall men councels encroched muche vppon emperours iurisdiction iniury ye apologie iewel bretherne complayne lo themperour marcianus emperour iustinian open proclamation plainly professe pope coelestine deputy cyril president cou cel pro iusti edict eius tom co cil horn primacye destroied ovvne author trow horne lanterne light shut vp darke dymme horne good torche light rather fayre bright light sonne selfe case al serue turne wil drawe somwhat nearer euen owne author owne emperour yea owne wordes proue intente trust ye wil fully satisfied maister horne writeth multos hoc mundo reges esse non esse vnum sicut papa est super ecclesia mundi totius many king world one king whole pope onely gouernor ouer church throughout whole world surely authour liberatus hereby appeareth well iewels great errour liberatus breuiar cap tom co pag iewels errour reply fol horne noteth author ad chapter declaration ad vvhy euag lib cap nowelles affirming stoutely assuredly one man haue rule whole church whole world liberat writer xi c yers past reporteth assertio spoke holy bisshop emperor iustinia ad yet accopted therfore neither foolish wicked begane narratio dissentio cyrillus iohns memory truth fayled whe ye lefte author ye toke ad chapter perchauce ye astonied heretiks theodosius eue place author sheweth coelestin presidet coucel deputy cyrill gaue instructios informatios letter demeane hi self nestorius prescribeth certain order doings therfore cyril self tyme pronounce final sentece depriuatio nestorius saieth forced therto coelestinus letter geuing sentece cyrillus gaue sentence agaist nestori celestin cyril epi tom cyril epi proued horne theodosius hi self themperor supreame head matter ecclesiastical horn ovvn example also candidinian turned agaist hi cap satis euidenter distin neither theperor lieutenant thing either allowing disallowing ad wil proue vnto eue supreme head theodosius writig cyrillus vt perturbatio quae ex cotrouersiis istis accidit secudu ecclesiasticos canones dissoluatur hurly burly cotrouersies religio might pacified quieted according ecclesiastical canos ecclesiastical cano ending determinatio matter spirituall apperteyneth clergy ad layty also answere take hadfast thing selfe haue alleaged wil ye know horne whether doings erle cadidianus theperors deputy reached discussio determinatio matter ecclesiastical say saing cofirmed appeale supreame head theodosius plead self comissio gaue cadidianus deputatus est cadidianus magnificus come tra sire v que ad sanctissima synodu vestra ac nullo quide quae facienda sunt de pij dogmatibus quaestiones communicare illicitum nam que est eu qui non sit ex ordine sanctissimorum episcoporum ecclesiasticis immiscere tractatibus haue sent saith themperour theodosius noble erle candidinianus deputye vnto holye synode geuinge charge medle anye poynte towchinge question moued abowte godlye doctryne religion yt vnlawfull whiche order holye bisshoppes entermedle ecclesiasticall matter yet ye saye iohn fellowes woulde appeare pope legate true man ye point dede wherein doinges good felowes protestante bisshops iohn refused come pope legate cou cel good right horne fellovves refused cou cel trent liberatus cap horn supremacye destroyed ovvne author chapter large saufe conducte called late councel trente durst ye knewe cause good shewe face ordinarie learned consistory ye knew ye able shewe good cause ye haue deposed catholike bisshoppes coulde iohn deposed cyrillus memnon therefore called geue reckoning doings pope celestins legate president themselues cyrill memnon put vp complaintes pope legats newly come rome costatinople whole coucel bisshops durste appeare loe place ad chapter ope proufe pope ad ecclesiastical primacy withstading euer emperour supreme head al allowing iohns wycked proceding pope legats councell supreme authority resumed matter hads also cyrill memnon bisshops ephesus vniustly deposed offred billes coplainte wherevpo iohn cited appere playd night owlespart able abyde cleare light pope authority ad honorable councel haue ye cocerning ephesine councel spoken altogether saye ad ephesios poore ayde ye like take councels hand nay ye quyt ouerbore ad ouertilted therewith shall yet large appere vouchesafe reade haue writen matter iewel art fo et returne vntruthes horne diuision pag eutyches stirred vp much trouble day vvherefore vvas cited appeare flauianus bisshop constantinople bisshops assembled synode ansvveare vnto heresy vvho vvoulde vvas heretik vvarrant vvoulde appeare bisshop fled prince liberat cap appeare fledde vnto emperour theodosius declareth vnto griefe emperour sendeth vnto synod vvith eutiches one chiefe officer florentius vvith mandate bicause wee study carefully peace goddes churche catholike faith wil goddes grace haue righte faithe kepte whiche sette foorth nicene councell confirmed father ephesus nestorius co demned wee wil therefore bee offence committed aboute aforenamed catholique faithe bicause wee knowe honourable florentius faithfull approoued man righte faith wee wil shalbe present synode bicause conference faithe vvas asistaunt vnto father vntruth floretius vsed examination al examined eutyches openly synode vntruth neuer asked hi one question diuerse time faithe finally saide vnto saithe florentius doth confesse christ twoo nature doth beleeue aright vntruth floretius cou cel vvas co demned deposed vvas eutyches excommunicate deposed condemned eutyches rested obteined emperour commaunde nevv synode constantinople vvherein examine actes former vvhether thinges touching proceding eutyches vvere orderly rightly appointeth besides florentius diuerse vntruthe nicephorus hath thing noble councel see doings thereof vvhen eutyches coulde vvin purpose neither synodes procureth friedship empresse eudoxia others emperour call synode againe ephesus vvhich synode emperour prescribeth fourme proceding synode vvas vvicked conuenticle vvherein truth vvas defaced heresie approued emperour seduced chrysaphius one priuy chamber fauour vvithe chapter eutyches archeretike stapleton eutyches false monke ye flie fro ordinarie iudges suche iudges matter neither presence floretius emperours deputy councel maketh emperor haue sayd ad shewed supreame head much emperor sayth coferece sayth woulde deputy present graunted whe matter faith debated emperours dist vbinam chal act pa cabil milleuit cap al christe hereof yt may inferred coucels assembled disciplin ecclesiasticall faith theperor deputy haue nothig infrigeth greatest part supremacy plain rule practise church expressed coucels chalcedon cabylon milleuitum graunt emperours deputye may present councell matter faith debate present ende hath authoritye determyne decide controuersies haue alredy proued theodosius selfe stoppe belyke gappe ye imagin florentius play iudges parte examyne eutyches openly synod faith belieued examination florentius vsed none lay man beside might haue demauded beleued demaunding determin ought belieue adde diuerse tymes faith vntruth florentius al synode neuer asked one question alleage synode hadde nowe condemned suppose ye would fasten iudges part vpon sayd eutyches doth confesse christe two nature doth belieue right might anie haue sayd symple sentence simple yt ye thought simply dubly craftely yea altogether falsly minding beare ignorant reader thoughe bene final sentence therfore ye say eutyches excommunicated deposed condemned pray maister horne florentius flauianus councell howe praye youe councell woordes florentius demaunde eutyches faithe liberatus cap yea tell thou must confesse curse doctrine contrary faith nowe eutyches would said ye say many thinges would holy scripture hadde suche matter councel curse curse florentius spake woordes rehersed afterwarde cursed depriued priestly honour florenrius owne bisshop flauianus conteined chapter quoted yea playn place withal pope primacy flauianus sent setece rome eutyches thus codemned coplayned letter vpon flauianus appealed pope leo eutyches rested pope synne dowbt whether yowe wil graunt christes mother take christ self beseache yowe without faultes holy vertuous godly man leo let passe speake though much might said therin bicause good euil life pope man material doctrin teacheth matter haue hand verely right faith true doctrine found belefe seme taxe wil ij shorte saynges onely ij generall coucels shortly note reader absolute doctour leo malapert comptroller chalcedo councell bishop expressely plainely professe iudgement blessed father leo solemne subscription wordes no summe orthodoxum esse sanctissimum patrem nostrum archiepiscopum superficially slenderly perfectissime perfytly exactly assuredly knowe surely forsothe holy father leo orthodoxus right beleuer true catholike sounde teacher god people onely common meane sort summe orthodoxum catholike right beleuing highest degree without blotte blemish respecte suche sentence protested pronounced suche many lerned auncient father aboue vnleuen hundred yeres paste suche solemne assembly absolute vndoubted commendation excellent prelat whence crepe lewde surmise face dare deface like constat absolute comendatio without surmised exceptio al general coucel cocil co stant act shyneth horne dymme doctrine stroge surmise weaken kicke piller breake shinne deface greater owne shame therefore glosing causelesse surely meaning gracelesie verely suche ye expressed woulde forthwith haue disgraced quyte ouerthrowen false conclusion immediatly folowing freighted allmost many lie lynes touching suyte emperour haue councell called must vnderstande horne bare calling councells suche emperours haue vsed one greateste amonge ecclesiasticall cause speake properlye matter ecclesiasticall prouision waie exhortation bishop meete conuenyent place without breache ciuill order forbiddeth illicita collegia tit de illicitis collegijs vnlawful assembly shoulde accopted theperor allowed theperor prince lorde territory soyle bishop woulde assemble dede discussion determination matter faith councelles may wel said belong great ad weighty cause church belogeth lay prince withstadig leo far fro acknowledging supreme gouernmet authority calling councels yf deceiued ye self know ad belieue cotrary therefore durst speak ye thought vnder dark mystical talke pray horne fault ye find leo worthy thus touched yow onlesse yt moste playnely seriously auowcheth solicitudine quam vniuersae ecclesiae ex diuina institutione dependimus episto ad episcopos aphrican good euidete proufs fetched farder leo self ye shall fayne yf ye haue grace acknowledge truthe whether ye regarde doings saying pointe moste notable peter primacy doth euery confesse appereth many sermon workes leo saieth quoniam inter apostolos similitudine honoris fuit quaedam discretio potestatis quum omnium par esset electio vni tame datu est vt caeteris praeemineret whereas apostle lyke honour meaneth apostleship priesthood yet difference power amogs al lyke elected yet yt geuen one peerlesse aboue wherein meaneth saint peter leo saieth bisshops haue seueral appointed care care vniuersal church cometh see peter leo saith euen god ordinance taketh care whole churche leo saieth vt ab ipso quasi quodam capite dona sua velut omne corpus diffunderet vt expertemse ministerij intelligeret esse diuini qui ausus fuisset petri soliditate recedere hunc enim consortium indiuiduae expoundeth saying shall partaker god misterie departeth peter sowndenes christe called scripture rock gaue name peter yt shall much way note iewel recyting place doth dissimble writen godlie learned man leo also fathereth yt vpon pope bonifacius writeth ye see originally lyingly vnitatis putteth trinitatis though leo ad bonifacius make peter one three parson blessed trinitie poynt pope glosar good molineus horne selfe whiche molineus place gloseth apase pope much againste yet matter much better iewel reading aswell otherwhere canon lawe vnitatis non trinitatis nowe way shewe yow pope glosars molineus withal one iewels prety knackes worthy added reckonig hardig sander haue rightfully charged let v returne leo see whether woordes amplifie supreame authority doinges practised dict alias ad luxe nale om concil pag ra li cap ouncels kepte vvithout con ent pope beatissimi petri iure atque honore serua ep alias coc pag col spiritual temporal diminution spirituall power temporall power doth helpe assist thinke yow would perniciouse pestilent fellow dioscorus faction thing haue regarded pope leo ecclesiastical authority notoriously transgressed god lawes man lawes onlesse good emperour ioyned assistaunce vnto maye answered calling many generall councels emperours especially firste seuen hundred yeares christ patriarch selues archeheretikes matter like easily redressed churche authoritie onely yet neyther catholique prince call could call councell without pope wil consent ye thinke dede ye doe thinke farre wrong godly learned bisshop leo call able capable willing toward reformation sone refourme wrong iudgement declareth expresselye euen councell chalcedo summoned commaundement emperours consent see apostolique surely rule canon church aboue hudred yeares past councell could kept socrates witnesseth without authoritie bisshop rome speciall prerogatiue priuilege see prerogatiue leo also doth signify speaking emperour marcian called chalcedon councel yet saith without hinderance preiudice peter right honour consent peter successour apostolique see rome meruail much ye frame supremacie marcian supplication bishop eusebius desiring emperour procure letter coucel would heare cause dioscorus serueth rather councels primacy remouing also councel fro nicaea chalcedo doth serue litle purpose vide tom concil pag cause trasposing leo ambassadours signified bishop would assemble onlesse themperour would personally feare seditio tumult eutyches disciple therfore translated chalcedo nigh constantinople emperour might comodiously done good emperor assure ad honour theclesiastical authority ye turne hinderance derogation supplicatio eusebius haue put large booke world see vntruly haue dealt partly nipping sentence midst partly false translation first leaue begining bishop supplication wherin shortly declareth whole effect request saiyng act coc chal pag entet purpose clemency prouide subiects helpe iniuriously oppressed especially beare office priesthod beginning appereth bishop requested onely emperours external ciuill power redresse help iniuries appere thought good leaue quite againe processe sayed bisshoppe saieth prostrate beseech clemencie ye commaund dioscorus answere matter shall obiect fololoweth leaue euidences doinges v read councell word bishop required councel iudge emperor least shuld appere leaue end latine hath perferre ad scientiam vestrae pietatis omnia quae geruntur turne make relation thinthat iudged haue put word iudged liyng liberality latine hath al persuade bishoppe requested emperoure iudge betweene dioscorus ye put whole wordes author would haue easely appeared nothing rather contrarye place omitted nowe expressed circumspect reader may sone perceiue thus like doctrine manner writing false vnperfect vntrue againe tale maister horne though tell v large howe emperoures marcian valentinian sente letter summons bisshoppes commaunding epist praeamb concil chal ed tom pag col c yea writen notary synode sayth whole synode sayeth synode ye well trauayled self frendes synode shuld haue co sidered rule necessary bring pytte errour ye fallen wel perchaunce ye lack courage ye geue assured yf reasonable answere wil contente set ouer witness self hitherto haue best liked sought helpe ayde supremacy hand meane iudges senatours emperours deputy wheras ye alleage matter finally determined action matter resumed action say oft mouing matter requiring ye woulde geue sentence concerning bisshoprike holy church ephesus gloriosissimi iudices dixerunt quoniam sepe nobis interloque horne ye wil wisely geue ouer matter bassianus residewe councell ye haue vniustly pleaded vppon require v belieue yow better ye shewe cause onlesse ye haue v vppon bare worde credite yowe think wise men wil hasty excepte ye shewe good commission apostle bringing forth whereof contente geue good long day councel whervpo ye would seme proufs shuld reste ye haue shewed yt v anie good cleare light ye haue done nicen ephesine obscurely vnperfectly chapter contayning euident proufes chalcedon councel pope bishop supremacy cause ecclesiasticall good reader thowghe horne sufficietly alredy answered solution argumetes nede greatly stay loger yet shew fayrer clearer light illustratio confirmation assertion euen councel horne hath part shal yelde horne suppose fekenha wil wherfore following horn trace step wil rone ouer act said coucel though wo derful long tedious compendiously gather material thing side act pa col b paschasio lucetio reuered episcopis bonifacio religiosiss presbytero tenetibus locu sanctiss et reuerendiss rchiepis almae vrbis romae leonis anatolio c act pa co quia synodu facere ausus est sine authoritate romanae sedis quod nuqua rite factu est nec fieri licuit rome heade church act p co c romam cclesiaru omnium caput act pag col first begin first sessio certain pope legate named placed al bishop patriarch though one priest bishop shal ye find wicked b alexandria called accopt mainteining doings councel whervnto b rome gaue cosent authority auouched neuer lawful shal ye find heare rome called head church shal ye find pope leo gaue comaundement finde learned bishop cyrus theodoretus deposed dioscorus maximus patriarche receiued placed among bishop euag lib ca dioscorus comanded leo sta placed among bisshoppes vniuersal bishop leo restored shal ye find laie men priest haue voice councel bishop appeareth ciuil magistrate present councell geaue sentence act pa recipiens locum sanctiss episcopo inclytae vrbis romae pope restoreth
