authority therevnto comission churche pag col thus say euen booke bring forth emperours comission otherwise thinke crie sanctus sanctus ye shal say bring forth comission vndone al primacy emperour hath commission church belike church aboue onlesse ye haue found newe diuinitie ye find new lawe wherby taketh comissio shal aboue geueth curse horne ecclesiasticall curse surely shuld maistres madge played shrewe youvvhat maner curse zeno eperours curse vvas shrewe curse shrewes heart zelouse detestation heretikes good catholike man nowe say cursed al wicked sacramentaries whome pray curse trow ye accursed chiefly nestorius eutyches general coucels excomunicated yet al haue margent dasshed fresh iolye note prince supremacy al cause pray god send horne much worship yt ye late like marginall florishe owte chalcedon councell yet let v see proufes ye lay forthe say zeno required cause vnity church ye mary constantine marcian yea marcian called cheif phisition neade put remembrance hereof leaste ye take muche pryde yt yea zeno sayeth god people shall bowe neckes power dede horne onlesse ye proue saied spiritual power said hostiu generationes coteretur oes aute incuruabunt post deum sua potestati nostrae ceruicem libe c gens hostile conterentur que exti guetur oes collae sua imperio secudu deu nostro submittent nice lib c libe c libe c nice lib cap coc pag col meante good argument pittye hath quyte broken necke neither yet doth zeno speake neckes subiectes yt semeth nation enimies assuredly woordes al pagan emperours vse yet trowe therefore supreme gouernours al cause spiritual yt would require tracte tyme fully open either howe horne hath confounded maymed mangled authours narration shewe thing euen true narration story reherseth make fully agaist pope primacy ioannes talaida saieth liberatus appealed pope simplicius euen athanasius simplicius writeth acatius answereth withowt pope cosent emperours commaundement preseruation vnity church simplicius replied ought communicate petrus moggus agreed emperours order ad proclamatio onlesse woulde embrace decree cou cel chalcedo thus letter going fro simplicius died felix succedeth doth depriue bisshoprike excommunicateth taking part said petrus moggus death acatius succedeth flauianus woulde suffer himselfe enstalled without pope consent within shorte tyme euphemius patriarche constantinople receiued synodicall letter pope manye thinges else might said euen chapter vpon maister horne himselfe pleadeth passe ouer prince supremacy cause ecclesiastical hath horne al diuision marginal note lyeth dust hath beside saith emperor lieutenant deposed iohn talaida patriarche antioche vntrue emperour dede commaunded lieutenant liberatus cap vt pellerent eum expulse driue bisshoprike depose make bishop lay emperours power merely selfe wise prelate said king edwardes dayes tower catholike faieth take awaye ricke iohn remayned bisshop stil iohn talaida appereth well liberatus owne author horne iohn talaida saieth liberatus appealinge emperours violence pope simplicius habes episcopi dignitatem remansit romae remayned rome hauing stil dignity bishop also afterwarde ricke also pope endewed bishoprike nola campania emperours prince haue power though lawful expelle depriue men church temporal dignity possession depriue man church office ministery depose bisshop priest fro spiritual iurisdictio authority deposition cause ecclesiastical church fro authority came belongeth prince depriuations ecclesiastical deposition take answere one al horne vntruly reporte prince deposed bisshops horne diuision pag pope simplicius considering great contention vvere accustomably election pope prouide decree pope hereafter chosen vvithout authority prince vvhich decree although extant yet manifest inough epistle kinge odoacer put actes thirde synode simmachus pope keepe rome vvherin king doth auouche decree simplicius also addeth vve maruaile without v anye thig accopted seing while priest meaning bisshop rome simplicius liue nothing ought haue bene taken hande without v chapter simplicius felix symmachus pope rome stapleton pope simplicius decree gaue prince authority confirme chosen pope helpeth supremacy nay doth much impayre al prince authority behalfe dependeth pope decree superiour lawe subiect law lawemaker yet diuision hath maner inckling iuduce price supremacy cause ecclesiastical yf horn would haue loked litle vpo first line next leafe mought haue found said synod see rome hath priestly primacy ouer whole world councels must confirmed see like matter whereas king odoacer beside decree touchig chosing pope self say made pope request made also concerning alienating church good whole synod reiected codemned ij cause expressely first saith eulalius bisshop sicily whose sentence bisshops saying whole synode folowed rule father decree appereth made layemen though religious godlye synod rom sub symmacho tom conc pag col whome authoritye euer geuen ouer ecclesiasticall good reade secondlye declared confirmed subscription bisshop apostolike see nowe whereas holy father nicene councel haue decreed priestes whatsoeuer prouince keeping councel within owne lymities shall attempt thing without authority metropolitane bisshop voyde none effect howe much knowen haue bene presumed see apostolike bisshop thereof present qui prae rogatiua beati apostoli petri per vniuersum orbe primatum obtinens sacerdotij statutis synodalib consueuit tribuere firmitate bisshop prerogatiue blessed apostle peter hauing throughe whole worlde primacy priesthood hath bene wonte confirme decree councels presumed say layemen though certayn bisshops agreing vnto yet could preiudicat prelat knowen consecrated vndoubtedly voyde effect neither waye accompted amonge ecclesiastical decree thus farre synod selfe alleaged horne god rewarde geuing v good instruction selfe yf came frende let haue thankes therefore yf falleth willes yet god praysed sinne worketh somtime greater amedement turneth horrible temptation confortable calmenesse storme came also vnhappy meaning hathe yet brought v happye information doctrine vtterly ouerthroweth heresye see horne laie magistrat yea king selfe yea though religiouse godly vtterly excluded authority cause ecclesiasticall whereby phantasticall primacie vanisheth cleane away also pope whome cal forraine power hath primacy chiefty supreame praeeminence priesthode onely rome romaine prouince saith synode self clerckly alleaged per vniuersum orbem throughout whole worlde parte worlde primate thus much saith synode thereby vtterly ouerthroweth whole effect othe partes whiche catholikes refuse swere vnto verely ye goe haue hitherto wil surely espied preuaricatour double faced proctour secreatlie instructing client aduersarie face protesting plead better instruction hyred aduocate coulde haue geauen v counterpleader haue ministered vnto v horne diuision pag next simplicius vvas foelix third chosenact vvho confirmation sent many letter vvell emperour acatius bisshoppe constantinople matter betvvixt iohn peter vvhen coulde preuaile suite made iohn bisshoppe nola campania one letter pope foelix vvrote vnto zenon emperour matter put fift synode constantinople vvherein pope salutation doth humblye beseech emperour take humble suite good parte shevveth holy vntruth vvordes apostolike catholique left churche maketh suite vvill vouchesafe mainteine vnitie churche vvill destroye heresy breaketh bonde vnitie vvill expell peter mogge bothe oute citie also churche regiment vvould suffer peter deposedvide tom coc pa epist felicis ad petrum haec legat sanctum dei apostolica et catholica eccles vt ab ipsa propter praedictas causa depositu ad comunione suscipias sed per diuinas apex vestrae serenitatis ab antiochiae confinio propelli e pro ipso aut co stituite vnu operib sacerdotiu ornantem etc tom conc act synod pag b admitted communion churche honorable letter vvould banish bound antioche saith bisshop rome foelix vnto emperour place appoint one shal beutifie priesthode woorkes stapleton procede still bring authority selfe peter deposed confesse whome horne emperour euen pope foelix appeareth one leafe place selfe alleage case painefull turne backe leafe two yet might haue vouchsaued haue read next line allegatio foelix signifieth deposed therfore requesteth themperour expel place mete man whiche thing pope doe day requiring catholike prince remoue hereticall bishop place good roome neither yet therfore euer prince accompted enacted intituled supreme gouernours cause ecclesiasticall new religion hath inuented newe title pope foelix also excommunicated acatius constantinople bearing peter mogge witnesseth liberatus whereby appeareth clerely pope primacie ouer ij chiefe patriarch east churche constantinople antioche againe owne example cleane ouerthrowen horne diuision pag b anastasius emperour vntruth deposed macedonius bisshoppe constantinople one falsified ghospels liberatus saith stapleton macedonius falsified ghospel wene worthy deposed author vseth worde deposed saieth expulsed whiche might ordinary vsual course liberatus cap bishop first deposed matter cleare side greatly enforce reason anastasius selfe wicked hereticall emperour great good deduction made doings let passe horne diuision pag b election symachus platina mentioneth vvhat great diuision sedition arose muche party vvere faine agree haue councell holden determination matter councell appointed rauenna saith sabellicus end controuersy might decided according right king theodoriche vvhome matter vvas discussed last pope symachus vvas confirmed neuerthelesse fyer vvas thus quite quenched foure yeares blased sorer againe vvhereat king saieth platina beinge displeased sente peter bisshoppe altine rome enioye see bothe vntruth platina saieth vt pulso vtroque sedem teneret deposed vvherevpon synode vvas called bisshops vvherein saith sabellicus pope selfe defended ovvne cause stoutlye cunningly confuted saith platina al obiections laid verdict vvas acquited fault laied laurence peter stapleton may said doings prince election clergie example agree practise haue already saied somewhat say diuision folowing shall saye particularlye horne diuision pag b thentent may better appere vvhat vvas king authority matter mark fourth romaine synode holden time symachus matter vvhiche although mangled confusedly set forth booke generall councels bicause may seeme vntruth slaunderouse malitious vvould haue vvhole trueth dissention appaare yet vvil shevv much prince vntruth cou cell vvill shevve verye small small entermedling authority synodes churche matter synode vvas summoned kept rome vntruth king selfe cou cel declareth commaundement pope letter synod vvas sumoned commaundement honorable kinge theodoriche declareth many grieuous complaintes vvere brought vnto againste symachus bisshoppe rome symachus commeth synode ansvvere selfe geaueth thankes king calling synode requireth may restored suche thing loste suggestion ennemies former state come cause ansvvere accuser parte synode thoughte demaunde reasonable decernere tamen aliquid synodus sine regia notitia non praesumpsit yet synode presumed decree thing without king knowledge neyther came passe vvisshed king commaunded symachus bisshoppe rome ansvvere aduersaries shoulde resume thing vntruth councel protested perteined man el king committed vvhole debating iudging mater synode vvhich concludeth sentence vvith vvords vvherfore according king comaundement hath committed cause v refourme restore vnto symachus right euer ought haue within citie rome without stapleton hath horne fetch proue prince haue chief interest mater ecclesiastical deposition bishop yea pope selfe first angry mater boke councels mangled confusedly set foorth thorne pricketh disclose worlde saye truthe seeth owne conscience councellesm horne complaineth dareth shew vvhere thoro pricketh selfe councell alleageth dothe set foorth pope primacie grieuouse remembrance therof causeth speake tel verelye horne stepped foorth one fote turned eie vpon next leafe haue found clercklie worke made eunodius defence councell hand withall haue founde euident authority pope supremacie vppon state temporall spirituall also finde booke confirmed cc xxx bishop assembled rome synode leaue therfore horne complaint complaine tom conc pa grieueth dede confusion confession ye find bishop concerning ecclesiasticall praeeminence liyng open thicke like great block way ye coulde passe ouer allegation haue patched must needes stumble breake shinnes therat grieueth ful sore let v see good holsome herbes ye cunning gardener haue gathered garden ye thinke lieth vnhasomlie sluttishly ye say first councell called comaundement right honorable king theodoriche make honorable ye wil arrian shal ye make yf ye knew arrian martinus pol sabellicus honour might haue bene better bestowed el ye knewe reading small trow furnish boke yet say truthe small reading serue turne ye say called councell call forsoth cosent pope symachus though coucel called bisshops tolde king pope thing church kinge made aunsweare pope declared consente letter yea bishop satisfied king saiyng required sight pope letter king shewed vnto pope also self present licensed bishop examine matter litle affectu purgationis suae culmen humiliat desire purging hubleth high authority dignity yet horne addeth synode presumed decree thing without king knowledge yf saied ought ye said somwhat presume may two thing farre sonder though yet one sense dede might ought haue proceded king consent without pope hath iudge world god neither ca iudged inferiours nec aliquid ad se praeter reuerentia de ecclesiasticis negotijs pertinere pa col bishop told king face finally king referreth whole mater synode plainly protesteth coucels part prescribe ought done weighty mater mee saith king haue nothing doe ecclesiasticall mater honour reuerence comit heare heare matter ye shall thinke profitable christias city rome might set peace point lo al horne supremacy driuen bishop proceding sentence doe declare pope symachus iudged man neither bound answere accuser committed god iudgemet reason coucel geueth appertaineth sheep pastour vnde secu dum principalia praecepta quae nostrae hoc tribuunt reherse iudicial sentence declaration taken true bishop medle cause discusse iudicially would said canos thei could therefore immediatly sentence ye haue hast broke midle followeth doe reserue whole cause iudgemente god sette former parte recited parcell sayed sentence ye must needes doe haue ye sponne faire threade selfe prouing thing whiche thing yee fellowes denye pope iudged man haue ye nowe made supreame heade whole churche haue geauen selfe suche fowle fall worlde lawghe scorne see finde faulte councell mangled confusedlye sette foorth whiche plainelye pithelye confoundeth greate shame good ground refuse othe ye copelled also take othe pope primacy squemish conscience yet refuse authority owne author text plainely auouched horne diuision pag shall manifestly proued testified pelagius pope legate constantinoplethe vntruth vvordes pronouced emperor co mademet liberatus lib c accepit abimpera potestate super ordinationem ducu ac tribunoru vt remoue ret haereticos pro eis orthodoxos ordinaret lib c whych thyng horne concealeth meruaile warrant empresse al dare say knox fellowes haue spoken bishop think setteth better surely selfe anthimus captaine heretikes time geare goeth handsomly thyngs warrante yow dewe order proportion euen good matter good selfe nowe horne hath declared anthimus deposed bishoprike retourned shewe howe first ordered made bishop haue tale tolde purpose worlde paulus bishop murtherer deposed well orderly trowe pelagius pope proctour howe horne frameth primacy hereof god woteth wotte world iustinians commission depose bishop horne meane kyng edward gaue england late horne commission iustinians neither hath hys author suche thing themperour gaue bishop authority appoint captaines emperours officer helpe forward execution nay saieth horne wurste behind iustinian theperour gaue iudgemente vppon origenes cursed dede somwhat might haue bene sayde sauing haue sayd somwhat alredie suche manner cursing sauinge horne hys great curtesie hath eased v ad hath made trowe againste hys nothing hys skill full answere v saying origenes long tyme yea yet lyvinge condemned newe sentece determinatio made iustinian confirmation olde matter supremacie yf man shoulde beshrewe luther cursed harte newe broched heresy curse hys heresy manie hundred yeares condened ad cursed many good vertuous clerke many general coucels neither iustinia geue sentece curse origen self cap liberat saith comaundemet procurig chief patriarch rome alexadria antioch ad hierusale ordinary iudges case emperours absolut commandemet co demned find act generall cou cell action co co sta ca origen condemned arius macedonius euthyches horne diuision pag vvhen theodorus bisshop caesarea cappadocia heard condemnation reuenged laboured earnestly vvith emperour condemne theodorus mopsuestenus famous aduersary origen vvhich brought passe ouermuch fraude abusing emperour great slaunder offence church thus ecclesiasticall cause appereth emperor vntruth bisshops emperour chief intermedli g hath well appeared chief entermedling vvho although last vvas beguyled false bisshops yet vvorthy noting vvhom offence church came vvhich appeareth follovveth beleeue manifest al men saith liberatus offence entred church pelagius deaco theodorus bisshop eue theodorus selfe openly publishe clamour cry pelagius woorthy brente quicke whome offence entred worlde stapleton horne nowe bringe v prety conclusion prove v bishopes dissention abuse prince assisting nowe one parte nowe prince supreame headeuil successe prince ermedling cause ecclesiasticall whereof rather well followe conclusion experience sheweth prince intermedled cause religio troubled churche selues abused also misused others therefore price mete person supreme head cause example hereof plenty constantin great persuaded donatistes importunat suyt august epist waded farre ouer border owne vocatio augustin writeth sanctis antistibus veniam erat petiturus tripar l c came point aske pardon holy bishop emperour suit arrians medled far bishop matter banished innocent godly lerned bishop athanasius whereof deathebed repented willing testament restored theodosius first niceph li c persuaded smothe toung flauianus vnlawful periured bishop antioch take parte wrongefully west bisshops greatest parte christedom wwhereof haue spoken theodosius seconde defended ephesine conuenticle pope leo seduced dioscorus eutyches co chalc act rather abused one priuy chamber chrysaphius eunuche wynked dering holy flauianus whome chalcedon coun calleth martyr lib ca emperour deceyued acatius consta tinople banished iohn talayda catholike patriarch alexandria appealed emperoure pope simplicius nowe like maner emperour iustinian ouer busy ecclesiastical matter one toke great delight noteth liberatus geue iudgment matter cap concil chalc act fine deceiued theodorus secte acephali condemned theodorus mopsuestenus ibas two catholike bishop highly praysed chalcedon councel wherof sprong vp church moste lamentable tragedye space many yeares writer doe pitefully report niceph lib ca iustinian also banished good bishop constantinople eutychius suffering alter religion restored againe deathbed constantine dyd athanasius woulde haue banished also anastasius catholyke bishop antioche would yeld heresy aphthartodocitae example ought rather teach prince intermedle matter aboue vocation trulye muche sowle passeth body geue anye presidentes supreame gouernemente yea cavses mayster horne hys fellowes long prince fauour woulde geue vnto horne diuision pag pelagius yet vvas suffragan proctour pope vvho aftervvard absence pope vigilius maister crepte see middest broiles totylas king gothes made italye vvhen also came rome vvhiche historie noted pope vntruth vvas subiection ecclesiastical mater rome coquered totylas pelagius vithall citie submited selues subiection totylas vvhome humblie knee acknovvleaged lorde appointed thereto god selfe reste seruaunte note also hovve king sent embassadoure vvhat charge othe voyage message returne king straightlie gaue vnto hovve buxomelie thing obeyed hovve last tovvard emperour commaunded tell message fell doune foot vvith teares bothe noble ceased make moste lamentable humble supplication till vvithout speed vvithout vntruth slaunderous shall appeare reproche leaue returne home least take thing sette foorthe prince onely iurisdiction ouer ecclesiasticall personnes matter temporall cause ecclesiasticall marke vvhat vvritten historian platina amongest decree pope pelagius telleth vvitnesseth sabellicu narses emperours deputie ioyntelye pelagius decree none ambition shoulde admitted holye order pelagius moreouer vvriteth vnto narses vntruth decree narses vvas ecclesiastical mater executio churche canos made desiring ayed bisshoppes liguria venetiae histria vvhich vvould obey putting aff aunce authoritie first councell constantinople vvhiche epistle amongest thing vvriteth vvise honoure must remember god wrought time totyla tyraunt possessing histriam venetia frenche also wasting thinges woulde neuerthelesse proueth naughte el pelagius firste hath ordeined sec lar word helped spiritua l could preuaile suffer bi hoppe myllaine made vntill sente woorde thence moste milde prince meaning emperour reciued answere againe writing shoulde done bothe ordeined bisshoppe ordeined brought rauenna appointment high authoritie long pelagius bycause vvas chosen ussu principis without emperours comaundement could send vnto reason tovvne vvas beseged huge risyng vvaters stopped passage soone might elected pope sent gregory craue em erours pardone obtaine good vvill dayes sayth platina clergie nothing pope election except election bene allovved emperour stapleton horne telleth v tale olde wonte without head taile abuse ignorant reader confuse heape disordered false wordes pelagius sente roman king totilas entreat peace would time ceasse warre geue truce saying meane whyle succour sabellic aeneld lib would yelde citye rome pelagius coulde wynne none answere hand bu beate downe walles receiue army stand curtesy mercye totilas afterward possession city cocernig pope pelagius set ambassadour themperour fearing warres fro emperour iustinian sent pelagius iustinian trauaile peace sending withall worde case would inuade italye would destroye rome plucke downe faste ground totilas toke othe pelagius hys ambassadours doe hys message faythfullie returne againe theyre ambassade exployted pelagius pitefullye withe manie teares layethe iustinian miserable state vtter destructio desolation rome impedente onlesse woulde forbeare warre totilas yea ad hys fellowes fell vpon theire knee humblye beseching haue compassio citye fyne iustinia would relent wherevpon sone returne rome set al fier totylas lyuing creature man woman childe suffered inhabite prye nowe horne pycke ye establishe primacye folye open matter withe many word refuted one matter ecclesiastical ye see wel inowghe therefore selfe faste ye wou de steale away yt proue matter otherwise sir ye shall steale awaye beside note extreme folye busie selfe reader self deny nothing towch spiritual matter ye shal carry lie two el tel v wil haue v note pope subiection totylas platina pelagio sabell aenead lib seing neither pelagius pope vigilius yet liuing costantinople neither way subiect tyrant totilas rage crueltyes called flagellum dei scourge god tyme tooke rome entred conquest pelagius homage obtayne mercy poore cytyzens totylas seing coming towarde said meaneth pelagius comest thou suppliant pelagius answered sayinge yea sir come seing god hath made lorde haue mercy beseche vpon seruaunts haue mercy vpon poore captiue cytie lo subiection pelagius made totylas wishe noted horne though made thing pope subiection spiritual matter tel v also whye ye write departed reproche reproche iustinians hand authour sabellicus sheweth none see man folish wilynes dede sabellicus writeth pelagius noted fauorer anthimus saith withall pelagius detest thinges seme fauour wel supply defect superfluous liyng talk pelagi brigeth forth decree symony made pelagius narses themperors deputy mater faith horne new decree maners bene decreed long therefore execution old canon narses might medle withal wel inoughe make vp mater yet one againe declaration concerning interest emperour election bishoppes pope wherevnto time nede greatly say thing much hath ben said hereof horne diuision pag time pelagius first papacy vvas councel holden tovvers frauce licence consent arithbertus king reformation churche discipline vvherein appeareth king authoritie vvas vntruth councell suche thing necessarily required confirme strengthen discipline vvhere decree maides vviddovves shall maried vvithoute consente parentes vvhiche especiall matter ecclesiasticall declare vntruth declare due obseruatio therof strength depeded vpo tho prince good lavves strength thereof depend vpon commaundement prince onely say king childebert clotharius honourable memory kepte preserued constitutio lawes touching matter nowe king charibert successour hath confirmed strengthened precept stapleton nowe maister horne reuolted fraunce againe tarie long sodainly returneth againe constantinople short tale consisteth two lye first saieth king authoritie necessarily required confirme discipline churche neither councell neither gathered second coucel declareth strength decree speciall matter ecclesiastical dependeth vppon commaundemente prince councell declareth onely good king fraunce kept constitution churche behalfe tripart li ca forced lawe due obseruation thereof like iouinian emperoure made death lawe defile virgin nonne though sinne churche condemned doth multiplie woordes proueth nothing imagined supremacye mary knowe horne councell youre selfe alleaged maketh pope supremacie lette tell father councell saye conc turo priest dare bolde doe contrarye suche decree come see apostolique litle whose authoritie may take place whome apostolique see sendeth maketh deputy referendaries father haue euer kept authoritie commaunded thus fight well v nothing selfe horne diuision pag emperoure iustinianus calleth bisshoppes church vnto generall councell constantinople vvhich called fifte oecumenicall synode represse insolence certaine heretiques vvho taught mainteined heresy schismes greate disquieting churche againste doctrine establisshed foure forenamed general councelles time councell menna euag li ca bisshoppe constantinople departed life vvhose roome emperour placed eutychius emperour gouerneth directeth thing councell niceph li ca emperours done generall synodes appeareth vvriting vvhiche sente vnto bisshoppes vvherein shevveth right belieuing godly emperours auncestours alvvaies labour cutte heresy sprong vp time calling together synode religious bisshopsal graunted horne primacie neuer vvhitte thereby furdered preserue holy church peace right faith sincerely preached taught allegeth thexaples costatinus magnus theodosius elder theodosius yonger martianus emperours vvho saith called former generall councelles vvere present selues ovvne personnes aide helpe true confessours tooke great trauaile vppon righte faithe preuaile preached forenamed auncestours godlie memorie saith strengthen confirme lawes thing whiche decided euerye councelles expulse heretiques whiche went gainesaye determination fower forenamed generall councelles vnquiet church protesteth first entraunce made beginning foundation emperiall gouernement vvitte vnitie faith agreeable fovver generall councelles amongest churche minister east vvest restraigning schismes contention stirred vppe fautours eutyches nestorius againste chalcedon councell satisfying many gainsaied holy chalcedon councell expulsion others perseuered errours holye church monasteryes ende concorde peace holye church priestes firmely kepte one selfe faithe whiche fower holy synodes confesse might preached throughout god holye church declareth hovv consulted vvith letter messenger matter hovv declared iudgementes vnto vvritinges vvithstanding seeing certaine heretiques continue heresy therefore haue called saith royall cittie meaning constantinople exhorting assembled togeather declare againe mindes touching matter sh vveth opened controuersies vigilius pope vvith constantinople asked saith opinio herein hee twise oftentimes writinge without writing curse three wicked article c vve commauded also iudges emperoure co maudeth pope com sinod vntruth sence horn imagineth vilz inforce thereby supreme gouernemente come vnto synode debate three article together ende agreable form right faith might set forth asked bothe writing touching matter eyther wicked article might condemned el thought right shewe minde openlye answered vnto v would doe seuerely selfe concerning three point deliuer vnto v declareth ovvne iudgement beliefe agreeable vvith faieth set foorth fovver generall councelles prescribeth vnto speciall matter debate decide synode vvhereof finall ende saith truth euery thing may confirmed wicked opinion condemned last concludeth vvith earnest godly exhortation seeke god glory declare iudgements agreable holy ghospell touching matter propoundeth doe vvith conuenient spede dat nonas maia constantinopoli stapleton horne hath emperor prince would beare iustinian hand also ought supreme head gouernour cause euen ecclesiastical spiritual iustinian hearken lawes constitution tell flatly suche heade agreeth shoulder wil made monster handes shall finde papist pope supremacy euer emperor sence pray horne ope proclamatios ad law euer continue enacted holy ecclesiasticall canon foure first councels shall haue strength force imperiall lawe iustinians testimony pope primacie cost ex trasl hal sancimus vt sancti ecclesiastici canones qui sanctis co cilijs niceno constat ephes chalcedon expositi sunt vicem legum obtine ant praedictorum enim sanctorum concilioru decreta perinde vt sacras scripturas suscipimus canones vt leges custodimus ac propterea sancimus vt secundum eorum definitiones sanctiss veteris ro papae primu oim sacerd sit sumi potificatus apice apud romam esse nemo e qui dubitet lib cod iustin de summae trinitate ideo que oes sacerdotes vniuersi orientalis traectus et subijcere et vnire sedi vest sanctitatis properauimus mox nec eni patimur quicqua quod ad ecclesiaru statu tinet quamuis manifestu indubitatu sit quod mouetur vt et vestrae inotescat sanct quae caput est oim sanctaru eccliaru secudu eoru definitiones c vt supra const sancimus sacras sequetes regulas c const secundu diuinas regulas sancimus sacras per omnia sequentes regulas const iustinian y yt embraceth decree holy councells euen doth holy sacred scripture kepeth canos doth imperial lawes iustinian enacted also according definitio foure councels pope rome shal taken chiefe priestes iustinian yn expresse lawe declared man doubteth principality highest bisshoprike resteth rome iustinian declared pope iohn studied laboured howe bring subiection vnitye see rome priestes easte iustinian tolde shall nothing moued perteining state churche neuer open certaine would signify holinesse head holy church iustinian declared lawes doings matter ecclesiastical followed holy canon made father iustinian published thys lawe matter ecclesiastical moued laye officer intermedle suffer bissoppes ende yt accordyng canon selfe iustinian great impudency obtrude title supreme gouernour whiche many expresse lawes doe euidently abhorre shame infamy dishonour shoulde accept title canon holy catholike church sequentes igitur ea quae sacris definita sut canonib co si ecclesiasticu negotiu sit nullam co munione habento ciuiles magistratus cu ea disceptatione sed religiosiss episcopi se cundu sacros canones negotio fine iponu const haereticos illi dixerut et no dicimus quicu que mebrum sanctae dei catholicae apostolicae ecclesiae sunt qua omnes sanctissimi totius habitati orbis paetriarchae tam romae occidentalis quam huius regiae vrbis alexadriae theopolis h erosolymoru oes sub ijs costituti episcopi vno ore apostolicam fide traditione praedicat qui igitur incotaminata coione catholica ecclesia dei amati huius sacerdotib participant opt iure vocamus haereticos owne lawes standing plainly cotrary would haue heretike hath yn hys lawes pronounced hym heretike doth comunicate faith holy churche especiallye pope rome fowre patriarch hath also said lawes shewed pope rome hath primacy ouer priestes first fowre generall councelles vnto pope patriarch haue agreed obtrude therefore presumptuous title emperour al shunned bring forth horne ecclesiasticall constitution decree wil made emperour iustinia al wil serue purpose one iote diligent reader remembred lawes referred pope iudgement made one owne followed former canon holy father last enacteth expresly ecclesiastical matter lay magistrats shall intermeddle bishop shall ende al matter according canos three thyngs beyng well remembred borne awaye nowe tell horne bring iustinians constitution ecclesiasticall matter effecte argumentes yn thys diuision resteth vppon thys poynte iustinian made lawes matter ecclesiasticall thing nede answer haue done sauing partly lye horne woulde ouerpassed wherein imagineth thing spoken done fifte generall councell constantinople whereas greate part done cou cel constantinople vnder emperour whiche horne doth vnskilfully confoude partly also shew yet one iustinian doth expounde doinges costit nouel qua sententia ta etsi per se valetem multo tame adhuc valentiore reddit maiestas imperatoria quae regia hac vrbe ipsu expellit hovve themperours said strengthe lavves churche tom concil pag horne wel wreste purpose iustinian saieth following holy father c forth many place iustinian haue declared againe speaking thing decreed synod zoaras sentence saieth power yt se fe imperiall maiestye hath made yt yet muche stronger doth expulse imperial city lo horn decree synode stronge thoughe emperour neuer confirme become imperial primacye nowe farder heare purpose prince assiste furtheraunce executio bishop deposed zoaras power coulde thrust city banishe must ciuil power iustinian made councels lawe stronger ye heare iustinia meaning often alleage prince streghthe lawes church shew supreme gouernment final sentence iudgemet rested bisshops againe affirmeth act pag ofte sentece priestes hath deposed holy rowmes vnworthy priesthood ofte empire minde made order costitutio authority priestes see horne deposing priestes bishoppes proceded first authority sentence iudgement priestes afterwarde putte execution imperial lawes say shortly bishop deposed prince banished death dayes prince proceded clergy thoughe deposed condemned generall councell might nowe goe forwarde thing weight remayning sauinge marginal note emperour commaundeth pope come councell stayeth litle making good apparance ye say commaunded pope yf ye proued withall authority commaunde would matter ronne better syde ye could shewe commaundemente came councel ye able shewe yet able shewe came induceth rather pope primacy especially considering praeam epist coc sort religious men monastery secu da syria doo offer vp booke supplication vnto emperour beseeching vvil commaund archebishoppe mennas president councel receiue booke vntruth false translatio considre synode anthymus heretiks vvherein also decreeth touching many ecclesiastical matter cause man rebaptize prophane holy communion cal conuenticles dispute matter concluded publishe set forth heretical bookes communicate knitteth vp vvith conclusion vvee haue decreed thinges common peace holye church tom co cil pa act co sta pa prima ergo est sententia quae consta tinopoli co tra anthimum lata est secunda autem sententiae quae constant fuit cotra seuerum petru zoaram terita co stitutio est ordinaria quarta autem actio hierosolymis et haec omnia mesib facta sancitae fuerunt thinges haue determined sentence stapleton goe horne euer like selfe brother iewel first beginne great vntruthe procede greate manye moe meane ye cal first fifte lette printer beare residewe ye must take vpon shulders first wher ye speake title ther title prefixed councel sentence dede title prefixed councel though ordination made councel tel matter cheif authority ordering thereof simple lie euer ye shoote farre come short home wordes rehersed yt followeth leaue ad petrum archiepiscopu hierosolimoru peter archebishop hierusale iustinia send co stitutio coucel coucel beig ended order sentence declared act coucel first sentece geue co stantinople anthymus sentence geuen seuerus petrus zoaras constitutio iustinian whereof ye speake made sente bishop hierusale kept also councel condened anthimus al done fowre monethes therfore yt ca true title coucel much lesse tel matter cheif authority euery man cunning make men weene egge chycke henne hatched yet one thinge commende telling v pope legats councel set right hande patriarche menas whiche suppose maketh somwhat pope primacye adde named appointed commaundement emperour commede vntruly saied pope owne legate deputy naming appointing emperours foloweth constitution iustinian tom conc pa b touching legate omnibus quidem ex italica regione ab apostolica sede nuper missis lately sent italy see apostolike like maner say theodorus maister requestes emperour call deliuered synod billes supplication considered consideration finde woordes theodorus finde say synode v interpellantes vos ipsis finem imponatis thentent meanes matter may ended cocluded emperours officer required synode would make ende complaintes layed certaine bisshoppes monkes conceale alter cleane simple consideration thoughe councel haue considered emperour concluded therefore yet one againe diuision tom conc pa col tel v booke supplication made monastery secunda syria emperour menna president councel receaue booke consider according ecclesiastical canon woordes author quae ipso insita sunt canonice finem accipere conuenientibus ad ipsum c content booke supplication ended determined cononically considered accorde menna whome name bisshop constantinople holy romaine holy synode thus false doctrine appeare commeth trial lode alwaies fardel vntruths nowe trowe shall quickly lese aduantage strayte ye bringe v foorth bisshop calleth emperour higheste potentate worlde next vnto god maintayning onely pure faith offeringe vnto god pure leuen true doctrine incense burning chaff meaning ye say false religion vnquencheable fier thinke horne yf iustinia lyued would take doctrine pure fyne flower rather stynking musty chaffe bran well haue hearde iudgemente parte alredy bsshop yf sayd al cause make hi say margin said wel towarde purpose nothing towarde truthe therefore ye hauing espied former wordes come iumpe purpose ye vndershore withe sayinge saied bisshoppe speakinge heretyke desireth emperour whome god reserued ful authority directe cut church expulse dominion ye al much nearer wherein good bisshop meante full direction selfe sheweth cutting away heretiks expulsing dominios therefore goodly marginal note god reserueth prince fulnesse direction cause ecclesiasticall quayleth worth rushe neither yt collected expresse woordes bishop yf yt sauing shrewd meaning mistaking yt greatly material might stad right wel meaning ful final directio executio ye lay forth many ecclesiastical costitutions among const haec decreuimus sanctorum patrum canones sequuti om c c pa haec sente auimus sequentes sanctorum patru dogma shal dispute matter religio ons concluded westmynster disputation themperour decreed thing sentence common peace church ye say truth truth ye haue falsly following accustomable humour left iij iiij wordes strayt way following haue saith iustinian determined thing following decree holy father wordes doe set self primacy quyt beside sadle thus theperours conclusion knitteth vp al knitteth vp conclusion ecclesiastical primacy vnfoldeth al false conclusios false boke yf ye take ioyne beginning said constitutio wynding vp yt matter wilbe much clearer clere iustinias costitutio self bring forth conc co stant act pag may serue sufficiet answere al boke co cerning prince intermedling cause ecclesiastical saith iustinia strage thig theperors haue ben accustomed vnto makig present law meaning anthimus tom conc synod act pag col rem non insolitam im erio no facie te ad praesentem veni nu lege quoties enim sacerdotu sententia quosdam indignos sacerdotio de sacris sedib deposuit que admodu nestorium eutychen arrium macedonium eun mium ac quosdam alios ad iniquitatem non minores illis toties imperium eiusdem sententia ordinationis cum sacerdotum authoritate fuit sic que diuina humana pariter concurrentia vnam consonantiam rectis sententiis fecere quemadmodum nuper factum esse contrae anthymu scimus qui quide deiectus est de sede huius regiae vrbis sanctae gloriosae memoriae agapeto sanctis ecclesiae antiquae romae pontifice eo quod c seuerus zoaras often bishop sentence haue deposed displaced holysees dignity vnworthy parson nestorius eutyches arius macedonius eunomius certain nawghty theperors folowing sentece ad authority decreed ecclesiastical ad teporal authority co curring together made one agremet right iudgmet euen knowe happened late touching anthimus thruste see imperiall cyty agapetus holy gloriouse memorie bisshop holy church olde rome horne diuision pag nothing may churche mater vvithout prince authority al thing thus done commaundement emperour first action foorth second third fourth many acclamation president councel mennas concludeth saying synod ignorat zeale minde godly emperour towards right faithe nothing moued church vntruthe double text ad margin standing false traslatio nihil eoru quae sanctissima ecclesia moue tur couenit fieri cocil p co ought without wil commaundement stapleton goe ye horne clerkly worke yf ye roundly hansomly proue ye may perchance set new head vpon iustinians shoulder yet woulde vgle monstrouse sight neither clerkly truely turne couenit yt mete semely conuenient oportet yt must ought maruaile ye bearing state bishop haue litle faith honesty dwelling nighe winchester schole litle sight grammer mennas condemned anthimus bishop cryed forwith codene seuer petrus zoaras whome mennas answered mete cosult themperour first true great zeale faith ad hadde exequution sentence lyke knacke dioscorus must deposed no sicut scit vostra charitas apostolica sedem sequimur obedimus ipsius commun catores co municatores habemus condemnatos ab ipsa no condemnamus act pag surely woulde haue meruayled yf mennas take iustinian supreame head within fowre lynes declareth pope supreame head followe obeye hi al thing comunicated communicate co demned whome condemne also gaue anthimus heretik tyme repentance appointed pope agapetus proceded se tence according prescription pope cyrillus epist coelest epi inter epist cyril cyrillus proceded nestorius ephesine councel according limitation pope celestinus horne diuision pag autority prince matter ecclesiastical godly auncient father confesse nothing moued church matter vntruthe godly father neuer confessed ought done vvithout authority also submitte theselues vvillingly vvith humble obedience direct godly emperor lavves vntruthe notorious impudent often auouched neuer proued cod lib tit al matter cause ecclesiastical vvhich thei vvuld haue done yf hadde thought prince ought haue gouerned ecclesiastical cause zelous emperour doth declare authority prince lavves doth rightly dispose kepe good order spiritual temporal matter driueth avvay iniquity vvherefore gather togeather vvere one heape tha lavves selfe made emperours touching ciuil temporal matter also manye lavves constitution vvhich vntruthe vvhich auncestours vvhich apostle father church made auncestours made ecclesiastical cause yea vvas nothing perteyning church gouernemente vvhiche prouide order direct lavves constitutionsnou co themperours ecclesiastical lavves vvherein may euidently appeare aucthoritie prince onely ouer person also cause ecclesiasticall made common generall lavve patriarch touching ordering bisshoppes clergie church minister prescribing number suche reuenues church may vvell susteine affirming care ouer church religious house lavve executio cost geaueth authoritie patriarche bisshoppe refuse reiect although great suit men much authoritie made prescribeth vvhat sorte vvhat ende churche good shoulde bestovved threatneth sorte order shal liue together vntruth churche prescribed order rule const prescribeth order rule vvherby choose ordeine abbat requireth monasticall personne diuinorum eloquiorum eruditionem conuersationis integritatem learning god woorde integritie life last chargeth archebisshoppes bisshoppes churche minister vvith publisshing obseruing constitution yea temporal officer iudges also diuine mystery vvherevnto addeth vvarning vnto mennas archebisshop knevv suche forbid refourme abuse suffer constitution emperour neglected broken selfe shal forfait emperour fiftie poundes gold const minister kepe continuall residence benefice othervvise bisshop place others roomes neuer restored stapleton shall nowe haue long rehearsall full three leaues many ecclesiasticall lawes made iustinian emperour would thinke horne eyther folishe make suche sturre man denyeth nothing proueth cause reherse constitution iustinian partely ouerthroweth primacy partly displaceth fro al bishoply priestly office shal man saye past shame haue regard say doe preach write world bewitched thus paciently suffer men sermon bookes const hoc aut futuru esse credimus si sacraru regularu obseruatio custodiatur qua iusti laudandi et adorandi inspectores et ministri dei tradiderut apost et sancti patres custodierut et explanarut sancimus igitur sacras per oia sequetes regulas c aut virginitate degens horn whether ye one lacke quality iustinia according holie rule canon ye spake requireth bishop must lose bishoprik also ordeined one quality bisshoppe haue maner wife ordered yea wife ordered priest muche custome alloweth geuen lawe wee commaunde geuen twenty poundes setteth rate ecclesiastical person degree according habilitie church concluding thus surely presume meanes take haue appointed cotemplatiue life saieth iustinian certeinly holy thing thing owne nature coducteth soules god neyther fruitful leade life puritye prayer god geueth sufficient help also wherefore themperours former time toke care matter also lawes haue set foorth many thing touching dignity vertue religious men doe followe holy canon holy father haue drawen certaine order lawes matter thing themperours maiesty doth throughly search whiche hath receiued god common gouernment principality ouer men nowe thys place ye see serueth expresly church principality whose holy canon holy father themperour sayeth doth reall presence christes bodie horne take ad madge good hede marke wel whether ye sect arrians generation whiche priestes contrary canon church thei mightely contemned ye kept company wiues yet haue read decree doe consent bishop costantinople saith george mercy god bisshop constantinople definitiue sentence haue subscribed sort bishop also set handes mater finally determined monothelites case subscriptio wil serue mater horne hath helpe hand yea hath gregory self saith comendeth richaredus gouernmet cause ecclesiastical set margent weighty mater foorthwith weighty richaredus called th accopt isidor liuing time gregory made pope yere accompt bede false say richaredus called councelles one onely councel yea false againe gouernement ecclesiasticall richaredus doings neyther word whole councel horn alleaged thing may good consequence induce gouernement say ye doe moste impudently going make reader belieue richaredus prince take supreme heades church till later day blasphemously calling pope mater childe perdition wel might cause haue called gregorie surnamed ye write great god wotteth pitie great fellowes al bookes writinges beare ful plaine testimonie pope singular praeeminence whiche thing place largely proued though matter semeth require somewhat said neede say thingsee article pag certain folovving onely remit reader place shal finde gregorie practised supreme authoritie wel spain throughout whole christened world saith gregorie forsothe king richaredus carefull continuall preaching brought arrians true faith gregorie saith wel yet wil trow say prince preached pulpit arrians verelye clergie godly promoter saied doe selfe preache conuert heretiques decree briefely gouerne cause ecclesiastical prince owne person owne authority neuer dothe furderance thing done saied sometimes saint gregorye doe selfe horne goeth craftely disgrace slau der saint gregorywe might passe next mater sauing ye without good occasion bettering cause bring richaredus woorked thinges without pope gregorie may feared ye haue woorse meaning ye doe altogeather craftely blemishe deface sainte gregorye ignoraunte reader el tell purpose write ye saint gregorye asshamed selfe greg li ep owne slacknesse bringe woordes sainte gregorye shall aunsweare dreadfull doome youre excellencye shall lead flockes faithfull one ye haue broughte true faithe careful continuall preachinges muste either refourme ignorance ye knew preuent reader circumuention wilye handeling mater like perchaunce miscaried ye knewe greg li epist admonish spoken gregorye deede proceeding maruelouse humilitye lowlines worthy doigs gregoriein like maner wrote sainte augustine oure apostle commendation doings wherein yet vndoubtedly great doer selfe many wayes historie bede clerely appeareth otherwise though richaredus doings gloriouse worthy perpetuall renoune nauclerus generat pa yet shal gregory match passe neither shal altogether voide worthy comendation concerning care refourming spaine repressing heresy either authority learned woorkes verely platina witnesseth meanes gregorie gothes returned vnite catholike faithe plat greg whiche appeareth time otherwhere spaine hearken farder nauclerus one ofte reherse booke writeth super beatus gregorius c beside saint gregorie compelled ligurians venetian iberian confessed schisme libell receiue decree councell chalcedo broughte vnitye churche reduced idolatrye partely punnisshmente partlye preaching brucians people sardinia husbandmenne campania good mightye authoritie writing ambassadours sente conueniente time sequestred bodye churche donatiste heretiques affrique maniches sicilie arrians spaine agnoites alexandria onely heresie neophites fraunce rising symoniacall bribe manye rootes spreade farre wide againste whiche valiauntlye foughte labouring mightelye queene brunechildis frenche kinges theodoricus theodobertus till lengthe generall councell beinge summoned obteined haue vtterlye banned accursed saith nauclerus country nede speake realme matter notoriouse good meanes studye carefulnes brought miserable idolatrie faith christe therefore venerable countreyman bede writeth maye well oughte call apostle gregorie apostle lib c recte nostrum appellare possumus debemus apostolum quia cum c saith wheras chiefe bisshoprike worlde chiefe ruler church long conuerted faithe procured oure nation time idol slaue church christ may well vse saiyng taken apostle apostle yet apostle seal apostlesship lord god appeareth gregorie doe ireland also ecclesiastical authoritie greg lib cap thus much haue spoken gregorie either necessarily suppose altogether without good cause surely without deape harte griefe consider farre gon learning vertue faith whiche nowe almost one thousande yeares past receiued blessed man handes altogether newe apostle horne heere nothing grosse ignorance blessed true apostle english nation better child perdition meaneth dede plaine antichriste pray god one open eye coutrie see dede true antichrist messenger forerunner thereby carefully christianly shun well one christ truth selfe selfe hath said nere antichriste teacher vntruthes huge number hath horne heaped v vppe hitherto hath bene answered litle third part boke yea diuision doe muster haue already ben touched rest large let v ouer runne diuision shortly againe first besides false translation putting repairing order ecclesiasticall disciplinem horn vntruths laid forth make new fourme thereof though king altered old religion realme placed newe neuer vsed christes churche horne fellowes haue done countrie beside pety sleight diuers noted hath maimed mangled wordes king richaredus wherein whole pithe diuision resteth make apparence pretensed primacie would lothe man see weary man expresse namely text note standeth prince speciall care subiectes tom conc pag col whole woordes king care king ought farre extended directed vntill found receiue full measure age knowledge worldly thing king power passeth glorie oughte care greater welth subiectes moste holy priestes bestow onely diligence matter whereby oure subiectes may gouerned liue peaceablye also helpe christe extend selues thinke heauenly matter labour knowe make people faithfull verely ought bend power order men maners princely power represse insolency euill ought geue ayde encrease peace quiet muche ought study desire thinke vppon godly thing looke high matter shew people brought errour trueth cleare light dothe whiche trusteth rewarded god aboundant reward dothe aboue comitted vnto doth adde seing said luc euer thou spendest come againe recompence thee whole ful talke richaredus king councel touching duetyfull care aboute religion compare gentle reader broken mangled narratio horne thou shalt see eye lewde pelting pelting lewdnesse thou shalt see king protested care god matter dew charge vocatio king additio aboue commytted wnto work supererogatio exteded selfe zeale aboue duety ad office required al horn left bycause knewe quite ouerthrowe purpose saieth againe kyng richaredus decreed councel owne authority commaundyng bisshops see obserued wordes also hath caused printed distinct lettre wordes author alleaged cocil tolet cap tom pag col owne wordes proceede owne authority found whole processe king oration councell cou cel selfe contrariwise councell expressely saith decree consultu pijssimi gloriosissimi richaredi regis constituit synodus synode hath appointed decreed aduise godly gloriouse king richaredus synode horne made decree aduise king vide gregor lib epist king made authority stapleton nowe good reader passed first sixe hundred yeares hauing answered horne argument proufes pretendeth serue thinges within yeares great doubte staye withe selfe order take residewe myne answere haue gone ouer litle one half parte horne booke wherein taketh vpon challenger apponente yf weighe nomber yeares horne taketh large race course yet remayne almoste thowsande alredy passed yf measure leaues almost one halfe rest behinde nomber beside remnante booke wherein plaith defendant parte speake thus much consideration yf shoulde largely copiouslye answere residewe haue begonne fullye vnfolde fonde folly confuting euerye point booke woulde wexe bigge huge syde yf lightlye breiflye passe yt ouer perchaunce horne woulde bragge saye coulde answered yet bethinkinge selfe well vppon matter compendiouse waye seemeth tyme beste wherein could shorte compendiouse one lyne shoulde sufficiently discharge selfe whole answere saying shortly truely one onely authority apte fyt coclude purpose coulde also shifte waye iewel fellowes groundeth self vppon yt good peremptorye exception might boldly say horne al proufes gregory come late yeres empted spente gone might truly seing latter yeares euer yt must yeld geue place father first sixe hundred yeares answere might contemning neglecting al long ragmans rolle hereafter followeth set vppon see valiantly wil defende owne heade sente vniuersall churche lawes prayeth gregorie onely preserue church rauenna peculiarly vnder rome olde priuileges also bestowe greater priuileges vppon wherein appeareth great vntruth foly withal superintendentes tel tale truly story theodorus archebisshop rauenna saieth nauclerus minding vpon christmas daye sonne risyng say masse apollinaris church forsaken al clergy vntil towarde noone came tyme meanes exarchus brought churche cause enmyty clergy bore nauclerus writeth great almes man liberal churche good also busy kepe clergy good order cause hated solemne daye vtterly forsoke trowe horne solemnely conducte maner lacke ordinary solemnity cleane destitute two thing difference knowe betwene staring starke blinde thincke selfe horne holy mortified woulde lothe shewe self swithens quyer winchester vpon christmas day al alone without one minister seely say leo secod made end hereof causing theperour iustinian shew great cruelty c grosse lie leo second pope constantins time father iustinian cruelty iustinia shewed whole city rauena death leo lest twety yers vnder costatine pope later end iustinias reigne restored banishment yet continuinge al former cruelty nauclerus writeth naucler generat p changed neuer whit former life excepted banishment euer shewed reuerence see apostolike otherwise banishmet wont therefore hearing felix bishop rauenna disobeied pope commaunded lieutenant sicilie punish dede cruelly barbarously accorde causing ignorantly affirme leo dead lest yers causing co stantine pope ought appeareth story therefore conclude pope leo commaundement power iustinian brought rauenna vnder obeissance pontifical reporteth belie pontifical whole storye tyme ignorantly pontificall dede saieth percurrente diuale iussione c commaundement emperour sent abrode church rauenna restored c iustinian nameth meaneth constantine emperour straight councel ended promulged edicte leo pope suche longe tedious mater open horne vntruthes horne diuision pag benedictus secod vvho succeded next leo second vvet point beyonde al predecessours constantin moued vvith vntruth sanctitate permotus moued vvith holynesse faith platina sabellic also humanity piety fauourablenes tovvards al vvhen sent theperour confirmation theperour sent saith platina decree henceforth loke whome clergy people romain army chose pope al men without delay beleue christes true vicar abiding confirmation themperour lieutenant wonte doen c wont allowed pope creation confirmed prince self vicegerent italy first al appereth story true hovve interest prince ecclesiastical matter thus continuing vntruth loger fro pelagius firste decree long tyme although many vvayes assailed many attemptes made pope shake vvas length flattery vvhich parasite cal humility geue vnto theperours vvhom apperteined vvhether story true vvere geuen hovv vvas geuen hovv long giftes toke place hovv vvas taken avvay retourned former right may vvell called question good vntruth good token ca beshewed token shevv vvas geuen sort tvvo pope vvho sat papal seat vntruth benedict sate one yere moneths pa taleon moneths peece vvere vntruth bened vvas much fauour agatho emperor fauour vvith theperour vvas predecessour agatho vvho made great suit vnto theperour like thing obteined suit vvith speciall prouiso reseruatio authority stil remain vnto theperors vvitnesseth pontificall gratian receiued emperour letter say accordinge petition wherebye somme moeny releassed wont bee geuen emperour pope consecration yf happen deathe anye election bisshoppe electe vitaeliani papae romae act fol coniectures whie horn hath made post hast doth yt appalle yowe heare patriarch constantinople al bisshops obedie saries bisshops vnder patriarche antioche heard readen letter sent pope agatho councel rome aduisedly co sidered haue tolde yowe stuffed authority concernyng pope primacy yelde truth yeares forsake abandon greate schisme false heresie doth dasel amase yowe heare patriarche constantinople confesse whole councel yf name pope vitalianus receyued againe theyre dypticha raced sondred ad sequestred selues catholike churche woulde forthwithe returne thyther againe whereunto emperour councell agreed therevppon councell made manie gratulatorie exclamation anie way stay redresse thys huge schisme englande else euen put churche bokes pope name imbrace againe hys authoritie doe ye take yt hart horne see pleadinge macarius heretyke also iewells ordinarie fasshion pleadinge vppon doings heretical bisshops emperours grounding hym self vpon nomber patriarch constantinople antioche diuers bisshops theyre councells yea vpon emperour father great graundfather teaching proclamatios quite reiected refused corsy vnto heretical writing macarius sone beganne read straight condemned bishop looking emperours pleasure therein though selfe present thereat act p act act fol col c sanctum synodus dixit ecce hoc testimoniu sancti patris peremisti congruit orthodoxis ita circumtruncatas sanctorum patrum vox destora haereticoru poti proprium hoc est humble reasonable requeste quenes maiesty ad councell yet anye lurking sore priuily pynching stomake namely ye see great greef father geue v assured marke knowe yowe iewel ye wretched wresting wrething miserable chopping paring auncient father writing wherein ye true schollers monothelites whose practises discried session allegation pope legats founde truelie faythfully semely done trowe nypped yowe verie hearte roote ye reade case ye euer reade yt haue trusted rather men eies owne synode say cursed vnhappie macarius property heretyke nyppe breake mangle mayme father testimony therevppon oft taken maner nowe cofessing forthwith depriued bishoply attierment plucked backe would god yt might please quenes maiesty honorable coucel play supreame head good emperour costantinus iudges make indifferet search vewe whether catholiks late boks iewel horn ad fellowes play macarias thervppo eue horn sayd theperour costantine geue iust iudgmet sentence redie sownde way quailing ad appeasing huge scisme without book wil excessyuely growe eche part rather encrease cotentio ful pacificatio part fault fownd dowbte nothing yt wil cofessed therevppon theyr part harty renuciatio al schisme heresie would wishe theire rich plucked shuld remaine good worldly estate al hurt wish nowe horn returne matter ye see poore iudgmet poore selie supremacy ye geue emperour ad noble wherin effect whil ye would seme aduace exalt ye make theyr office much better register notary office office though honest worshipful perchauce yet dowbte whether honorable many yeares past one fellowes protestat prelats sayd one thowed register tel thee regesters office honorable office welm iewel let yt honorable suppose shal make hym supreame heade churche withall hath horne argument great foyle horne diuision fol bishop clergy vvhich vvere prouince antioche vvhan macarius vvas deposed reader cosider horn dealing eue coucel haue ad shal declare whether horn doth altogether resemble macarius shameful practise allegatios one reason horn proue costantines supremacy antiochians sewed themperour appoint archbisshop place macarius appointment archbisshop imployeth supremacy diuerse king england haue appointed bisshops archebisshops realm yet none euer toke vpon either name authority supreme gouernour al cause ecclesiastical vntil miserable tyme heretikes authority prince establishe heresy haue spoiled god minister church dewe authority gouernement haue told horne costantin hath disclaimed supremacy supreame iudgement cause ecclesiastical wherof also next matter immediatlye rehersed thing alleage good sufficient proufe wil therfore demaunde question ye see macarius deposed confesse selfe iudgement synod might themperour kepe stil ad laufully bisshoprik would ye say might supreame head except ye wil say lawfully deposed heretike therfore theperour could kepe also yet maketh supremacy iudgemet bisshops aboue themperours power wil aske whether yf macarius bene hartely poenitent recanted heresy themperour might haue kept take hede ye brought streights way euer ye wind yf ye say may ye must yf ye wil haue themperour supreme gouernour al cause ecclesiastical whole cou cel act subfinem vtterly denying al hope restitution though iudges theperours comaundemet moued kinge kinges vvho hath bestovved earthly kingdome vvyse hath geuen therevvith mind seeke much heauenlye thinges pietye fruite mercy authoritye keper discipline prince minde ioyned godde bye subiectes receyue reformation disorder kinges ought haue muche care refourme correcte naughtynes amongest subiectes triumphe ouer enemy dooinge make authoritye subiecte serue bye whose gifte protection reigne vvherefore seinge holye mother churche body christe enioyeth meanes sincere principall childe inuincible soundnes therefore writen moste mercifull prince holye churche dispersed throughout worlde esai psal kinges shalbe thy noursinge father like sorte writen honour kinge loueth iudgement set much heauenly tha earthly thinges doe preferre without comparison right faith worldly care doe yowe herein legate humble seruauntes whiche sente vnto councell predecessour agatho commaundemet vvherfore thankes geuinge crie vnto lord lord saue christian kinge heare day calleth vpon thee whose godly trauaile apostolike godly doctrine religion shineth world horrible darkenes hereticall malice vanished away trauaile god assisting mischiefe wicked crafte deuill brought ouerthrowne benefit christian faith ministerie sake ye owe god chiefe rule gouernemet hath al point followed doctrin apostle approued father left see apostolike beati petri autoritate confirmat confirmeth vvith authoritie peter general councell doe deteste therfore curse al heretikes yea honorius also late bishop sea laboured prophanely betray subuerte immaculate faith holy churche mother faithfull arise put thy mourninge weede clothe thy selfe ioyful apparaile beholde thy sonne moste constant constantine al prince thy defendour thy helpe afraide hath girded selfe swoorde goddes woorde wherewith deuideth miscreauntes faithful hath armed selfe coate armour faith helmet hope saluation newe dauid constantine hath vanquished great goliath thy boasting enemy prince chieftayne mischiefe errours deuill careful trauaile righte faith hath recouered brightnes shineth thorough whole worlde stapleton al one leaf half nothing materiall may auoyded former answere touching pope honorius might yelde owne person heretyke accursed sentence themperour synode bisshop rome meane either pope head churchconcernig pope honorius horn maketh heretyke patres synodo romana nisi fide exorbitauerit quene england supreame head neither shal able proue collection bringe honorius heresy lyueth yf say haue alredy declared councell rome tyme kinge theodoricus councel yt self could iudge pope graunte yt neuer steppe backe yt muste maister horne take father assembled vnderstandinge withall onlesse swarue straye fayth ye nowe happelye replie aagaine say shal pope ye make vniuersall bishop whole churche direct sayde churche true sownde fayth self heretyke howe yt whole greater parte churche shall head miscarie also howe y yt true heard handes euen nowe churche rome neuer caryed away errrour fayth howe yt trewe ye sayd peter pryuilege onely self hys successours also ye make pope onely erre selues also confirme theire bretherne remoue errour answere case pope open lawe decree made consent brethern synod consistory promulged obserued throwghe christendomme set forth heresy reply good effectuall suche decree ye haue shewed euer shall shewe making suche lawe blessed hande god doth vpholde euer hath vpholden pope promise sake promise saye made peter owne priuat person safegard church otherwyse must nedes haue great wracke fayth rock head thereof shoulde publikly decree heresy case therefore pope pryuately close heretycke self without open setting forth proclaiming errour common lawe honorius heretike proprely called heretike pope church rome said haue erred neither inconueniences wil ensue ye brought foorth verely soeuer honorius owne person yet certein see rome tyme euer alwaies clere heresy yea ad contynual persecutor thereof tyme honorius self pirrhus patriarche constantinople bannished emperour heraelius afrike suyte churche rome platina plat honor sabel acnead lib tom concil gest theodori pag sabellicus testifie heresye also tyme theodorus pope within three yeres aboute decease honorius pirrhus came afrique rome recanted heresye pope therefore reconciled though afterward againe ad proprium impietatis vomitum repedauit retourned vomytte impietye pope also theodorus wrote paulus constantinople defender also heresye warnyng rebukinge thereof al tyme generall councell pope agatho therefore notwithstanding priuate erroure honorius whiche neuer taughte preached publiquely onely letter comming foorth name deathe surmised suche yet pope agatho letter redde allowed whole councell moste truely sayed predecessours kepte alwayes sownde vnuiolated faithe act cocil const pa c supreame vvoorker gouernour although vntruth mere sla derous ignorant verye superstitious vvoman vvill say vvoorse matter sonne vvas aboute tenne yeeres olde zonaras affirmeth vvhole rule although romayne empire especially preserue estate god holy church vvith possible care councell cause hath vvith paine gathered councel together geueth licece also liberty euery vvithout al feare vtter mind iudgemet frankely end truth may better appeare shevveth order obserued making tarasius bishop prescribeth vnto bishopps vvhat office ad vvhat doo propounding vnto holy ghospelles right vntruthe saied idola appellant anathema act fol et act fol fol horn councell declared heretique doth shame horne one name generall councell doth plainly accurse fellowes detestable saiyngs writing doings holy image call idol ye doe booke yf authority coucel furnished presence bisshops established cosente pope foure patriarch euer since catholike people latine greke church highly reuereced may take force know law eclesiastical may ought take force yf fellowes heretikes point onely according rule prescription emperour iustinians writing rehearsed euer shall heretike ye verye shame medle councel yea craue aide councel healpe erect newe papalitie vpon exceding shamelesse demeanour yet impudencie borne withal beside matter image also open euident testimonie pope supremacie synode certainelye councell chalcedo pope leo letter read sixt generall councell agathos letter read father receiued allowed highly reuerenced said letter directed towchinge matter fayth controuersed euen yt fared also letter pope adrianus sent theperour patriarche constatinople towching reuered image beinge proponed ad reade father vniformely ioyfullie codescede cotentes ful testimony therof act eche one set hys ad subscriptio sayd adria writeth tarasius patriarche costa tinople olesse wel knowen tarasius good syncere zeale ad catholike fayth touching image ad sixe general coucels would neuer haue cosented calling councell nequaquam ad synodum conuoca da cosentiremus dict act fol col b ibide fol col tripart lib cap theodoret lib cap wherby ye see horn pope hath voyce negatyue summonyng ratifiyng coucels drawe backe bene lawful councel according old canon alleaged ecclesiasticall story commaundeth without pope authorityte councel ought kept according cause diuers coucels abolished antiochian east ariminense west sayed pope adrian saieth tarasius vnde ipse beatus petrus apostolus dei iussu ecclesiam pascens nihil omnino praetermisit sed vbique principatum obtinuit obtinet cui etiam nostrae beatae apostolicae sedi quae est omnium ecclesiarum dei caput velim beata vestra sanctitas ex sincera mente toto corde agglutinetur saynte peter feding churche god commaundemet hath omitted nothing euer hath principality nowe hath whome blessed apostolyke see whiche head god church would wish blessed holines wythe syncere mynd withall heart ioyne self emperour hym self sayth councel called synodical letter sente fro apostle treateth hath apostle epistle pope asketh holines fatte bakon eaten pope answereth wel smoke dried resty sodde likewise asketh whether shall eate dawes crowes hare wilde horse pope biddeth beware wise also asketh howe horse haue falling sicknesse shall doe pope aunswereth hurle ditche asketh shall doe beastes bitten madde dogge pope biddeth kepe close hurle pitte asketh one nonne may washe others feete men may pope answereth yea goddes name also asketh howe many cross aboutes vntruth questio vvas othervvise shal appeare bodye man shoulde make greate manye suche like pope apostle horne heart remebring selfe wel canonically handeled beare muche lower saile beare either bisshoplye priestly office faring like mad speaketh wot nere euen egle eies findeth fault men blindnes sheweth desiderius passeth rome vvho pope receiued vvith great honour geuing part recompence title christian king augment beneuolence tovvardes charles desired sende bishop fraunce celebrate synode rome vvhere vvere gathered together bishop abbottes prelate vvhich coucel also carolus selfe vvas present saith martinus gratianus maketh report hereof churche history vvise charles vanquished desiderius made patricia capable emperial dignity furthermore decreed tharchbishops ad bishop euery prouice shuld receiue inuestiture none shuld cosecrate onles comeded ad inuestured bishop kinge vvo euer woulde doo contrary decree accursed except repeted goodes also cofiscate platina addeth charles pope romaine ad freche sweare one keepe perpetuall amity shuld enemy anoyed one chapter charlemayne adrian leo bishop rome stapleton adria vexed king desiderius throwgh hys owne furiouse pryde magnitudine animi consilio doctrina et sanctitate vitae cu quouis optimo pontifice comporari potest vertuouse learned man nothing follishe furiouse lying also promised charles make hym emperour would ayde helpe hym history saieth except horne pene history doth furder cause thys charles righte power electe pope inuesturing bishop seeing helde yt hys owne right tytle speciall gratiouse graunte pope hys synod self alleage nay verely one exaple cleerly destroyeth al imagined supremacy al shall bringe hereafter emperours claime electio ad inuesturing bishop diliget reader reme brig first original ad authority hereof sprong imperial right power pope special graunte made charlemayn first emperour west traslatio therof must also see al bring hereafter themperors claime behalfe proueth primacy prince rather pope authority facte proceded facte would proue primacy horne diuision pag longe charles perceiuing church muche molested dravvne partes vvith heresy foelix calleth councell al bishoppes vnder dominion italy fraunce germany co sulte conclude truthe bring church vnity therein selfe affirmeth epistle vvriten elepandus bishop tolet bishoppes spaine vvee haue commaunded sayth charles synodall councel deuout father al church thoroughout signiouries end one accorde might decreed beleued touching opinio know haue brought newe assertion suche holy catholike church old time neuer heard sabellicus also maketh mention synode vviche vvas conuocated frankeforth ad carolus edictum commaundement charles stapleton gere serueth nothing proue carolus called councell horne sayeth sabellicus also maketh mention synode couocated frackford also horn sabell aen li danata est haeresis de abolendis imaginib altogether superfluous seing ye named author spake thys synode sabellicus poste alone well let charles called synode ye tell v donne doth platina owne authour sabellicus also declaring suche iconomaches image breaker ye platina theophilatius stephanus episcopi insignes adriani nomine synodu franco ru germanorumque episcoporu habuere qua caet codemned heretyks ye tell v also cheif cou cell whiche theophilatius stephanus pope adrias legate appereth wretched dealing authour apologye hys duble lye aswell would thys synode proue generall councell maye abolished national saying councell abolishe seuenth generall councell whereas confirmed said generall councell like decreea duble vntruth englih apology abovvte synode strongest part apologie lyeth dust wheras chiefe principall parte deface councel trent shew priuate authority one nation publike comon authority generall councel might well inough abrogated could finde colour proufe councel franckford ye heare dothe infirme ratifie confirme nicene councell made honoring vilaining holy image horne diuision pag carolus magnus calleth commaundemente bisshoppes fraunce synode arelatum appointeth archebisshoppes instructe people vvith godlie doctrine exaumples lyfe vvhen synode consulted agreed suche matter thoughte fitte time decree doinges shoulde presented vnto carolus magnus beseeching anye defectes decree supplie wisedome anye thing otherwise well amende iudgemente whiche well vntruth cou cel vteius adiutorio perficiatur helpe mighte ended brought passe ratified authoritye ratifie aide assist agreed neuerthelesse allovved confirmed amended vntruth allovving dissalovvinge councel speaketh dissalovved councel referreth al ecclesiastical matter vntruth misreportinge councell iudgement stapleton calling councels either carolus others haue oft saied proueth supremacy neither confirmation coucels much lesse father desire self confesse good reader take hede horne would stilie make beleue charles councell bishop forbid landes goodes geuen church man soules helth praied deathe whiche deede councell forbiddeth men shal entised perswaded enter relligion geue good churche onely vppon couetousnes animarum etenim solatium inquirere sacerdos non lucra terrena debet quoniam fideles ad re suas dandas non sunt cogedi nec circumueniendi oblatio namque spontanea esse debet iuxta illud quod ait scriptura voluntarie sacrificabo tibi priest saieth councell shoulde seke helth sowles worldly gaines christian either forced craftely circunuented geue away theyr good owght willing offering accordig yt write wil willingly offer sacrifice thee next canon yt sayde hoc vero quod quisque deo iuste rationabiliter de rebus suis offert ecclesia tenere debet euer man hath offred vnto god iustly reasonably muste church kepe styl prayer dead ther special canon made cou cell euery masse shoulde prayer made suche departed owte worldeprayers dead yt declared owte augustyne thys gwise fasshion anciente church lyke sleight horne vseth touching pilgrimage whiche owne canon highly comendeth thowghe full wisely discreetly yt preuenteth reformeth abuse wherfore ye shall heare whole canon shifte worde fro latyn english former cano coucel forbadde priest shuld goe pilgrimage without co sent bishoppe rome towres towne france tombe reliques blessed martyn innumerable miracle donne wrowght amonge gregorius turonensis bishop faythfull reporter vncerteyne hearesay presente eiesight moste fully declareth whiche holy reliques hugonotes late frace haue moste vilany dishonored howe horne primacy become trust length ye wil discharge feke ham fro othe say yow owne volutarie allegation man forced yow vnto mightie truth bewraying false cause greate folly yet leaste sayde folly preuarication shoulde open saye somwhat yt maye seame worke thowghe miraculously yet wo derfully euer thys leo tong cut roote write could speake neuerthelesse ad though fowle lying mouthe pope primacy stopped true declaratio yet wil speake hys owne honour leo hys vtter cofusion ad shame forsoth sayeth horne charles toke thys answere lesse insufficient greauous wel sayde tyme horne sauinge yt moste vntrue ad ye lay forthe prouf shal ye neuer able proue yt yet ye coulde proue yt ye shoulde dooe none thinge whiche yee doe solemnlye rest youre booke proue proued doth yet nothing relieue cause
