nowe thowghe cause whie charles shoulde greaued whole clergie people wel lyked wer old aunciet president yet goe forth smothe tale withal shewe charles quietlie beare grief sone born none althe new ghospell stand defacing al antiquitie addeth lie whereof haue alredie somwhat spoken pope promised longe make emperour yea good horn sone sayd yowe sone proued neither authour platina sayth haue hitherto read phy wretched dealig ad wretched cause ye maintayne ca vpholde platin homo certe mitis genij vt omnes diligeret neminem odio haberet tardus ad iram promptus ad misericordiam defacing ad dishonorig clergie worthy ad self cal noble price charles withal would fayne procede next matter vntruthes must go also discouered yow say without prouf yea good prouf layd cotrary pope leo streight dealing hateful roma author sabellicus platina say quite contrary platina among manifold notable vertues telleth man myld nature loued men hated man slowe wrathe ready take mercie pitie sabellicus matter sayeth thus coniuratorum odium pontificem inde ortum ferunt sabel aenead quod illi liberius viuere assueti ferre nequiuissent grauem pontificis censuram saied hatred co spired spronge hereof accustomed liue licentiously coulde abyde graue rebuke censure pope nowe horne able denie aswell carolus gaue ouer iudgmet wold could geue agaist leo falleth quarellig leo owght haue comeded matter standing thus stepping forth lawfully proue thing agaist leo rhegino chronic cum nullus probator aut testis legitimus appateret good man thowghe man coulde force yt yet knowing owne innocency toke open othe vppon holy ghospel gyltlesse suche matter obiected horne beinge pleasantly disposed sayeth owte platina leo earnestlye desire kynde iudgmente addeth owne lying liberalyte platina mente leo desirouse geue sentence owne cause wheras platina meante leo desirouse vppon assured truste owne integritye matter might haue bene iudged worthie commendation woulde submitte cause iudgemente neaded symachus sixtus platina wordes qui id iudicium maxime expetebat nauclerus generat impress coloniae vnderstanded perchaunce copy id sene nauclerus seameth many place followe platina reherse wordes medle iustifying matter one way men say strypes may cause yong striplinges saye tonge thoue lyest truelie eye eie thowe lyest whiche lie whiche hys obiecte let goe saye yt none cause onely ye haue prayer addition perchaunce woulde best haue liked geneuicall minister layeth forth iniunction charles matter ecclesiasticall consider style maister horne supreame gouuernour head churche matter thinges ecclesiasticall deuoute humble mainteyner churche consider againe order doinges maister horne sette forthe iniunctions kepe clergie within vnder rule father whence trowe toke maister horne longe allegation charles constitution placeth towarde ende allegation margin ioan auentinus whome may seme toke later parte former part thereof whence euer horne hath fetched founde dede among constitution charles set forthe xx yeres paste sette though constitution charles yet owne proper lawe statute vide epitome constitut carol expressely alleaged aphricane councell vsed godly prince establishe canon churche owne constitution lawes councell whence charles toke constitution saied scripture onely shoulde reade church added vnder name scripture farder added also yearly festes martyr concil carthag passion reade thinges horne iewell great deale shamefully quyte omitted reply cole falsely make folcke beleue vide dist memoriam decretis q volumus vt omnes se fol churche scripture ecclesiastical matter cause presumptio vvoorde god dischardge princely duety learned example godly king commended therfore holy ghost also instruction best learned teacher time vvhereof greate stoare especially alcuinus englisheman great learninge vvho vvas chiefe scholmaister teacher vvhome martinus telleth charles made abbot tovvers amongst many notable volume thu alcuinus vvriteth one entituled de fide sanctae indiuiduae trinitatis vvhich moste meete knovv dedicateth charles emperour beginneth epistle dedicatory salutatio superscriptio thus seeinge emperial dignitie ordeined god seemeth exalted none thinge alcuinus gouern profite people therfore god doth geue vnto chosen dignitie power wisedome power suppresse proude defend humble euil disposed wisdome gouerne teache subiectes godly carefulnes vvith twoo giftes holy emperour god fauour hath honoured ad exalted incomparably aboue auncestours name authoritie c vvhat must carefulnes moste deuoutly dedicated god bringe forthe time peace warres finished people hasteneth assemble togeather proclamation commaundemet meaneth expresseth aftervvard assembly cocourse councel vvas novve hand assembled saith imperiali praecepto emperours precept waiteth attentiuely throne grace wil comaunde euery persone authoritie say ought doo determine al dignitie iuste thinges beinge ratified set foorth comaundement geue holy admonition euery man may retourne home mery gladde precept eternal saluation c least seeme helpe preaching faithe haue directed dedicated booke vnto thinkinge gifte conuenient woorthy presented vnto seeinge al men knowe plainly prince people ought necessitie knowe al thinges ovvn person rest preache thinges please god neither belongeth man knowe better moe thing emperour whose doctrine ought profite subiectes c al faithful hath great cause reioyce godlines seing haue priestly power mete bee preaching worde god perfect knowledge catholique faith holy deuotion saluatio menthe price hath priestlie povver sette forth god vvord doctrine alcuinus vvhich doubte vvas doctrine catholike learned father time confirmeth vvell doinges charles prince callinge councelles makinge decree geuing iniunctions ecclesiasticall person rulinge gouerninge vntruth euer auouched neuer proued ecclesiasticall thinges cause gouernement moste christian prince ecclesiastical matter vvel considered shall vvell appeare ordering disposinge church cause although thinges borne vvith considering vntruth slaunderous plaine contradiction blindnes superstition time stapleton content matter stande highe commendation charles commended inowghe whome councell kepte men commendeth euen horne reporteth godlie wisedome continual feadinge christ sheepe withe holie foodeal charles commedatio serueth nothing horne discome dation instructinge diuine knowledge farre passing thorowgh holy wisdome king earthe wise man would maruayle end horne hath heaped prayses thys emperour truly praised much truer greater prayse discommendation horne boke beinge directe contrarie doings belief charles matter certaynly true maister horne selfe denie yt beside appeareth contradiction whiche maister horne shal neuer shift away charging want pure knowledge whereof yet doth nothing else purge almost fowre leaues following together fol col one hauinge priestlie power preache worde god hauing perfytte knowledg catholyke fayth saying al catholyk learned father tyme confirme well doinges charles selfe dothe impugne mass chrisme poyntes catholyke religion consider thinges good reader well iudge indifferency blind bussardes horne spake note margent may suffred wel inowgh agreable texte onlesse yt sometyme good thinges worse comminge yl men handes priestly power alcuinus meaneth resteth poynte priestes theyre synodes preachinges set forthe true fayeth doe good prince set forth theire proclamation trowe say emperour self preached pulpyt gown surplesse cope rotchet poore soules driuen full againste willes doe note shrewde meaning charles farre supremacy euer yea nowe proue naucler generat q c volumus vbi allegatur liber theodosij vsual sort horne reasoning catholikes bishop thys tyme yea tyme greate theodosius allowed taken whole worlde thei neuer expressely plainely named man worlde space thowsand yeres tyme constantine maximilian able expresse name title ben simpler playner dealing horne haue said title yet found idem pa haue take longer daie againe title supreme gouernour al ecclesiastical cause thing deny ad horn hath take proue boldly auoucheth hath already plainly shewed yet one allegation found though woulde say al olde father church greekes latines wanted woordes eloquence either could durste call supreme gouernour peculiar name thus tyme constantine great charles haue ben christen emperours aboue beside greate nombre christen kinges spayne fraunce yea countrye constancy faith vertues knowledge far exceading rest haue ben sithence least wise iudgements condemne later age nombre beinge greate vertues noble power mighty merueyl horne able shew one long tyme much called intitled idem pag saluted proclaymed supreme gouernour al cause ecclesiastical last al supreme gouernement vnder basilius emperour stapleton goe still pope confirmation matter ye know nedelesse might spared sauing horne must take foile euen owne allegation glosar saith prince consente required election addeth nisi aliud suade scandalum vel praescripta consuetudo onlesse saith offence prescribed custome moue v thinke otherwise horne hand benedictus nexte pope woman pope iohan confirmed emperour horne man may doubt pointe whether benedictus next pope iohan neuer pope iohan could nexte rather fable storie al great busines apologie others make therein confut apolog fol thinke hath ben already sufficiently proued neither nede make much wondering matter except ye list wonder selues whiche doe place pope supreme authoritie prince men woman yea chyldren fewe yeares haue three man childe woman lesse meruaile bene many hundred yeres one woman pope yet sayed vtterly false hath bene sufficiently proued touching confirmation pope inuesturing bishop adrian leo graunted charles greate whych ludouicus hys sonne gaue ouer againe prince coueted haue owne handes againe denied gratian hath collected example sydes geueth forth true euident reason well one first graunted also afterwarde iustly denied fyrst sayeth dist electios pope bishop referred prince emperours custome lawe hath taught v dissensios schismatiks heretiks church hath ben defended oftentimes lawes faithful emperours election therfore clergy presented prince entet authority strengthened heretike schismatike dare gainsaie also end prince selues deuout childre shuld agree vpon sawe chosen father thing might aide assist example valentinian themperour ambrose saith emperour wil thy aide defence becometh degree herevpon pope steuen horne talked euen made decree without emperours legate present bishop alreadie chosen consecrated reason decree bishop reatina coulde consecrated horne euen alleaged saith gratian emperours passing sometime bondes would nuber cosenters ad agreers thelectio wuld first shuld choose yea ad put oftetimes also falling false heretiks assaied breake vnity catholike church mother therefore decree holie father haue proceded medle election bisshops whosoeuer obtained church voice excommunicated ezechias toke awaye brasen serpent whiche moyses set vp abused constitution forefather sometime chaunged authoritie posteritie constitutios mere positiue abused gratian bringeth diuers good authoritie thus see horne owne authours good reason ye haue grace consider sufficiently answered confirmation pope inuesturing bisshops common matter booke yet see nowe matter weight world horn hand raining bloud three day many wonder time yea deuil selfe bewrayed priest lemmans whiche kept corner secrete horne fellowes ashamed kepe openly haue learned furder lesson priestes age knew frier nunne may laufully wedde wherat deuill selfe perchaunce doth much wonder maister horne doth wonder deuils straunge doingsm horn vvonderful vvisedome yet strange much wondered perchance great wisedom confirme vvitnesseth nauclerus time emperour lodouicus rome confirmed pope election also sayeth martin vvhich volateran addeth emperour pope de communi consilio ambo cuncta gerebant al thinges done common counsaile consent emperour pope least might thought meaneth vvel ecclesiastical temporal matter sabellicus maketh matter plaine affirming emperour pope secrete confer nce together many day consultation touching matter perteining christian religion also state italye litle talkinge pope pope decreed consente lodouicus thence foorth prince emperour selfe present councell clergye onlesse principall pointes faith treated hitherto ecclesiasticall cause emperour hath doinge vntruth neuer well pope vvell pope last decree allovvance emperour pope made exempteth temporall prince ecclesiasticall matter councelles though principall matter ecclesiastical concerning faith leaueth vntruth matter fayth emperours interestes gouernemet interestes stapleton horne hym self helpe matter forwarde bringeth forth decree made pope themperours consent lay prince present coucels onlesse principall pointes religion treated wondreth thing vnheard yet mought haue found much actes councell chalcedo act fol yea myght haue sene also decree well people prince might present much interest one thereyn pope nicolas sayed dist vbinam geuynge reason prince may present matter faith debated faith common perteineth well layitie clergie yea christen men without exception yet gone sayeth horne interestes still sayeth principall matter ecclesiasticall concerning faith intereste praye tell v determine define anye thyng determination voyde frustrate without nay might present eyther keepe quiet order el constantin marcian protested ad confirmandam fidem strenghthen owne faith last execute sentence determination bishop theyr ambassadours present late general councel tret emperour kinges wished selues horne diuision pag martinus secod gat papacie mali artibus naughty meanes saith platina ad noted marget vvas pope time first creation pope vvas made vvithout emperours authority pope died shortely came naughtily vvho adria third like vnto predecessor secod name vvho cuning sleight practised vntruth slaunderous shall appeare defraude emperour authority espying oportunitie reason charles emperour sabellicus saith vvas farre busied vvarres dothe promote matter decreed senate people immediatly vvas made bishop ad persuadeth doo hereafter vvayte emperours approbatio cofirmation appointing bishop kepe theselues ovvn fredome vvhich thing also nicolaus firste vvith others attepted coulde bringe passe platina reporteth vvho also vvriteth romaynes co ceiued hope great liberty hauty courage pope romaine borne great griefe vvithin vvhile vvas take fro stapleton horne hath sone done nicolaus first fro leape martinus secod betwene two yet ij pope adria secod ad iohn time also regimet twety yeres vnder especially vnder nicolaus first ad adria second great matter passed touchinge present purpose vnder pope el many yeres vnder thys nicolaus firste adrian second general councell kept constantinople vnder basilius emperour east partes matter horne councels general nationall diligent chronicler hath vtterly drowned silence yet might iwys haue found much apparent matter purpose councel hytherto mentioned basilius emperour called also councell emperours dyd horne might haue furnished booke ioyly talke emperour also made bishop beginning councell touching care endeuour ecclesiasticall matter padde strawe warrant made horne agast bold one come nere cusanus lib cap de co cordia catholica ignorant thereof coulde hauing sene cusanus de concordia catholica alleageth booke large place booke ad fiue chapter aboue place wher cusanus reherseth viij generall councell diuerse longe process shew purpose emperour basilius dealed demeaned selfe coucel ignorant therfore fol ex li cap say matter could laye excuse actes coucel commonly set forthe former tome councelles except horne alleage bookes chapter neuer sawe read tom fol colon impr praesente vttereth doctrine vpon heresaye reporte others shortly therfore touche general councel also seing maner bothe generall nationall somewhat hath bene sayd ad seing councel also set forth last editio tome fewe wordes declare pope primacy east church haue bene confessed laye prince primacy ecclesiastical matter haue ben none first wheras michael emperour east partes man geue al licentiousnes ryot thrust godly bishop ignatius see constantinople zonaras lib persuasion bardas whome incest bisshop excommunicated placed roome one courtyars otherwise heretike photius name whome pantaleon calleth phoca photinus nicolaus first pope rome legacy fro excommunicated photius michael emperour restoring ignatius see tom conc pa extat lerned notable letter nicolaus michael emperour lernedly copiously discourseth obedience reuerence catholik emperours haue shewed bisshops rome howe none heretikes schismatikes haue disobeyed whereas emperour michael saith commau ded pope sende legate constantinople aboute matter phrase horn make much pope lernedly trulye aunswereth catholike good emperours wonte commaunde bisshoppes pastours especially bisshoppes see apostolike reuerence exhorte desire suche thinges required proueth example dist victor honorius epist praeambu coc chal valentinian marcian cod de sum trin no reddentes iustinian conc const constantin conc nice constantin fift letter bonifacius first leo first iohn first donus agatho pope rome al letter thei vse word petimus hortamur inuitamus rogamus beseche exhorte inuite desire gentlenes reuerece apostle comaudeth al shew ouerseers watche soules shal geue accopte heb also whereas emperour councell bisshoppes banished remoued ignatius pope first sente legate examine matter freshe referre pope vnto see constantinople right appertayned wherein legate passing commission ouercome flattery ambition courte constantinople confirmed photius consent pope consenting thereto cyted bothe ignatius pontius rome iulius cyted athanasius tripart li cap eusebius complices required emperour michael good ayde fauour might appeare letter also declareth howe dede amonge ethnikes emperour also summus pontifex highe bisshoppe saith nicolaus cum ad verum ventum est eundem regem atque pontificem tom conci pa vltra sibi nec imperator iura pontificatus arripuit nec pontifex nomen imperatorium vsurpauit christ true king bishop came neither emperour tooke vpon high bisshops right authoritye neither high bisshop vsurped imperial title example constantin great calling bishop god iudged man theodosius younger charging lieutenant candidianus ephesine councel medle matter question doctrine hath bene alleaged maximus blessed martyr constans heretical emperour nephew heraclius put death proueth theperorus iudgement ouer bishop ought force zonaras lib pag therfore cocludeth ignatius deposed emperial sentece al deposed remained true bishop thus dealed nicolaus first michael greek emperor vsurping new authority self following herein example holye auncient bisshoppes requiring emperour moste godlye noble progenitours catholike emperours hadde done coulde haue place maister horne chronicle either hadde reade farre el sleightes woulde haue bene grosse haue picked hereof coulourable matter imagined supremacye vnder adrian seconde nexte successour nicolaus vide sanctiones ecclesiasticas collectas franc iouerio impress par vnder basilius emperour nexte michael holden constantinople aboute matter ignatius photius principallye generall councell accompte latines councell legate adrian donatus stephen bisshoppes marinus deacon president generall councelles firste action pope letter emperour reade wherein condemneth former synode vnder michael willeth monimentes recordes thereof burnte beginninge also synode emperour basilius made oration synode cusanus lib cap de declarynge wythe zeale loue vnytye god churche hadde called together exhortinge many wordes concorde agreement confessing also potestatem synodici iudicij diuinitus acceperunt concord cathol tom cocil pag edit postr haue receyued god commission power authoryte iudge synod addeth farder though doubted altogether zealed truth folowed righteousnes yet saieth thentent may appeare imperial maiesty secundum datam sibi potestatis suram ecclesiasticis negotijs nihil tacuisse eorum quae debent atque conueniunt hath ecclesiastical matter cocealed thinge dewe conuenient according measure power geuen vnto deposcimus religionem vestram c beseche religion godlynes ouercome nowe al affection partialyte hatred resemble much possible immutable vnchangeable nature god neuer respecteth person c oratio emperour three thing woulde note beare well away horne first bishop confessio haue power god iudge determine coucels power authoryty herein procedeth prince commission supreme gouernour next vnto god aboue bishop ecclesiastical matter fro god self saieth emperour secodly themperours power limited power chief supreme ad highest maner cause ad thinges thirdly howe limited forsothe commaunde prescribe bisshops shall doe decree determine ecclesiastical matter exhorte concorde vnyty seconde action diuerse photians offering vp libelles repentaunce synod themperour deputyes synod impositio handes reconciled third fourthe action diuers letter reade wel michael basilius emperours pope nicolaus adrian also pope againe touching condemnation photius intruded michael restoring agayne ignatius fifte action photius brought pope letter conteyninge condemnation reade vnto whole synod cryed recipimus haec omnia c receaue al thinges bicause agreable reason ecclesiasticall rule lawes action also pope legate called president councell sixt action photians appearing agayne moued well whole synod emperour repentaunce yet perseuered obstinately schisme wherupon emperour gaue seuen dayes deliberation time meane recociled bad appeare againe saying ventura sexta feria sanctum vniuersali synodo state omnes quicquid definierit vniuersa synodus fiet next friday present holy vniuersal synod ad whatsoeuer vniuersal synod shal define coclude shal done agayne see emperour iudgeth matter hand cusanus li c coucel yea saieth plainely restoring ignatius deuise longe holy blessed pope nicolaus examining matter thouroughly decreed synod restored right see agayne together holy romayn churche pronounced anathema suche resiste decree sentence knowing saieth emperour fearinge haue iudgement curse promulged obsecundare synodico iudicio romanae ecclesiae necessarium duximus huius rei gratia reddidimus ei proprium thronum haue thought necessary obeye synodicall iudgement churche rome cause haue restored vnto owne see authoryty sentence churche rome emperour east churche dayes action saieth yet farder hoc solum nostrum est si voluerit quis nominare crimina alia vero omnia canonibus quibus imperiu synodi creditu est tradimus parte man bring forth crime make anye accusation see put vp councell c thinges leaue canon whome rule synode co mitted bishoppes hearde saie vnto thus muche action seuenth action photius appearinge agayne marinus one legate commaunded staffe taken token bisshoplye estate dignyte libro c h rtatorie alloquitur vos imperator action cusanus recordeth bahanis emperours lieutenant much talke withe photyans hortatorie waye exhortation mouinge vnytie repentaunce onely shifte photyans say legate patriarch present commission condemned cotrary patriarch willes iudgementes vpon emperour offred whosoeuer would stand surmise prouision sent patriarch selues rome antyoche hierusalem lerne truthe refused doe length emperour seing obstinat full word purpose sayed omnes nouimus quod laici estis non adduximus vos latrare sine ordine facere verba knowe laye men brought hither barke talke order emperour saieth cusanus called therefore laye men ordered photius selfe bisshop felowes horne bishop mere laye person ordered none selfe ordered whereas one photians eulapius name beganne talke emperour legate see apostolike sayed eulapius condemned excommunicated see apostolike therefore emperour ought talke emperour sayed haue oftentimes much desired might perish therefore called hither returne church whatsoeuer patriarch shall iudge shall nill stande vnto man reiecte power geuen meaneth high bisshops christ god sauiour thus agayne see maister horne howe iudgement resteth bishop iubet imperator vt loquamini sed videntes iudices conuicia vestra nec audire vos volunt howe sentence see apostolike preuayleth howe buxomely vse owne worde obediently emperour yeldeth thereunto intermedling farder procure partes may heard tumulte may auoided iudges bisshops called actio may quietly procede setence last al setence may put executio notwithstanding indurat malice obstinat heretikes action al schismatical conuenticles photians condemned recordes thereof burned action also diuers image breaker came synode reconciled secte also againe accursed last action canon reade pope legate commaundement dist nullus number canon decreed secular prince intermedle election choyse patriarche metropolitane bisshop whatsoeuer also inserted gratian decree finally councel ended basilius emperour maketh longe notable oration synod cusanus lib c expressing dewe zeale dewty emperour al synodes councels auoucheth plainly secular laye men non est datum secundum canonem dicendi quicquam penitus de ecclesiasticis causis opus enim hoc pontificum sacerdotum est graunted rule churche speake thinge al councel ecclesiasticall matter worke saith bishop priestes comme ding bishop greate paynes trauaile councell speaketh laye nobylyte present thus de vobis autem laicis c touching lay sorte wel beare office priuate men haue say vnto lawfull meanes moue talke ecclesiasticall matter neither resiste point integrity churche gaynesaie vniuersal synode searche seke matter belongeth bisshops priest beare office gouernours haue power sanctifie binde loose haue obtayned keyes churche heauen belongeth v ought fedde haue nede sanctified boude loosed bande whatsoeuer religion wisedome laye man yea though indewed internal vertues longe lay man shal cease called shepe againe bisshop howesoeuer vnreuerent naked vertue longe bishop preacheth dewlye woorde truthe suffereth losse pastorall vocation dignitye haue doe standinge yet roome shepe shepheardes haue power discusse subtiltye woordes seke compasse thinges aboue v must therefore feare sincere faith harken vnto reuerence countenance ministres almightye god bearinge fourme seke belongeth degree vocation thus farre emperour basilius ende conclusion eight generall councell much sense longe inserte blame nowe maister horne ouerhipped whole generall councell doinges ij pope nicolaus adrian sawe perhaps hearde say made clerely yet sayed apparently might haue culled broken narration purpose well generall councell seing tooke paynes note themperors demeanour former thought poynte courtesye maister horne requytte againe one generall councell manye alleaged verye small purpose euery indifferent reader seeth whether purpose dare make selfe iudge nowe wonder shifte make auoyde authoritye generall councell emperour basilius well maye good leasure thinke deuise vppon wil nowe returne text saye martinus seconde whome trulye call marinus gat papacy naughtye meanes maketh proue supremacye laye magistrat noted saie margent platina pope tyme first creation pope made without emperours authoritye shoulde haue tolde v withall printe platina note founde haue sene platina collen printe venyce print sette forthe note onuphrius yet finde suche note margent like note brotherhood copie printed basill good authoritye maister horne owne booke god wote course whose euers note dist cu longe princeps non aduocatur ad electione facienda sed ad co sensum electioni adhibendam false note hundred ten bisshoppes rome marinus scarse fourthe parte confirmed emperours emperours tyme neuer created pope onelye consented creation election made clergye confirmed quyet sake preseruation vnyty haue shewed adrian decree people rome shoulde wayte emperours confirmation defraudinge themperours right vntrulye reporte renewing olde liberty priuileges dewe churche order canon councels whiche neuer came emperours pope owne grauntes decree namelye adrian first leo hath appeared therefore agayne reuocable without iniurye done prince weale churche requyred tyme frenche emperours busyed warres sarracens carefull ecclesiasticall peace vppon respect whereof co firmation pope graunted theyr predecessours negligence encreased fewe yeares shall anon see lefte protection see apostolike loste also empire cusanus lib c transferred germains otho first apperteyn bishop without worde prince supreme gouernement thinges church horne diuision fol b pope follovved formosus stephanus romanus benedictus leo christophorus sergius great company historian geue homely testimonie nauclerus saith satisfie voluptuous lustes maliciously malice one another cruel tyrantes added reason cum non extarent qui eorum vitia coercerent bicause none correcte chasten neither vvere suche mosters nauclerus termeth pope continued space vvere prince authoritie suppressed therfore nauclerus citeth platina affirmeth true cause monstrous rebelles churche vvas quod resp apperteined princely auritie graunte cometh nothing nere purpose scope prefixed ouersee care prouide good order christes churche redresse punishe remoue inordinate euilles therein stapleton horne nowe russheth withe bedroll certain naughty pope formosus iohn amog marueyl recken benedictus gener pag whome nauclerus writeth thus huius benedicti laus est quod intam corruptis moribus grauiter constanter vitam duxisse feratur commendation benedictus corrupt maners men saied haue liued grauitie constancie namely great humanitie clemency chosen much merueyle amonge many badde speake neuer worde good namely anastasius writen nihil habuit quo reprehendi posset pag man could charged nothing pag leo nihil tyrannicum prae se tulit rei diuinae consulens shewed tyranny behauyour attending vpo god seruice steuen whose lyfe full gentlenesse religion pag ibidem pag leo steuen bothe commended pope martyn folowed also gentle demeanour steuen agapetus writen haue ben vir innocens reip christianae feruens amator saxo gra lib innocent man feruent tenderer christian commo wealth also kyng denmark receyued faith good vertuouse pope great affliction wicked person day lacke dede iustice good emperours lyued ruled church betwen formosus iohn twenty yeres horne like fowle sowe nouseleth donghil careth fayre floures garden nouseleth selfe amonge euyll bisshops abyde speake one poore imperari bicause vntruth false traslation king emperour beare rule vntruth sab meaneth thig meaning although vvere kinges emperours yea execute princely office authoritie ouerseing correcting reforminge churche matter mynisters therefore state vvas miserable confusion vvere thinges especially church rome till god stirred vp vvyse mighty prince otho first vvhose zeale stoutnes trauayle reforming religion disordred churche tongue able expresse saith nauclerus stapleton make sabellicus saie great deale euer saied intended say doth certaynely ascribe cause pretend saieth immerito quis suspicaretur may ad without cause suspecte horne pope kept euill rule geuen al lewdenesse bicause emperours ouersee woulde haue folke think sabell aenead lib therefore make sabellicus conclude calamyte fraunce italy churche rome quod ea gete desitum esset imperari bicause kig emperour beare rule false translation maketh proufe knowe horne ea gente doth signifie english may finde faulte grammer slacked honesty farre leaue english thereof quyte pad strawe sabellicus saieth cause calamyte bicause kinge emperour beare rule ea gente stocke line charles great whose posterity hitherto lineally reigned downe arnulphus last mentioned emperour last dede opinion historian charles lineal descet dede churche great trouble disorder space yeres howe euil pope cause disorder woulde horne folowing herein steppe baudy bale thinke haue noted compasse yeres diuers good vertuous pope ruling churche twenty yeres cause al disorder euil life certaine pope much licentious lewdenesse italian especially roman tyme dede lacke iustice emperours partes thinge sabellicus co plaineth liued enormously licetiously makig king amonge themselues oppressing one also moste vily cruelly handlinge vexation trouble cause al trouble churche tyme yf liste shortly knowe gentle reader sabellicus agreing herein historian wil clerely tell saieth quantu francorum pietate c looke howe muche rome italy breathed alonge continuace misery aenead lib godlynes bountifulnes frenche prince charles issewe one whole age almost yeares much fell backe againe kinde calamytie space almost yeres ciuil sedition vnto ottho humblie beseching haue compassion church vvhich vvere spedilie refourmed must needes come vtter decaie vvhom came bisshoppe millaine one great manie moe making suite vnto ottho vvho moued ovvne zeale god glorie novv enflamed lamentable supplication bisshoppes rex pijssimus saieth luithprandus non quae sua sunt sed quae iesu christi cogitans moste relligious king hauinge carefull vvise vvith suche humilitie behaued selfe tovvardes emperour shevved suche faire face repentaunce vvell meaning emperour thought meant pretended svvare pope obedience loyaltie berengarius adalbertus ouer reached practised vvith adalbertus depose godly emperoure promised othe aide reason cause iohn pope shoulde hate moste godlye emperoure deliuered handes adelbert ennemie wherefore deuill shoulde cause absence church enformed bisshops cardinales priestes deacon whole people shameful doings asshamed rehearse whereof parte charge vntruth part sente ce leaft murder periurie sacrilege incest pray repaier vnto v selfe pope vvriteth ansvvere heare saye ye make pope ye attempte excommunicate ye may haue licence power order c short ansvvere emperour vvith synode replieth telling vvritten let vnderstand crime vvherevvith vvas charged sent si horne ansvvere fecke ham great part ansvveare rather became folly childe grauitie bisshop povver bind ng losing say one iudas vvhom vvas saide quaecunque ligaueritis super terram c vvhat euer ye binde earth shalbe bound heauen c novv hath povver emperour synod vntruth luithpra dus shevveth thinge iudas vvhen vvent betraie christ maister letter vvere sent vnto tvvo cardinalles vvho returned finding therfore synode procedeth deposition beseche emperour remoue monstrum illud monster place vvorthy bisshop roome tune imperator placet inquit quod dicitis request pleaseth saith emperour clergie people saith nauclerus doth make humble supplication vnto emperour prouide vvorthy bishoppe vvhom emperour ansvvereth choose selues one hauing god eye ye may iudge worthie wil confirme emperour sooner spoken saith luithprandus vvith one assent named leo emperour gaue consent et ottho imperator leonem creat pontificem ottho emperoure created leo pope sabellicus platina saith luithprand tell th large hovve creation leo emperour dissolued synode vvhat mischiefe monstruous pope iohn vv ought aftervvard friend rome pope leo vvas driuen avvay monster vvas deade romaine elected benedictus place requireth emperoure vvho vvas spolet confirme emperoure vvoulde compelled receiue leo againe heere emperoure summoned againe nevve synode vvherein vntruthe pregnant neither emperour deposed benedictus pope leo selfe neither doth platina nauclere sabell make mention synod called themperour thereaboute dist satte selfe canonicall deposition benedictus notvvithstanding sayth nauclerus leo vveary inconstancy romaine constitute consent synode holden rome vvhole authority chosing bishop shuld remayne emperour rehearsed decree vvordes synode rome church holy sauiour lyke adrianus bisshop rome graunted charles great dignity patricianship ordering apostolical sea inuesturing bishop also leo bishop rome seruaunt goddes seruautes cosent cleargy people rome doo constitute confirme corroborate apostolicall authority wee doo graunt geue vnto lorde ottho first king dutchme successours kingdome italy euer authoritie elect v ordeine bishop vntruth sumae soedis apostolicae highest apostolike see leeft rome archbisshops bisshops receiue ought inuesturing consecration excepting emperour hath grauted pope archebisshops vntruth vnde debet vvhence appertayneth left man hereafter dignitie relligio euer haue power elect one dignitie cosules bloud bisshop vntruth sumae highest lef agayne apostolike see make bisshop without themperours consent chosen bisshop without comeded inuested king wise co secrated vnder paine excomunication sabellicus noteth renovvmed matter right creatinge pope vvas novv restored emperial dignity euen nauclerus affirmeth godly imperour otho borne totius ecclesiae consolatione consolation whole churche chapter otho first emperour iohn leo pope romae stapleton declaration runneth vppon deposition naughtye pope iohn moste men call synode rome emperour otho present onlesse horne shewe emperour toke hym self supreame head cause ecclesiasticall temporall vtterlye renownced pope supreamacye case standynge thys pope wycked man freelie confesse vnworthy see yet horne farre iustifiing matter wherin eue hys owne author story haue bene vtterly ouerthrowen yf made therof true faythfull reporte ye shall heare v hys owne chronographer ye shall haue good cause astonied see shamefull impudente dealing thys man first begynneth notoriouse lie neither thys cardinall whome luithprandus calleth iohannem maister rolles whome calleth aronem vide naucleru generat pag sequet summus pontifex et vniuersalis papa luithpra dus lib reru per europam gestarum cap naucler generat pag vide trithemium scrip chronograph pantaleonis luithpra di ticine si ecclesiae leuitae um ab europae imperator gestaru historiae liber c bishop millain others named sente complayne vppon pope iohn otho sente hym iohn pope hym self iohn hys authour luithprandus calleth highe bishop vniuersall pope humbly beseacheth hym woulde vouchsaufe loue god holye apostle petre paule would wishe forgyue hym hys synnes deliuer hym churche rome hym committed tyrannye berengarius adelbertus wheruppon themperour gathered army commyng italie spede expulsed kyngdome italy sayde tyrant yt seamed euidente ayded assisted moste holy apostle peter paule noted afterward anoynted crowned emperour sayd iohn though vicyous swore also obedie ce vnto nauclerus writeth farther restore hym thinges wherof spoyled honored hym also greate reward aswell golde siluer precious stone toke oth pope vpo precious body peter shuld neuer ayde assist sayd beregarius adelbert horne nedelesse enforceth credit author liuing yea anaunceth famous writer deaco cardinal wheras far boke sheweth farre trithemius pantaleon report deaco cardinal rome deaco church ticinu otherwise called pauia italy onlesse perchauce cardinal cardinal amog pety canos poules londo like truth ye say horne ij line pope practised adelbertus depose emperour author speaketh much onlye pope promised foresayed adelbertus helpe againste emperours power affirmans se illu co tra imperatoris potentia adiuturum dict ca tell ye smaller distincte letter truely inough altogether confusely iohns doings writing author haue good experience ye shewe whome wordes spoken ye say emperour called councell italie depose authour sayeth notm horn confuse vvritig three dayes themperour bene rome pope adelbertus fledde thence greate assemblie peter church rogantibus tam romani episcopis quam plebe desire well italian bishop people whiche councell presente beside bishop many noble men pope ranne away bicause councell vntruly reporte iij dayes fled adelbert coucel called depose hym call hym answere appereth emperours owne oration benedictus rehersed dyuerse theis horryble owtragies ye specifie themperour councell sent hym purge hym self letter sent emperour ye dissemble many thinges dismember cap quod no ecclesiae vestrae vestrique defensores etc tytle theperours letter whiche summo pontifici vniuersali papae iohanni otho c highe bishop ad vniuersal pope lord iohn otho forth asked cause absence ye would see v church defensour againe oramus itaque paternitatem vestram obnixe venire atque hijs omnibus vos purgare non dissimuletis si forte vim temerariae multitudinis formidatis iuramento vobis affirmamus nihil fieri praeter sanctoru canonum sanctionem earnestly pray fatherhode ye forslow come purge selfe yf ye feare violece rude rashe people promise vpon othe nothing shal done contrary decree holye canon ye rehearse pope short answere yet short doth wonderfully trouble ye dare fully recite hea saie saith iohn ye wil make pope ye attempt excomunicate ye may haue licence power order saie masse true ye saie afterwarde councell desired emperour said iohn might remoued emperour answered yet ye leaue part answere might found rule holy vniuersall see hovv ad vvhat sorte emperour doo vvith pope deposition cap neither desire emperour thing el assistace remouig neither proprely speak otherwise cosenting assisting themperour create pope leo appeareth author saying al saied one voice leone nobis pastore eligimus vt sit summus vniuersalis papa romanae ecclesiae doe electe leo pastour high vniuersall pope roman churche doe refuse iohn renegate hys wycked behauiour wich thinge beinge thryse cried owte caried palace lateran annuente imperatore themperours consente peter church consecrated swore would faythful vnto thys election people also theyre consente aswell emperour ye make thys election platte forme election nowe englande speras imperator cu paucis se romae degere posse ne consumeretur populus romanus ob multitudine exercitus multis vt rediret licetiam dedit quumque hoc iohannes qui deietus est papa cognosceret etc nexte vntruth narration ye say luithprandus sheweth howe emperour dissolued councell speaketh worde dissoluing councell gaue licence many hys souldiers departe vppo wich occasion pope iohn maketh new hurly burley benedictus whome ye speake set vppe iohns place iohns death roman thrust owte leo restored againe whiche benedictus deposed perour cap nauclere generat pag platina bened leone benedictu sanctae et apostolicae sedis romanae inuasore omni pontificatus presbiteratus iure priuamus ob elaecmosinam vero domini imperatoris etc cuius opera sede debitam restituti sumus diaconatus eum ordine habere permittimus non iam romae sed exilium destinanamus luithpra cap coucel ye speake neyhter emperour sommon councell depositio fine force constrained romaine admitte leo ad sweare vnto nauclere platina write take matter pope hym self gaue sentence hym deposed hym depriued hym well hys vsurped papacie bishoplie priestly dignity yea banished also rome yet emperours request effusis lachrymis rogauit synodu teares requested synode mercye pope suffred remaine order deacon yet liue banishment rome declaration ye haue slyly craftely passed ouer euident argument false assertion boke yea sheweth emperour ye imagi clergy ad pope chiefly hath supreame authority deposing bishop whereas ye say leo synode gaue otho creation pope vide dist synodo consecration archebishops bishoppes belye decree graunteth emperour whole creation cosecration inuesturing bishop ad pope electio shuld take effectual themperours consent therefore middest allegation nippe quite worde consecration vnde debent whence ought whereby declared inuesturing confirming graunted emperour consecration referred order according whiche canon ought therfore decree ende saith anie chosen bisshop clergie people except co mended inuested king italie let consecrated word euident choise consecration ordering bishop archebishops reserued clergie people thereto required comendation inuesturing cofirmation emperour whiche haue shewed large impaireth iote pope primacie rather cofirmeth thing due emperour rather gifte confirmation apostolicall otherwise due vnto order quietnesse sake parte princelie power horne diuision pag vvhen godlyprince vvas dead vvhilest sonne ottho vvas busied vvarres sarazes son ottho vvas yet nonage pope began vvaxe euil state christes church decaie asmuch euer daungerous mater vvant godly prince gouerne god church ouersee minister therof stapleton well call otho vvithout kinges licence custome auncestours ordeine pope commaunde nevve elected pope forsake dignity vnlaufully come onlesse vvoulde make reasonable satisfaction embassadours vvere honorably receiued vvhen declared message pope himselfe maketh ansvvere taketh god witnesse neuer coueted high dignity chosen ad thrust violently thereunto romaine would suffer wise refuse notwithstanding coulde meanes aftervvardes emperour called vntruth vvas councel schismatical conuenticle auetinus councell vvhich helde sabellicus saith vvormes vvhereat vvere al bisshops frauce germany excepte saxon churchman rome sent epistle vvith greuous complaint hildebrand vnto councel quibus hildebrandum ambitus periurij accersunt eundemque plaera que auare superbe que facere conqueruntur hoc que reiecto alium pastorem postulant vvherein accuse hildebrande ambition periury complainning dothe manye thinges proudly couetouslye therefore desire may deposed pastour appoincted vntruth ridiculous father councell make decree depose hildebrande reciting therein many greuous horrible crymes moued therto bisshops germany frauce also bisshoppes italy assembled togeather ticinum citie lombardy nowe called pauia priuate life estate romaine forsake hildebrande choose selues pastor accordinge manner auncestours vvho listeth reade epistle seditious vntruth rayling traiterous tragicall feates practises pope emperour bothe especially decree may see orth winus gratius nauclerus aue tinus sabellicus platina chapter henry gregory otherwised called hildebrande pope stapleton man might make shorte true answere withal thys long tale say altogether extrauagante impertinente rather directly concluding pope primacie thowghe henrie fowrth woulde acknowledge hildebrande pope yet acknowledged self set vp yea sayd hildebrande lengthe supreame head christes church shall anon declare nowe might passe ouer al heynous accusation againste pope called gregorie matter sauinge thinke good geue notice reader yet neuerthelesse ye shall neuer able iustifie surmised fayned authour benno enimiesmarianus scotus saying hildebrande iustly excomunicated ad deposed naughtines vpholde ad maynteyned hery theperor self yet archdeacon pope legate fraunce hauing bisshop whome wonderfully suspecte symonie committed yet conuinced sufficiente proufe commaunded pronounce purgation gloria patri filio spiritui sancto bisshop pronounced rowndlie gloria patri filio lyfe could lyfe pronounce spiritui sancto hugo reported hildebrand foretolde hym great plague pestilence ere yt came told hym also certayne pryuie thought pleaseth yowe make platina lier flatterer taketh gregory true pope haue bene wrogfully thrust emperour ye seame rather encline abbas vrspergensis nauclerus bothe yet make shal fynd abbas gener abbas vrspergens guiliel malmesb li de hist anglicae blondus naucler gener pope hilbrand purgeth self receiuing blessed sacrament doth condemne feined false forged lie thigs ye alleage doth though saieth sigebertus write cotrary say doings gregory honest proceded zelouse faith like say coucels holde italy whose folly falshod euidently bursted aswel otherwise calling gregory disciple beregari ad one browght doubt catholike apostolical faith body bloud christ notoriouse lye hildebradus beig yet archedeaco notwithstading pope legat haue said frace brought beregari recatatio first tower frauce afterward rome also hiself pope yea hisef theperor present said masse taking body christe said theperor sir haue benaccused adherets diuerse crymes wherof yf gylty pray god haue receiued body entede presently receaue purgatio streke sodayne death vpopn pope receaued part holy hoste woulde themperor haue done like purgation refused doe nowe take heade self fellowes horne least owne councell pauia one moste greauouse moste horrible crymes falslye layde pope gregory truely layde adherent true disciple heretike beregarius bring doubte yea accurse condemne catholik apostolical faith whose condemnation made pope gregory decree made cocubines doth trow much greue doth matter peroura coniecture vvhie horne much offended vvith hildebrand wronge ye pretende pope haue bene done nowe cloked dissimulation also handling story considered dare open cause dissentio betwene pope ad theperor euente thereof dissention rose themperour woulde remoue symoniacall bisshoppesthe cause dissention betvvene themperor pope hildebrand naucler gener kepte aboute excommunicated alexander gregory predecessour self woulde forbeare sell bisshopriks spirituall lyuings whereof gregory sone euer elected admonished saying confirmed themperour would wise suffer beare doigs therfore willed either procure man shoulde made pope amende thing amisse notwithstandinge emperour confirme beinge afterwarde seduced gregorie excommunicated deposed irritated pope letter therein commauded purge self crymes charged withal conspired againste adherente bisshoppes assembled ye write wormes declared iudgemente god therein withall full answeare maister horne impertinent processe gregory deathe thys emperour taken prisoner hys owne sonne forced resigne geue ouer royall imperiall dignitye whiche rebelled againste hym rebelled againste hys spirituall father pope gregorie faste wrote letter depose hildebrande ye write wherein neuer lesse refused absolutly pope hildebrade toke pope thig desire alwaies thyrsted synge pleasant balades throughe mennes malitiousnesse thy godlinesse thou hast ouercome worlde chapter frederike barbarossa alexander stapleton maister horne good reader hath hitherto doth styll playe cacus parte liuius lib dec cacus stole hercules ox woulde haue espied track drewe caue tayles backward whiche thing hercules seing nothing mistrust shoulde therem horne playeth cacus parte stole hercules ox yet passed droue beastes beast denne lackinge theyr company beganne maner bellowe wherby thefte discried boke horne denne cacus pretye sleight conueyeth hys story proufes man first vrspergensis nauclerus sabellicus platina nauclerus againe beside radeuicus frisingensis next platina vrspergensis againe though tooke distinct seuerall matter eche one frederic octauianu pontificem cofirmat eumque albo equo sidente per vrbe ticinensem ducit de mo e adorat platina alex tunc episc ad pes octauiani prosternut imperator quoque id ipsum fecit vt ab eo indulgentia acciperent sibi obedientiam sacerent vspurg quem imperator concilio papa declaratu adorauit equu eius de per vrbem deduxit whereas manner al runne one way wherof assured al horne owne primacie part testimony cut eche caried craftely horn cacus caue bewraieth al horn theft wil ye proue like regiment horne frederike doings ye maintaine goe see ye proue v substantiallye refused ye say pope rouland yet receiued pope octauian confirmed ye say yea ledde citie pauia sitting vppon white horse adored platina nauclerus saye vspurgensis saieth fell flatte feete receiue pardon become obediensarie al ye saye therefore heare hercules stolen ox bellowe cacus denne maister horne eares paciently abide al octauian ye write pointes honest relligious thing perceiue made saint death naucler geuer said many miracle done tombe luca buried image nicodemus stomake disgest maister horn suffer supreme head like slaue kisse pope feete become maister horse ye suffer miracle pope tombe yet notwithstanding shall man point honest religiouse chance haue least co fort one pretie nip ad tel v called hi self victor enteded victorious coquerer deede vppon supreame head emperour frederike surely maruaile ye shoulde fauourably encline false antipope rather true pope dede rouland platina writeth elected cardinal octauian onlye therfore frederik mainteined hi rouland occasion horrible schisme ye speak rouland euer ad take true pope yea taken length frederike also co ming venice kissing holy feete seeing ye haue made pope hand holyesupra diuision bolde make feete holy ratifiyng allowing humilitye supreame heade christes churche length iesting alexander hath made great conqueste vppon false lying booke new set vppe primacie euer great alexander vpon king darius lo ye companion beare victor conqueste beare matter one lyke alexander wherin see reason perchaunce ye take victor nighe cousinage ye great schismatike therfore thoughe friderike suffer hand yea feete victora fable apology foxe touching thys alexander treading theperours necke alexander yet roreth owte apologie hym put yll fauoredly mostruouslie emperours neck vnder feete whiche semeth fable parcial writer wedded theyre affectios slaunder pope withal carion suche write yt althoughe catholyks perchaunce reporte dothe nauclerus addition vel vt blondus scribit post quam pontificis pes imperator exosculatus est ad altare maius ambo principe se amplexati exosculati sunt nauclerus nauclerus gener madde martyrolog non tibi inquit sed petro cui successores pa eo naucler dict gener whiche thowghe catholyke yet muche inclinable german comoly emperours parte semeth rather lyke narration blondus theperour vsual honor kyssing pope foot tale thapology true fox doth also ioly gay picture set forth thowgh yt make commendation pope moderation humility yet yt maketh hys supreame authority obey sayeth emperour thee peter whome thow doest succede thentent horne apologie foxe alwaies like bestly swyne nousell donge vente vp worste may founde pope prelate may haue iuste occasio charity comende greate moderation pope alexander may remember extreme misery oppressio almayne army spoyling ad wasting al aboute rome naucler gener pag emanuel emperour east sent embassadours promysing bothe great hoste almayne emperour friderike also vnio grecian romain church would suffer romain empire loge diuided fro time charlemayn come agayne one heade empire whome also banishment sayde emperour sent seconde embassy great quantytie mony promysing reduce whole east churche vnder subiection west grece vnder rome woulde restore emperour constantinople crowne west empire frederike seemed nowe rightlye worthely depriued pope notwithstanding greate misery stode presentlye daily like suffer power frederike answered se nolle id vnum coniungere pag quod olim de industria maiores sui disiunxissent woulde ioyne one forefather olde time purpose diuided trowe denie horne circumstance duely cosidered great ad rare moderatio pope alexader worthy set forth figure ad picture posteryty sober vertuous facte whiche mayster fox hath blased oute prowde hasty except charyties suche verely semeth take delight vice vertue rather heare one lewde fact pope twenty good charyte charyte paule describeth thinketh euill cor protestant lacke true charyty reioyseth vpon iniquyte reioyseth verytie suffreth thinges beleueth thinges hopeth al thinges beareth thinges contraryewyse thinke reporte alwaies worst reioyse take greate pleasure vpon iniquytie ought men reuerence sorye haue veryty truthe tolde suffer beare nothing church euil life fewe forsake comunion societie whole beleue much pleaseth hope accordingly thus muche way one touching greate ambition desire speake euil pope reporte worste doe booke horne haue done plentifullye exactlye throughe whole processe vt iudicaret eos aut causam sedis apostolicae sed vt prudentibus viris addisceret cui electo obedire potius deberet rsperg prince practise ecclesiastical gouernment euill life pope direct sufficient argument proue prince supreme gouernours al thinges cause ecclesiasticall coulde shewe authorityes place oute owne authours concerninge thys storye friderike first making directlie againste wherein ye haue played cacus ye wryte authoritie vrspergensis emperour sent theis pope come hym mynding examine theyre cause yt followeth iudge cause apostolique see might learne wise men whether shoulde rather obey thinke horne craftely cut steale away sentence reader preatye pageant cacus namely seing authour nauclerus writeth also like gener seyng ye demeane selfe vnhonestly vnclerkly principall matterm horn extraordinarye processe ad lewde ayling nowe care extraordinarye foolishe false excursion welthy pride fearce power trayterouse trecherie pope tyme erasmus comparing pope successours iulius caesar vrspergensis owteries couetousnes againste pope authoritye bernarde say founde faulte pompe pride eugenius clerely pronounceth withstanding pope primacy referre shorte confutation lying apologie al impertinent rayling rhetorike confu fol freely leaue ouer vnto rayle rolle self therein til tog wery againe yf ye wil thig shal let haue ofte said desire reader marke wel emperor variace see apostolike self set pope authority absolutely variaunce pope set man man election renouncing pope renouncing man man true right pope horne diuision pag tyme king cicilia apulia dispensation pope money otto frigingesis inuesture archebisshops staffe crosier ringe palle myter sandalles slipper pope might sende dominion legate onlesse kinge sende stapleton king sicilia procure dispensation ye say horne pope inuesture bisshops receyue legate vid de hoc nau gen p supreame heade praye pope gaue dispensation king procured yt ye see good reader howe sauerlye hansomly man olde guise concludeth self horne diuision pag doigs king realme eccles matter conquest looke bok de postestate regia set prelats hen english chronicle make report king realme hadde altogeather leafte dealing chur matter continued parte iurisdiction aboute ecclesiasticall cause although vvithout trouble polychron polychro fabian polychro fabian pope legate came englande made cou cel assent king vvilliam conquerour vntruthe al vvas one councell coucel vvinchester polychron polychro fabian polychro fabian put many bisshops abbatts priours procuremet king king gaue lafrauke archbisshoprike cantorb ladye daie assumption made archebisshope whit sonday gaue archbisshoprike yorke vnto thomas canon bayon vvhen thomas shoulde haue bene consecrated lanfranke fell strife betvvixt liberty church yorke controuersie church matter vvas brought referred kinges vntruthe fabia saith neither story appeareth iudgement thomas kinges commaundement faine come lanfrank sacred aftervvard vvhen grevve greater contention betvvixt tvvayne churche matter bisshop rome remitted matter determined kinge bisshops englande vvindesour kinge vvilliam cleargy cause treated polychron also cause vvas moued king misorder thurstan fabian polychron whome king made abbot glastonbury whose iudgement abbot chaunged tourned owne abbay normandye monkes vntruth vvere spred diuers house saith fabian leaue scattered aboute king hest king bestowed many bisshoprikes chaplaines london norvviche chester couentry c ruled temporalty spiritualty owne wil saithe polychronicon tooke noman fro pope lad polychron meaneth kinge vvoulde suffer legate enter lande pope came pleased suffred coucel made coutrey without leaue also woulde nothing suffer councel woulde assent vntruthe folovveth shall appeare geuing translating spiritual promocions geuing assent councels suffring nothing passe vvithout consent hearing determining ecclesiasticall cause restreining pope liberty vvithout speciall licence ruling spiritualty ovvn vvil king vvillia shevveth plain vntruth neuer toke hi self tooke self supreame gouernour vvithin realm al maner cause vvel ecclesiastical temporall chapter england conqueste william conquerour rufus sonne henry first kinges englande stapleton good reader hartely beseche euen ye tender either truth saluation sowles haue good speciall regarde horne narration nowe following length horn come fro long vnfruitfull wandering spaine fraunce italie germany country natiue contrey late doings countre suche haue sequestred selues fro common vsuall obedience contries concerning authority matter ecclesiasticall euer gaue singular peerlesse preeminence see rome yet sequester pittie selues daylie makinge none accompte good prince doings president behalf pretending practised hym yt behoued protestant especiallie horne thys boke euer proufes country yet conuenient prouf olde practise concerning newe primacie englande haue wrowght matter substancially least wise owne countre shulde haue browght forth good au cient autentique matter wil ye nowe see wise euen dealinge protestant prelats pynne vp proufes wythin vj hundred yeares christm horn firste thousand yeares shevveth example primacie practised britannie fol col euer bring theyr iewell telleth v ful merelie come late horne matter supreamacie weightie poore catholiks deniyng thereof greauously punished lawes anie matter nowe lying controuersie betwene catholyks protestantes englande horne say thys owne country approued chronicler reporte self alleageth first al rom prouinces publiquely embrace christes relligion one thousand yeares standeth mute belike thinking william conquerour conquered aswell olde catholyke fayth englande lande people fansieth duble conqueste one vppon good body vppon sowles faythe englishe men shall nowe say noble worthie champion shall dryue hym litle backem horn begineth newe primacie vvith vvilliam conquerour thovv h coquered lande fayth vvithall iewels peremptory challenge tel commeth late almoste fyue hundred yeares shall deale freely liberally iewell doth whith v bydde hym take beste helpe hym self verely horne nede yet lytle purpose aswell conquest hath sufficient prouf pretensed supremacy prouf euer bringeth yt must yelde geue place first thousand yeares whiche beare ful testimonie pope primacie laufully practised realme conquest matter fyll large volume withal runne longe thowsand yeares shewe prouf haue pope primacy conquest answere woulde waxe bigge prolixe yf shoulde doe onelie putte good reader remembraunce matter two muste therefore pluck horne backe williams conquest desire remember better proufs pope supremacie britanie saxon tyme beda hist ang lib cap aunciente conqueste al britannie williams yea aboute ix hundred yeares ilelande britanie firste delyuered tyrannicall yoke miserable bondage dyuelish idolatrie horne suerlie pope eleutherius whome kinge lucius sente letter desiringe hym commaundement mighte christened fugatius damianus whose holy reliques thought wale whose holy remembraunce church dedicated god name obsecras vt per ei mandatu christian efficeretur king luci ad realme christened bi pope legate ireneus li ca ad hac enim propter potentiore principalitate necesse est oem couenire ecclesiam hoc est eos qui sunt vndique fideles qua semper ab hijs qui sut vndi que co seruata est ea quae est ab apostolis traditio beda li cap rosper chronic doe day kepe preserue fresh immortall sent england sayed eleutherius godly wonderfully worke thys great conqueste nowe aske horne lucius meant send farre instructours teacher christian fayth namely fraunce beyng hande thys tyme christian church adorned wyth many learned bishoppes martyr though woulde perchaunce seeke manie pretye shyfte shyfte awaye thys demaunde yet neuer make good sufficiente aunsweare vntyll confessed pope primacye verie cause send farre blessed martyr god great learned bishoppe lyon fraunce ireneus writyng tyme firste apostle eleutherius doth confesse writyng church muste agree wyth churche rome sayed churche hath greater principalitie tradition apostle haue euer bene kept case nowe pope nothing doe matter ecclesiasticall within ileland tyme olde britaines pope celestinus appoint scottes theyr firste bishop palladius prosper writeth notable chronicler age dyd also send thys ileland germaine bishoppe antisiodorum bryng apostolicall authoritie britaynes heresye pelagians sayed prosper witnesseth lett v nowe come tyme saxon conuerted augustine shall fynd manie full testimony pope primacie prince subiection trowe horne selfepope celestinus practised supremacye saxos tyme impudent denie ouerpasse reason readely foud worthy coutriema bede lately set forth english tongue fortresse also adioyned storie nowe adde time wherin beda endeth storie conquest foresaied william pope supremacie englande sithence saxos time beda lib ca li ca li c appeareth domesticall story perpetuall continuall practise saied primacie realme pope well bookes extant printe asserius meneuens continueth storie death bede yeare lorde henricus huntingtoniensis gulielmus malmesburiensis alphredus beuerlacensis sent gift peece holy crosse king beig learned hiself loued entierly learned especially ioanes scotus traslated greeke tog work dionysius areopagita whoo vsed moste familiarly alurede yet yong sent purposely forbeare nowe notifie good reader two thigs first tyme good kinge offa yere lord gaue example inas long idem hunting polid l continual practise pope primacy realme england conqueste payinge peter penny ad receiuing palle pope vicare peter peter penny euen coquest payment said peter penny hath continued fro tyme tyme leuied king taking good diligent order sure paymente secondly tyme augustine first archebisshop among saxon al archebishops euen conquest receaued palle rome infallible token subiectio pope peter successour vpon whose holy tombe palle first layed ad taken sente archebisshop two token subiection cotinued fro tyme time conqueste continewed also without interruption onlesse verie seldome litle space reason priuate controuersie betwixte pope kinge euen thence freshe memorie beside many notable thing otherwise realme since conquest continually practised serue declaration confirmation said primacy perchaunce horne wil say sir though specifie nothing conquest iustifie prince supremacy yet margent booke doe remitte reader booke made king henry day de potestate regia wherein may see doinges king england realme conquest matter ecclesiastical prety clerklie remission dede sende reader one thowsande yeares together ye shoulde haue laide hi best principal proufs seke book wotteth whe legth foud shal proue matter substatially ye haue done hitherto selfe therefore ye worke signes profers marginal note wil remitte reader vntruth much one example nevve primacye brought foorth boke cocerning englad therfore marginal lie horne ye novv vvelcome englande horne vvithall ioly companye vvith vntruthes cleauing faste syde beside many trym follie othervvise marginal note also ful aunswere nowe lette v goe forwarde god name see whether kinge william conquered bothe lande catholike faithe one lette v consider yf kinge realme acknowledge pope supremacy much reuerently christian prince doth liuig say nothing othe toke day coronation promising othe aldrede archbisshop yorke crouned hi peter alter westminster clergy people would defende holye church gouernours tel reader good horn beseche king willia contrary aunciet order vsed euer since crowned fifth name third occupied said palle without licece leful authority court rome guil malmesb stigandu perpera falso archiepiscopu per card rom armenfridu episcopum sedunensem deponi passus est polychronic lib cap author polychronicon writeth like effect neubrigensis also newly prited toucheth depositio stigadus pope legat englad ad reporteth pope legat canonically deposed liking haue horne kig willias supremacy happy fellowes protestat bishop two archbisshops said willia king ye se cause sufficiet neub lib cap ye al shuld depriued aswel stigad yet ther one thig worse tha schisme heresym horne felovves deposed yf allovv vv conquerours supremacy woulde euer haue thought good reader pope euer haue found horne selfe good proctour papacy againste self fellowes lo brasen face shortly ye wotte wel shewe kinge william supreme head al cause wel temporall spiritual doth pleade foorth full lustely pope kinge william heareth certayne ecclesiasticall matter beinge controuersie dependinge pope cowrte betwene archebisshop yorke archebisshop caunterbury cause pope remitted determined king bishop gul malmesb ex praecepto alexandri ventilata est causa c adfuit hubertus legatus papae fabian cap polich lib cap guiliel de pontifi guil hu tingt well said horne like pope faithfull proctour hereof followeth pope supreame head iudge cause kinge pope commissioner whose commaundemet cause sent ouer heard englad yet hubertus pope legat present end notwithstading horne would belike make v belieue king william also thrusted abbats supressed monastery yt pleased telleth v kigs iudgement abbat thurstan chaunged monk scattered abrode forgotte set also authour others say slaying certayne monkes wounding certayne monk also hurt many men author pollichronico telleth moks scattered abrode kigs hest diuers bisshopriks abbays latter word ye leue also author fabia saith scattred reporte though bene scattred coates late dayes saieth spred abrode diuers house englande chaunged house religion spirituall matter kinge neither gaue herein iudgement spirituall cause nowe argumentes euidences fayled v shewe kinge william toke self supreame gouernour maner cause moste vntruely fondly auouche might well proue againste yowe storie lanfranke whome kinge williamnotable place lanfracus pope primacie lanfran contra berengar de sacrameto et hoc impio ore garristi quod garrista nemo loquitur haereticus non schismaticus non falsus aliquis christianus fol ye confesse made archebishop canterburie though according olde manner ye dissemble aswell depryuation stigandus whose place king set lanfranke lanfranke receyuid palle rome acknowledged kinge pope supreame head church thing doth manifestly appeare learned boke wrote againste greate graundsier berengarius ye doe nowe denied transubstantiation real presence christes bodie sacramente called churche rome condemned heresie ye vse doe church malignante councell vanitye see sathan whome lanfrancus answereth neuer anie heretyke anie schismatyke anie false christian hym wyckedly babled againste see sayth yet farder place sayd boke quotquot primordio christianae ecclesiae christiani nominis dignitate gloriati sunt etsi aliqui relicto veritatis tramite per deuia erroris incedere maluerunt sedem tamen sancti petri apostoli magnifice honorauerunt nullam que aduersus eam huiusmodi blasphemiam vel dicere vel scribere praesumpserunt whosoeuer begynning christes church fol beati patres cocorditer astruxerut haericum esse hoem omnem qui romana vniuersali ecclesia sidei doctrina discordat edit lo nan honored name christe though forsaking truth haue gone astray yet honoured much see peter neyther presumed time either speake write blasphemy saieth also blessed father doe vniformly affirme heretike doth dissent rom vniuersal church matter faith nede lay furth thee good reader lanfraks learned book goe matter haue hand ministred v horne cocerning matter sent determined king haue get either polychronico fabia would wish see place tha wil meruail horne would shame bring matter agaist pope primacy confirmation wherof ye shal find lafranks reasoning king right vpo church york somthing worth noting pope primacy beside writeth lanfrank man singular vertue co stancy grauity whose helpe cousel affaire king chiefly vsed therfore coclusion ye inferre premiss ye haue specified haue shewed impugne establish pope primacy fond folish false coclusion appeareth well fabian polychronicon would sometime like coquerour owne lucre safetie displace english prelats knight noble realme place owne norman roome also haue peece many time owne mind cotrary precise order canos lawes ecclesiastical fabian polychonicon willia malmesbury doth also witnes fault therfore willia coquerour ad others authour reporte discomendation serue notwithstading beggarly shiftes forced vse good argumets ad substatial bulwark lib de po tif angli build newe supreamacy vpo nowe might anie wise much meruail cosider ye haue lade freighted one page boke lesse quotatios polychronico yet one seruing rather againste yea eche one ouerthrowing purpose therfore ye would lesse espied throughout whole discourse ye neither name boke
