bishop abbats ye speake deposed king self write fabian cap king meanes procuremet fabia reporteth entent might preferre norman rule church preferred knightes rule temporaltie might stand suertie lande horne diuision pag like maner sonne william rufus vvho made anselm bishop yorke aftervvard traslated cantorbury within strife cotention fel betwene anselm fabian anselm might cal synod correct bishop kig would king also chaleged inuestiture bisshops king also forbad paying mony tribut rome saith polychronicon like inhibition made henry first vntruthe made holy church free sayeth fabyan fabyan gaue ecclesiastical promotion matth par auncestours doone vvherefore anselme fel vvith kinge vvould consecrate suche prelate beynge lay man made archebishop yorke vntruthe pleasure kinge left consecrate therefore anselme vntruthe fled rome vvas sente thither kinge fledde realme councel london spiritual condescended kinges officer punish priestes whoordome cause decree seemeth vvas cardinall named ioannes cremensis came redresse matter enueighed againste vice vvas selfe nyghte taken tardy councell also sayth polydore kinge prouided many thinges bee enacted shoulde greatly helpe leade godly blessed life simeon dunelmensis hen huntingtonus roge houedenus matt paris mat vvestmonast kinge called councell sarisbury sommoning thither well chief clergy people swore vnto vnto vvilliam sonne whereupon polydorus taketh occasion speake order parliamente though haue french name yet deede councell clergy polidorus polidorus nauclerus abbas vrsp laitie vvhereof prince hath full ratifiyng enfringing voyce saith king make bisshoppes abbottes vvhich calleth holy rite lavves religion church ceremony likevvyse cal ecclesiastical busynes prince euery natio begane euery wher claim right vnto selues namig denouncing bisshops daie hold fast toothe nayle also martinus noteth vntil time fro thence vntruthe flatly belying martinus eue til day king hungary maketh inuestureth according pleasure bisshops ecclesiastical person within dominion stapleton concerning vvilliam rufus kingye shal nowe good reader see euidente testimonie horne meruelouse newe logike diuinity wherof spake euen nowm horne buyldeth newe primacie vppo doinges ill prince eusebius de vitae const lib prope finem y worthy clerkly conclusion wicked king rufus woulde suffer blessed learned archbishop cauterbury anselme cal hys synodes correcte bishoppes challenged inuestiture bishoppes woulde paye tribute rome ergo quene englande supreame head church englande losenes fondnes thys argumente euery childe may sone espie argument may set pope crowne vppon head wycked heathen prince especiallie tyrate licinius whome eusebius coparing good christian emperour constantine copartner hym empire ad hys wyckednes writeth thus nonlatin alphabet c first watched obserued priestes god vnder hys gouernemente wheras nothing offended hym curiouse subtyle working deuised pretensed matter trouble vex themthe agreablenes betvvene rufus ad tyrat licinius stayyng ecclesiasticall councels could fynd iuste matter accuse withall made proclamatio bishoppes nonlatin alphabet c maner matter assemble together yt shoulde lawfull repayre theire neighbour church nonlatin alphabet c call synode place consulte debate vppon suche thinges apperteyned commoditye churche thys hys dryfte wich sowght theyre destruction either bishoppes daunger punished yf trasgressed law yf kepte lawe broke order custome churche could aduise selues weighty matter synode thys wicked hated god gaue thys commaundement might worke quite contrarye doeinges good constantyne whome god loued reuerece god suche studie endeuour haue peace agreemente assembled god priest together horne like spider ad flie worthines bisshop anse guil maelmesb lib de pontif henri hunting histor angl e cause dissen io betvvene king ufus anselmus edmerus de vita ansel li rege pro ecclesiaru quae de die die destruebatur releuatione pro christianae l gi quae multis violabatur renouatione pro diuersoru moru qui oni ordine hominum quotidie nimis corrumpebantur correctione coepit interpellare thother cotrariwyse wet dissolue thing wel ordeined breke peace ad agreemet thus farre eusebius heathen tyran licinius ye play therfore horn like spider gathereth nothig poison sweet herbes doe good chronicle ye like flie loueth dwell horse dong would god reader horne would either aduisedly weigh ill king willia rufus agreable consent writer strauge woderful toke sene time ad ended life slaine glausing arrowe huting excellet learning costancy vertue b anselmus great miracle god wrought wel death set foorth best historiographer time especially henry hutington willia malmesbury one edmerus hath made ij special treatise one cocerning anselmus doings king king hery cocerning priuat life would wish getle reader read know better worthines man withal state cotrouersy betwixt hi two king willia rufus hery effect cocerning william rufus rested said william would admonitio good man wel leaue fault also inuesturing bishop pilling spiritualty ad teporalty selling bisshopriks bought solde plainly marchandize horne author fabian beside others dothe declare beginning king displeasure bishop anselme rose principally woulde according expectation geue way thanks edmer lib thousand pound making hi archebishop cauterbury yet naught king neuer denyed pope supreme heade iudge church paiment tribut called rome shot time pretending knew true pope church rome troubled schisme seeming time fauour rather false true pope vrbane notwithstanding acknowledged true pope edmer dict lib attamen posthaec et vrbanum per vvalterum albanensem episcopum qui palliu rom anselmo cantuariam detulit pro papa suscepit et principum suorum cosilio actus amicitiam suam virum recepit ad receiued walter pope legat brought palle anselme receiued anselme also friendship henry huntington writeth king selfe sent palle brought cauterburie set vpon aulter honor peter kissed al men humblie kneeling haue shewed fasshio king forbod tribut paid rome marueile ye tell rather polichronico fabian saith well residue ye alleage good dedes henric hunting cap describing death willia telleth day whe died held hand three bisshopriks cauterbury winchester ad salisbury diuers abbey let farme also restrained mony old time paid rome called rome shot al told fabia chronicler shew couetous man iniurious church shewe practise due laufull authoritie thereby yet serueth notwithstanding horne purpose wel horne wil haue prince like william rufus father conquerour taxe pille spiritualty temporalty realme measure polichronicon fabian report conceal notwithstanding staie tribute rome yet william pill shaue people tribute misuse diuers disorder fabian saith pilled spiritualtie temporalty vnreasonable taskes tributs concerning kig hery first one bring foorth worthy example new supremacie yet ye fasten vppon neyther edmer lib de vita anselmi post ea omnia regauit anselmum rex quatenus ipsemet romam iret henr hungt rogatus rege perrexit romam ide heric hugt anno statuit vt nuqua per donationem baculi pastoralis vel anuli quis quam de episcopatu vel abbatia er rege vel quamlibet laica manum anglia inuestiretur ex antecessoru suorum vsu relicto ec persona quae regimen ecclesiarum sumebantur per se eligit nec ea per dationem virgae pastoralis quibus praeficie batur inuestiuit edmer lib de vita anselmi much lesse shal ye fasten vpon king henry folowing though time displeased anselme would neyther consecrate bishop communicate king inuestured pope commaunded matter yet sta ding controuersie flie ye write king desire went rome see could mollifie pope afterwarde king perfitly reconciled king made ordinaunce decree time foreward bishop abbat inuestured king laie man pastorall staffe ring writeth henrie archedeacon huntington writer liuing like also edmerius anselmes copanion exile writeth king gladde made peace accorde anselme great hope soner subdue normandie euen chaunced notable victorie toke prisoner brother robert prince assisted robert whiche thing certified anselme letter sent englande men day imputed victorie agreamente made anselme tel nowe good faith horne supreme heade king yelded pope inuesturig idem pope would neuer yelde emperour henrie neither matter omnes qui haec gesta tuc teporis audiere ea meritis cocordiae qua rex cu ansel fecerat ascripsere fabian cap excommunicate emperour king henry faine forsake doings though selfe mighty prince emperours father law maude empresse daughter also perceiue horne wil lightly blushm horn sheweth selfe vvorthy punished vvhoredome ovvn storie could ye would neuer shame haue tolde reader priestes punnished whoredome sauing maistres madges poore honestie yet whoredome infinitely excedeth punished keping company concubine wiues whome laufully maried ordered priesthod doe marie neuer allowed euer condemned wel greke churche latine decke margent thicke ye fabia simeon dunelmens rogerus houedenus henricus huntington matheus parisies matheus westmonasteries polidorus ad blow horne dishonesty shame long ye see supreamacy ye shal buyld vpon fickle filthy foundation fabian simeon dunelmens rogerus houed rex tenuit conciliu magnu apud lodonu de vxoribus sacerdotu prohibe li c concessere namque regi iustitia de vxoribus sacerdotu improuidi habiti sunt accepit eni rex pecuniam infinitam de presbyteris redemit eos similia habet henr huntington verely owne authours doe witnesse king kept great councel london among al decree saieth fabian one priestes forgoe wiues pope legate taken ye write whoredome yet mattheus westmonast writeth priest correctour priest thereby excused fault doth relieue cause wherein doth saue honestie king punish fornicatours clergy consent wherein thier rashe graunte ouerseen circumuented king tooke greate masse money parson faultye dismissed ye tell v nowe polidore parliament dede councel clergie layetie lib order parliamete abovvt conqueste parliametum est ex gradibus siue generibus scilicet ex procuratoribus cleri militibus comunitatis ciuibus burgensibus qui repraesentat totam communitatem angliae quia quilibet magnatum est bi pro propria persona non pro alia ye meane ecclesiasticall councell polydore neither saieth meaneth yt maketh parliamente assemble politike matter prelate also come baron matter ecclesiasticall appointeth specialle conuocation truthe yt conqueste william conquerours tyme appeareth old recordes writen semeth abowt coquest proctours clergye sate lower howse sayde recordes shewe parliament properly standeth consisteth degree proctours clergye knightes sheere burgeses citizen represent people comminaltie realme noble men bishoppes oth r owne person yf shal beleue said auncient record nowe though many yeres matter politike couocation haue nothing doe yet paiemet made taketh place vertue parliamet clergy onles clergie cosent yf true mony mater auciet time clergy ciuil mater also prerogatiue belik left volutarely might better attend owne spirituall vocatio accopt ought good reason made late parliamentm horn vvisdom reasoning hym selfe wherein mere laie men haue turned vpsidowne state catholique faythe againste full mindes clergie leaue euery wiseman well consider beganne saye polidore meaneth parliamente councell spirituall matter purpose polidorus lib admonebat ne sanctos ritus neue religionis iura et ceremonias verteret pollueretque great wisedome haue ye alleaged calleth making bisshops ad abbats holy rite lawes religio church ceremony seing king gaue ouer electing bishoppes seing authour doth shew anselme rebuked king therefore nowe matter englande horne addeth greate vntruthe kyng hungarie tellyng v martinus kynge hungarie vntill time yeare grace thence euen til day maketh ad inuestureth according pleasure bisshops c thys say great flat vntruth martinus saieth plainly cotrary thus time king hugary saieth martinus writing many aduertisements pope letter gaue ouer inuesturing bishop prelats martinus polonus pascha li renunciauit inuestituris episcoporum alioru praelatoru vntil time kinges hungary wonte make true wordes martinus place passing impudency horne author telleth pope primacy man wresteth prince therefore whereas martinus telleth vntill time kinges hungary inuested bishop addeth farder time kinge hungary gaue ouer pope handes horne bothe lewdely concealeth also owne impudentlye shamelessely addeth thence euen til dayes martinus auoucheth telleth also plainely contrarye witte time king gaue ouer al matter farder make matter soud princely make martinus say kinge hungary inuested bishop according pleasure wordes according pleasure martinus al poynt descant vpo playne fitte owne volutary pleasure dede sou ded pleasauntly horne eares example might also goe bishop made prince pleasure remoued againe highnes pleasure hearde forme paschalis graunte made henry though prince haue inuesturing confirming bishoppes graunted yet neuer grauted prince oly pleasure suffised make man true bishop first prince inuested confirmed vide naucleru generat pag shoulde libere praeter violentiam simoniam electus chosen freely without violence simony prince part great faultes emperours germanie kinges oure land inuesturing bishop owne handes namely henrie emperoure william rufus england grieuouslie daily committed secondarelye though inuested confirmed prince dist synod yet post inuestituram canonice consecrationem accipiant ab episcopo ad quem pertinuerint inuesturing let saith paschalis consecrated bisshop belong likewise leo graut made otho geuing emperour inuesturing bishop addeth et consecrationem vnde debent consecrated ought word vnde debent ought nonse lefte alleaging graunt made otho thentent inuesturing prince fol fac without co secration al metropolitane self poore man bishop neither might seme good sufficient haue example antiquitie purpose also ye make martinus say king hungarie made bishop according pleasure see nowe prince pleasure maketh bisshop must free election without eyther forcing clergy choise forcing chosen filthie bribery also must follow due consecratio al fellowes doe lacke therefore deede waye conclude true bisshoppes neither lawe churche see henric cap elizab cap neyther yet lawes realme wante due consecration expressely required act parliamet renewed queenes dayes suffragane bisshoppes much horne diuision pag b e sithen entred noting practises coutries behalfe might onely note doings vntruth time yeares least time frederike king cicill iames king spaine brother reformation relligion dominion appeareth epistle vvrite arnoldus de noua villa also make digressio state part christedo church grece armenia moscouia c acknovvledged vntruth armenia neuer acknovvledged price suche prince supreme gouernours al thing next christ especially also note auncient part christedom southvvard aethiopia conteining kingdomes vnder ruling vvho vve misname presbyter ioannes vvho say vver priest head bisshop ouer christian realmes hauing povver vvith pope vntruth sladerus vsurpatio hath chaleged europe head vniuersal priest ad king vve may beleue sabellicus vvho saith hath often talked vvith marchauts haue trafique hath also diuers time enquired matter interpretour inhabitaunts borne al say name neyther presbiter ioannes pretto ianes say name gyan mightie maruaile greatly italian meane call name priesthode say al suite requestes euen greate bishoppes brought king self benefice spiritual promotion opteined handes vntruth lewde nipping away vvordes folowing sentence beynge sabellicus telleth exceadinge great nomber chiefe prelate metropolitanes vnder euerye one prelate leaste tvventy bishoppes sutes cause ecclesiasticall beyng brought vnto maker prelate bishoppes ecclesiasticall person called ouer clergy laie cause ecclesiastical themporall gyan mightie supreme ruler ad gouernour ad eue hath vntruth neuer able iustified cotinued sithe partes vvere first christened saye thomas dydimus apostle vntill tyme thys vvaye novv retourne ovvne countrey chapter armenian aethiopians preto ianes lande stapleton man would thinke maister horne straunge spirituall meditation rauishedm horne spiritual rauishmet sodainly caried fro england moscouia aethiopia c interlaced digression woorthy belike depely cosidered tel whether impertinently falsely betwene doings king henrie king stephen immediately succeded full wisely wrenched writhed vppon sodaine man rapt vppe caried awaie spaine greece armenia moscouia yea aethiopia sodainly england againe foure hundred yeres past busie busie owne honestie spaine nowe long taciturnitie belike hathe espied notable matter purpose thinke ye good reader forsooth commeth mummerie sendeth v arnoldus de villa noua telleth v shall learne frederike king sicilie iames king spain epistle writen said arnoldus arnoldus heretique catholique bookes printed man shall finde thing telleth v nothing brother gesnerus horn bibliotheca maketh metion arnold phisitio ad nubreth bokes epistle word maruel notable worke shoulde escape hys handes suerlye much doe suppose haue chaunced vppon hym brother illiricus frende gaspar hedio addeth paralipomena abbas vrsper gensis haue feeling thys greate ghostly rauishmete ad feele fyngers endes arnoldus better illiricus maketh hym owne deare brother heretike aswell self also vehemencye thys impertinente madde meditatio caried away vide paralip vrsperg matheum flaccium illiricum catalogo testium veritatis one hundred fiftie yeares leaste tyme ye shoulde haue orderly prosequuted many myles matter yt self thys arnoldus noted haue writen lyke blinde lewde lying prophete abowte tyme clemente fifte made pope abowte yeare lorde arnoldus taking vppon prophete sayeth antichrist come within yeres blinde prophesiyng hys part horne also playeth lying prophete imo quod deterius est videtur nobis quod pro nihilo habeant ecclesiam romanam quia nulli appellationi ad eam factae deferunt telleth v wonderfull epistle authour wrote one hundred yeares borne whiche epistle though highe mysticall yet semeth greate poynte heresie euer reformation king wente aboute epistle seme geue playn testimony pope primacy fynde faulte certaine religiouse person despised churche rome disallow appeales see yea telleth v greate mighty assertion sayeth quod concluditur infallibiliter quod antichristus apparebit mundo ab hoc anno domini infra immediate sequentes annos infallible conclusion antechriste shall appeare world within fowre thyrty yeares immediatly folowing yeare lorde sayth withall within sayde sarasyns destroyed iewes conuerted iurisdictionem summi pontificis per vniuersum orbe dilatari authoritie pope spredde owte worlde well euer yt arnoldus de villa noua seameth greatly furder horne primacy semeth ignorace taketh one arnoldus bernard epist platina sabel en lib dede one arnoldus brixianus abowt thys tyme codemned heretik eugenius bernarde platina sabellicus doe write brother bale sayeth condemned sayde clergy might vse temporal iurisdictio thys arnoldus might haue serued turne tyme somwhat matter accustomable reasoninge authority heretikes maye serue turne let arnoldus ad spayne goe tyme horne hath great coutries time taketh hys part grecia armenia moscouia ad aethiopia acknouledge theyre prince theyr supreame gouernours al thing next vnto god ye muste belieue without proufe belyke yt shewed horne thys spirituall reuelation otherwise assured shall neuer iustifie vntrewe saying though perchaunce cou treis tyme shewe see rome suche obediece owght haue done especially grecias ad moscouites followe religio order greke church yet neither doth horne proue euer shall able proue church cou try gaue suche authoritie theyre prince euer toke spirituall cause theyre patriarche bishoppes supreame heades matter spirituall maruayle nowe yt horne loke vpon grecian armenian one blind eye bleared affection heresie hatred pope otherwyse yf woulde loke vppon better indifferente eie cause whie regarde aswell aunciente greeke churche acknowledged pope supreamacye also later acknowledging generall councell lion wherof haue spoken also afterward general coucel ferraria fro thece traslated florece also armenian ioyned roman church first anno nauclerus generat pag volater geograph lib otho frising three hundred yeres aboute yeres deathe henry first bernardes tyme armenian submitted selues eugenius sending chief metropolitane vnder moe thousand bishop see rome trauayling iourney yere ad halfe came viterbu scarse ij dayes iourney rome pope lay receyued ad instructed al thinges sought handes touching order blessed sacrifice obseruation festiuall dayes certayn pointes wherin varyed rest christendome errours coc nicen cap theophil ioan niceph li cap writer much ad ofte noted submissio church rome fel tyme horne talketh affirming falsly maner people armenia acknowleged none oly prince supreme gournours neither neded yow yet horne haue loked far enuious eie might haue abidde late time late councel trent ye haue found armenian sent ambassadours pope recognising hys supreamacy desiring confirmation theyre patriarch antiochia ye haue founde abdisa patriarche assyrian inhabiting nygh famous floud tygris came rome small eyther trauell daunger hys life confirmed pius quartus last pope blessed memorie also promised well hym selfe vnder spiritual gouernemet woulde faythfully constantly keepe suche decree set forth saied councell trent perchaunce ye lesse passe armenian seeyng haue syde ye saye thys tyme greate prince aethiopians hauing lesse kingdomes vnder hys dominion country beyng auncient part christendome southwarde selfe haue forsaken priesthodde take heede pray ye haue withall forsaken christendome ye contented italian call hym prieste ihon thoughe prieste head bishoppe ouer christian realmes hauing suche power wyth pope vsurpation ye terme yt hath challenged europe head vniuersall priest kyng ye would rather called sabellicus telleth mighty gyan called ye mighty lying exposition falsly declare supreme ruler gouernour cause aswel ecclesiasticall teporal first seing ye pretend selfe good antiquarie would gladly knowe monumentes ye haue aethiopical religion time bene mete ye laied foorth authour discharge surely beleue ye haue sene none al antiquitie dare boldly auouch ye neither haue shal see whereby ye may iustly gather aethiopias take king supreme head cause ecclesiastical temporal haue contrary confession bishop raba rago king embassadour king portugale domian go de aethiopum moribus pontificem romanum tanquam primum episcopum pastorem ouiu christi agnosco nostri certe ab exordio primitiuae ecclesiae rom pontifice vt primum episc agnouerut cui etiam hodierno die vt christi vicario paeremus anno dom propterea dico ego humiliter ad terram flexis genibus quod tu pater meus e ego filius tuus procul dubio sanctitas vestra dei est vicarius made yeares past saying doth acknowledge bisshop rome chief bishop pastour christes shepe haue confession wherein declareth aethiopias eue fro begining church acknowlege b rome first ad chief bisshop ad day obey christes vicar speak orator cofession haue king cofessio made pope wherin calleth hi caput oiu potifi u head al bisshops saith pope aequu est vt omnes obedientia tibi praestent sicuti sancti apostoli praecipiut mete al men obey euen thapostles commaund saith humbly kneling ground pope father sonne saith holines without al doubt god vicar thinke ye horne ye shal like mighty giant coquer al reader ad make bond slaues ignorace folly sabellicus sayeth called mightye cyan therefore yee maye mightely lye conclude thereby hathe collection spiritual liuinges therfore supreame gouernour cause horn sabel ene lib shal greate falshood discouered lying sprite coniured beholde euen immediatly word alleaged sabellicus al benefice spiritual promotion obtayned king hand foloweth say immediatly quod rom pontifex regum maiestati dederit thinge bisshop rome hath geuen king maiesty woordes authour haue lewdely nipped quyte macaria lyke iewel pewefellowe neither doth speake order relligion age many hundred yeres paste ye pretende late tyme thus horne longe fruitles iorney wherin wayfaring men longe iorneyes wonte doe mat par polychro ye haue gathered store wonderfull lie delight hearer haue trauayled far withal welcome home againe moscouia aethiopia englande horne diuision pag england also king stepha vntruthe polychronico saith thing mat par fabian reserued self inuestitures prelats likevvise henry secod made thomas becket archbisshop catorbury therat sworn king lawes sonne ninth yeere reigne king called parliamet northampton entended reformation many priuileges clergy amongest one although one clergy committed felonie murder treason yet might king put death laye men thing many kinge thought redresse said parliament thomas becket resisted might preuayle againste king vntruthe foloweth matter longe se fabian cap wel neere al bisshops englande yere reigne king made iourney ireland great trauaile subdued irishe helpe primate armach fabian refourmed maners people dweller countrey thre thinges especially first ruling ordering church curate ad order diuine seruice minister sacrament matrimonie england christian region seconde lay people behaue selues towards curats wise pay offer god tithe thirde making testamentes chapter king stephen king henry thomas caunterbury stapleton maister horn hath maruelouse grace dwel stil matter nothing relieue cause inuesturing bisshoppes neither quenes maiesty grace noble progenitours tyme haue challenged yet prince england many hudred yers neither likely king stephen reserued perpetual confirming clergy immunites made solemne othe recorded willia malmesbury ego stephanus dei gratia c stephen grace god assent clergy people chosen king england consecrated thereunto willia shuld reserue said inuestitures hiself author polichronico saith blessed saint martyr thomas ye cal thomas becket sworn tale verily hath maner apparace colour none article king ad thomas coteded much article appere life thomas giraldus cambresis king kepeth councels irelad pope co sent king ry coquered irelad pope consent dede ye recite one ye may proue new supremacy therby hard wisest man coutrey tel yea much rather yt serueth cotrary proueth pope supremacy disallowed said article many king also beig legth fain yeld therin like say king doigs irelad wherof ye write thing eue cofessio helpe primat armach giraldus cambresis one writeth kin doigs ther ad one sent thither kig saith kept many cou cels ther pope wil ad cosent polidor sayth king obtayned title irelond pope authoritie guilielmus newburgensis writeth much lyke willia conquerour poli li addit ad neubur praemonstrato prius apostolico papae iure quod regno angliae habebat licentia que haereditatem conquirendi impetrata inuaded england intimate right interest pope obtayned licence atchiue conquere inheritaunceking vvillia co querour moued right first pope ere co quered england perchaunce wil many secte maruaile ye haue either named thomas passed ouer story sleightlye wil think ye dissembler traytour cause least faynt patrone especially seing fox hath ministred much good matter prosequuting matter xj leaues frends wil say allegation simple ad coldethe doigs kinge henry thomas declared foxe maner altogether extrauagante ye might haue founde foxe maner stuffe nomber kinge henry seconde constitution ordinaunces playne derogatorie many pope lawes yea playne commaundemente man appeale rome peter penny payed apostolicall see yf man founde bring interdict curse realme england apprehended without delaye traytour executed finally maner decree comaundemente proceding authority pope receiued shall finde wil say concerning said thomas parson doinges martyr rebell traytour contention stode vppon matter faith religion true doctrine sincere discipline vpon worldly thinges possessios liberty exemption superiority like deede suche lyke thynges finde foxe storieth thynges good fayth trouth doth would gladly leaue horne take hand shape full answere much would require long processe answere allready waxeth log forbeare diligent exact discussio whole wil open much vnlearned reader may serue hi true knowledge matter discouering fox crafty vntrue dealing withall full answere friuolouse false argument producted horne first thomas king stoutnes sternnesse semeth repreheded would nedes haue absolute answere would contented reasonable answere made saluo ordine meo sauing order afterward exception saluo honore dei sauing honour god thomas iustlie accused stoutnes stubbournes modification moderation may serue indifferent man aduisedly considereth king article proposed thomas might excuse fro stoutnes stubbornes foxe aduersaries lay intend nowe enter serious deape examination sayd article wil say yt al olde canon church yea againste reason archbishop shulde iudged suffragan thomas againe omitte article one quite contrarie apostolical doctrine canon nice auncient general councels finallie catholyke doctrin christes vniuersal churche appeales made archdeaco bishop fro bishop archbishop ca de appellatio si emerserint ab archidiacono debet procedere ad episcopu et ad epi ad archie et si archiepis defuerit iustitia exhibeda postremo ad rege est peruemendu vt praecepto ipsius curia archiepiscopi cotrouersia terminetur ita quod non debent vlteri procedere absque assensu regis quadrilogo de vita b thomae lib vide dict quadrilogu lib impress parisijs principio vide foxu fol cap null qui de rege teneat capite vel aliquis domesticoru ministroru eius ex communicetur c nisi prius rex c ad case ther defect iustice matter browght king co maundemet ended archbishop cowrt without proceding without kinges cosent wherby pope supreme authority authority also al general coucels ordinary necessary remedy many case stad kig englad grace accepted reiected fox reciteth king costitutios leaueth ad many ad reherseth six six maketh thre manifest ad ope lie wher saith sayd decree recited codened pope ther thre codened ad thre pope suffer ad tolerat againe decree none held king capite seruats shuld excomunicated onlesse kig first cosulted trow horn hiself ad fellowes neither kepe precise order wil allow well fox full pretely leaueth costitutio cause moueth ca tel thik ye nowe fox ad like thomas good cause mollify matter saluo ordine meo saluo honore dei ad whe wold accepted gai say altogether ad appeale sea rome ye wil say notwithstading matter fayth religio true doctrine therfor far fro cause title martyr dede wisely yet wilily ad like crafty fox done scrape hi blessed kalender good fayth place ca haue none onlesse late stinking martyr geue place yelde deuils ad god martyr ad none thig denial pope supreamacy supremacy necessary doctryne holde euery christia vnuincible ignorace vppo payn damatio euerlasting separatio fro catholik church mebers beside thisa man may martyr though cause fayth relligion niceph li hist eccles cap telemachius martyr theod l cap tr l c niceph li cap cu sequet sigeb chronic et videelega te disputationem alphegus sit martyr inter lanfrac cantur anselmum postea cant archiepiscop apud edinerum lib de vita anselmi vide guliel malmesb de pontif lib many take blessed martyr church died faith doctrine beig cotrouersy iustice ad truth sake theyr vertuouse dealig good moke telemachius seig rome two swordplayers redy destroy ad kil vppo great zeale came thought haue parted ad slayn self wheruppo theperour honorius reckoned amog martyr ad made lawe kid play exercised rome cause also iohn chrisostoms troble proceded directly fro matter fayth doctryne reprouig thepresse eudoxia omit quillia la bert take martyr slayne rebukig adultery come nearer cotrey thomas tyme alphegius archbisshop canterburie litle conquest suffred selfe slayne dane rather would pille polle tenauntes leauy excessiue somme money dane required redemption whose vertue god synce hath geuen greate testimonie aswell diuerse miracle preseruinge body longe vncorrupted cheife moste aunciente presidente newe testamente iohn baptiste died lyke liberty fredome speache quillian lamberte may set esaye prophet olde testamente howbeyt sayd thomas cause necessarie doctryne also imployedvvat testimony god hath geue vvorld thomas doyngs either directly indirectly blemisshed ordinaunces king concerning pope supremacy madnes yt seke word sette forth blessed man quality martyrdome god self hath wonderfull straunge yea certayne notoriouse miracle aswell lyfe seruant afterwarde geuen worlde suche testimonie deuills hell quadrilogo li c vox de coelo elapsa sic contestata est dicto quadril li c vlt na loco passio ni eius vbi ante maius altare pernoctauit humadus vbi tandem sepultus est etc theyre disciple earth may rather gnashe theyr angrie teathe enuie good meanes deny deface yt true shall yt also thomas heard long ere returned englande celestiall heauenlie voyce thoma thoma ecclesia mea gloriabitur sanguine tuo thomas thomas churche shall glory thy bloud true yt writen incontinently hys death place passion buried paralitici curantur caeci vident surdi audiunt loquuntur muti claudi ambulant euadunt febricantes arrepti daemonio liberantur variis morbis sanatur aegroti blasphemi demonio arrepti confunduntur quod diebus patrum nostrorum non est auditum mortui surgunt palsy cured blinde see deaffe heare dombe speake lame walk ague healed ad possessed deuill delyuered diuers disease holpen blasphemer beinge taken possessed deuill confounded finally sayd authour muche eare eie wytnes saith hath ben heard father dayes dead men relieued againe erle flaunders ad frenche kinge came canterburie pilgrimage thomas quadrilogo lib cap obtulit munera vinu videlicet et auru aureu scilicet calice vini centu modios perpetuo ad dayes kept self solitary great mourning lamentatio great abstinence setting syde al affayres great ad large dominios greif sorow forthwith sent ambassadours pope purge selfe sayd murther wheruppo obserue done king son also promised part see couenants kept yet see iuste iudgement god king rebelled againste spirituall father thomasthe kigs sonnes rebell hi theire carnal father rebelled world saye doe destitute man helpe ranne god helpe helpe blessed martyr thomas whose greater miracle done canterbury worlde wonder wherefore forsakinge normandy saftie sayled englande quadrip histo vitae thom lib c cu sequet commynge towarde canterbury entred city puttinge al princely appparell lyke newe kinge dauid beinge presequuted absolon hys synnes dauid wente citie barefoted newe dauid beinge barefoted hys body naked c iosephus li c de antiq iudaeo meruelous voluntarie penaunce dictum quadripa gul malmesb sauinge couered withe poore vile cote vppon bare beinge nowe hym selfe deceyued good deuotion expectation shall anon declare sayde tombe toke discipline rodde euerie monke loue deuotion martyr renounced foresayd yll statute customes euer onely sayd woulde kepe suche short shal ye find holy english couocatio borowed damnable article whereof haue spoken whole order beside gaie gospelling church secte sprang among albanenses whiche otherwise called albigenses people called albij countie tholous fraunce whiche haue rehearsed nowe arnoldistae schollers disciple arnoldus de villa noua time long vnborne seemeth called arnoldus brixiensis withal well maister horne maister illiricus whome fetched epistle arnoldus de villa noua waye maister horne imagining arnoldus haue liued aboute time king henrie first illiricus imagining arnoldistas named arnoldus de villa noua condemned borne selfe confessing liued aboute suche time haue declared maister foxe also greate antiquarie farre learne confoundeth two arnoldus maketh great sturre auauncing newe ghospel arnoldus de villa noua false lying prophet haue shewed yt may proued illyricus heretique mainteyned suche errours specifie whereof nothing doth appeare foresaied epistle therfore suppose yf mainteyned errours arnoldus brixensis vide de hoc arnoldo plat adriane sabel aenea li bernard epi yt arnoldus brixiensis theis errours waldenses may seme disciple excommunicated generall coucel tolde secte albanenses albigenses horrible error albigenses springinge loynes holye brother waldo beside comon vsuall errours waldenses codened matrimony paulus aemilius li hist franc ecclesiam nostram caetum infernorum vocitabant matrimonia damnabat promiscuos concubitus eosque nefarios sanctos ducebant ad lyued lyke brute beastes filthie beastlie bytchery withstanding multiplied sort desperatly suffred al kind punishmet ad death maynteyning theire heresy set vpon destroyed armie yet preciouse martyr foxe thoughe self cofesse chronicler make better turkes infidelles wold fayne honesty new ghospell hys newe canonisation men shoulde thinke yt foxe vvolde fayn haue v beleue theis albigenses martyr frid dict epist patarenorum complices qui vt alios paena possint eximere de se velut impronidi non formidant vvhy heretiks called selues patarenos epiphanius lib tom here contrary chronicler vpon owne bare woorde one doth euer shalbe able shewe thinge worthye credite contrarye desperate rage theis wilde wodde waldenses suche haue sayde shune rather couitte deathe make theyre secte eies worlde commendable fox holye martyr haue late donne englande el cause bothe councell themperour calleth patarenos called selues olde tyme messalian heretikes called selues like cause martyrianos men glorying nonlatin alphabet secte heresie suffred martyrdomme let mayster foxe make accompte hys holy martyr see howe manie canne fynde haue maynteyned sayd errours albigenses paterans waldenses shall fynde holie cataloge altogether voyde empted olde martyr may take theyre olde place kalender againe mayster foxe doth highlie esteme men lightlye regardeth euer either forsayde moste famous lerned councell late councell trente hathe sayde donne againste doctrine holye martyr wyll belieue catholikes truelye call furiouse madde martyr let leaste belieue emperour friderike newe greate charles mayster horne sayeth let hym fewe wordes heare rownde full answere vglie madde martyrologe vide petra de vinea lib epist short ansvvere fox madde martyrolog themperour frideryke horne supreame head speaking sect folishe frontyke wood waldo sayeth exeplum martyru qui pro fide catholica c call selues sayeth fridericus thowghe followed example martyr died catholike fayth paterans men prompte redie suffer death howbeit wretched paterans hauing holie belief eternall deitie theyre owne wickednes offende three together god theyre neighbour selues god saye while knowe faythe shoulde haue god counsayle deceyue theire neighbour while vnder pretece spirituall ghostly feadinge feade pleasaunt wicked heresie cruell selues while beside losse theire sowles men making accompte lyfe rashelye seeking death pateras desperate dealinges take pleasure bring theyr body payneful death might true knowledge sownde strong faythe auoyde whiche greauouse thing spoken remayne lyue nothing afrayde theyre example staye refrayne selues must plucke owte sworde take worthie vengeance vppon suche enemy god selues persequuting muche earnestly muche iudged spread abrode practise wycked superstition nighe rome head church rome head church fridericus co fession againste paterans thus farre friderike emperour let nowe mayster foxe take fytte ad worthie condemnation al stinking martyr take also mayster horne digeste yt well tel good leasure ye better aduised ye haue wone supreame head colour ye make hym supreame head confesseth church rome head al church also fealt practise pope supreamacy aswel excommunicatio depryuation fro empire platina sabell naucler alij followed sayde excommunicatio electours proceding new election pope commaundemente frideryke hym self matter spirituall acknowledged pope supreamacy ye haue heard yt appeareth petrus de vinea chauceler wrote epistle though thowght pope vsurpe vppon certaine possession friderike notwithstading former othe made contrarie afterwarde challenge matter peter patrimony medle withall greatly necessarye purpose church rome lacked yet pope lacke supreamacie neither lacke sayde supreamacie thowghe lacke sayde patrimony hereafter though bishoppricke indewed one foote land worldly power temporal preeminence hath sett vp pope primacy pope primacy consisteth supreme authorytie ouer christes flocke predecessour peter christ selfe gaue earthe generall councels confirmed acknowledged continuall practise age age without intermission dothe inuincibly couince supreme gouernment ouer christes flocke spiritual matter neither friderike neither christian emperour whatsoeuer except constantius arrian euer striued contended bishoppes rome conclude therefore onlye time saye dealing emperour mayster horne intolerable thus misuse reader ashamed confidently alleage emperour confirmation newe supreamacie thinck yow auentinus man age farre iudge lutheran certaynelie verie muche affectionated theperours pope suche credite sayeth yt therefore muste belieue friderike charles greate moste profitable christian common wealthe howbeit let also passe praise dispraise emperoure oure principall matter whether quene supreame head iudge al cause ecclesiastical impertinent therfore shall procede residue horne diuision pag fabian whiche time henrie king englande held solemne councell whiche bothe sentence king prince fewe priuilegies vntruth captaine notorious polidore saith clean co trary taken awaie order priesthode vvhat time pope legate required vntruth vvas tenth tribute ad vvas graunted denied tribute glergie denyed robert grosthead vvhome yee call saint robert wrote vnto pope sharpe epistle grieued church england taskes paiementes reason whiche sawe redresse prelate lad coplained vnto king wast goodes patrimonie churche pope neare kinsemen alient bisshops king auoided realme vvhome also emperour frederike vvrote vvas shame suffer longer realme oppressed vvith pope tyrannie chapter king henrie third stapleton concerning kig henrie henry toke away many priuileges order priesthode clergie denied tribute pope legate roberte grostheade writeth sharply pope exaction frederike emperour writeth king shoulde suffer realme oppressed pope tyrranniem horn impertinent argument ergo fekeham must take othe quene supreme head yf like argument conclude maister horne may bolde blowe horne triumphantly reioyce like conquerour nowe matter argumentation yll worse forme yt ye ought proue king dayes lyke regimente matter ecclesiasticall nowe kinge toke vppon supreamacy ecclesiasticall contrarie whereof euidente chroniclersm horne seketh matter leauig principall donatistes authours selfe alleage otherwise shorte declaration king henry ye friuolously trifle excedingly lie ye haue done doe reste muste beside matter rehersed cocerning donatist saye augustine sayd sayd donatistes theyr reasoning catholykes marcellinus august co tra dona post collat cap om collat carth conc dicebatse mirari donatistas habe e inco pore sa guine qui nunquam erubes erent toties manifesto mendatio deprehensi nimium patienter pertulit homines per inania vagantes tam multa superflua dicentes ad eadem toties conficta redeuntes vt gesta ta ti voluminibus onerata pene omnes pigeret euoluere c suffred ouer much patience felowes spoken aswell prince kinge helpe money pope againste themperour frederike thowghe allied vnto shall superiority quayle onely bare friuolouse matter laye forth yf yt friuolouse horne starke false maruayle suerly yf kinge toke away anie priueleges clergy horne kinge yt thinke yow gaue priuileges clergy commos yea nobylity co teyned magna charta magna charta kinge caused bishop realme beinge arayed theyr pontificalibus solemly accurse priuileges grauted poules churche london kinge polidorus lib pro sua pietate gratia irrogauit paulino collegio sacerdotu ea omnia libertalis priuilegia quibus ciuitas lodine vteretur frueretur quae ne indedanu vllu faceret dedit ex suo libra septe quas etia nuc vicecomites vrbani ex arbitrio regio quot annis capiut polidorus lib iam ade annus salutis humanae nonus cu regnare cepit hericus quo anno cociliu pricipu est habitu eo concilio de regis pariter ac pri cipu sentetia paru multa priuilegia ordini sacerdotali que reliquo populo irrogata sunt multae que leges quas reges qui sequuti sunt ita approbarunt vt inde bona par iuris collecta sit quemadmodu eo extat libello qui inscribitur magna charta alterae westmynster hall king selfe nobility came pope hearing kinge afterwarde pope consente dyuerse payment clergy many thinges could lay forth pope primacy practised tyme englande nowe horn one onely acte parliament made mortmaine force yow able plucke fro pope triple crowne set yt vppon kynges head yf mortmaine bene straightly sene vnto hundred yeares ye haue fownde reuenewes suppose slender poore ye beinge good lawier ye either diuine chronicler think belyke self goneshotte ad mortmaine reacheth onely men relligion yt semeth mate may wel prouided horne forceth litle howe litle haue whether haue ought nought suerly horn semeth straunge man churche knowinge clergy hath vppon great truste good haue vpprightnes vertue bene endewed great possession dede commonly haue bene imployed vppo nedy according mynd doners shuld fynd fault mortmaine good well disposed men haue voluntarily offered church well charitably bestowed perceyue ye enemy mortmaine nowe haue madge lyue catle owne haue care prouide mortmaine successours see tell yow ye must vnderstande statute mortmaine doth reache religious men onelythe statute mortmaine doth touch religiouse bisshops spirituall men yea lay men also made aswell commodity spiritualty temporalty saue aswell one thother theire wardes eschetes commodity mortifying land wont followe well litle vnderstandinge maister horne hath mortmaine farre yt principall matter yet tell v also polidore cause lawe mortmaine wont telleth v cause fantasied selfe trueth polidore sayeth kinge made lawe represse riot excesse clergy polidor prudentia summa religionis studiosissimus insolentiae bonifacius dead accursed king interdited realme bothe realme released curse interdiction benedictus successour bonifacius yea bonifacius yet liuing king plainly agnised authoritie see rome appealing bonifacius toke right pope vsurper intruder see apostolical vacant thought next successour ye heare maister horne notwithstanding greate enmitie betwene king pope bonifacius appealeth see rome thought vacant haue said absolued sentence excommunication bonifacius successour whiche altogether ye omitte yet ye tell v pope clement fift made ye say pope king ouerreache authour water olde lying glose nauclerus neither saieth could truely saye king made pope saith made pope intercessio neither authour antoninus saieth ye saye swore pope certaine condicions doe ye name horne forsoth naming antoninus historia part c horn ovvne story proueth fully pope supremacy naucler gener contrariu declarauit scilicet ipsum fuisse catholicu indubitatu pontificem ant par tit c cocilium nullo modo cosentire voluit sed cotrariu declarauit scilicet ipsu f isse catholicu indubitatu po tificem fourme state condition new primacy faire phillip woulde full ilfauoredly acrased defourmed among three prima est vt perfecte reconcilies ecclesiae sacrosanctae relaxando venia dando de adiutorio dato captura bonifacij papae secundum est vt censuras excommunicationis amoueas contra meos sequ ce prolatas tertium est quod mihi concedas omnes decimas regni per quinquennium reparationem expensarum multarum bello inito contra flandrenses first ye perfectly reconcile churche release forgeue meanes pope boniface taken prisoner secondly wil reuoke sentence excommunication geuen mee confederate thirdly graunte fiue yeres tenth al realme relieue great charge expences defraied warres flemmings condition king required pope assure othe would horne faine haue pope boniface taken heretique saieth king phillip would haue declared councell holden vienna matter taken vp horne saith satisfie king declared pope bonifacius doings preiudiciall heires haue ye horne either wilily omitted matter pope coditionated withal haue fondly told v self councell vienna cofirme pope primacy ad declare selfe also lyer saying matter taken vp c coucel assembled bishop beside prelats would wise agree king request declared cotrary wit bonifacius catholike vndoubted bishop owne authours antoninus nauclerus specifie yea nauclere addeth quo rex cogebatur contentus esse determination councel kinge constrayned contented coronation foresayde clement presente philip frenche king ant part tit ca nauclerus dict gener paul aemilius naucler volum pag blond celebrauerat prouinciale concilium c ad sedem apostolica se mitiore aquioremque appellauerat ant part tit c s naucler gener king arragone write kinge englande also yet hath horn one prouf proue philip head churche deposed bishop heresye claymed inuestiture bishoppes inuestitures let goe time haue sayd inough suppose matter deposing bishope deposed vnder pretence heresy saieth nauclere depriued temporaltyes bishopricke doe ye horne recite whole sentece author antoninus nauclerus blondus writing nothing mater deposing bishop claimig inuestitures seeme alleage ye doe blindly allege may blot hi sauing ye may truly put councel king philip called frauce appealed haue told thapostolik see rome ye sayd shew whole ad entiere sentece authours fully adorne primacy withal whiche toke certayne bishoppe laying hys charge patera heretik spoyling hym bishopryke al good ad spoyled also robbed bishopprykes beinge vacante would haue inuestitures bishoppes king philip deposed bishop heresie yet shuld horne al take smallest reliefe therby yf philip supreme head lyuingm horne declared one agai heretik ovvne king phillip vnder dominio might also depriue fellowes heresie haue shewed pateras make litle generall coucels ad stay self religio vpo iudgmets lay prince haue heard codenation fro notable general coucel lios fro new charles emperour frederike faire king phillipmark vvoorke god good reader handie woorke god men cast owne turne geue sentence selues hotte ernest wilie first enterprise matter yet pursuit vngratious purpose cause declare worlde small circumspection prouidence lesse faith honesty many thing might brought furder aunsweare horne saieth king councell aegidius romaine diuine went reformation horne calleth matter ecclesiastical paulus aemilius authour therein double vntruth neither true aegidius counsailer aider refourme churche rather defourme order horne relligion aemilius saith againe sabellicus eyther twise placed horne margent wrog alleageth sabellicus altogether wrogfully may goe small ouersight horne diuision pag b time councel vienna famous scholman durandus setteth forth booke vvherin reckeneth vppe diuerse great enormity churche matter reformation alvvaies ioyneth king secular prince prelate purpose citeth fourme auncient councelles many time enueigheth complaineth vppon vsurped vntruth spiritual matter nowe questio authority romaine bishop vvarning men bevvare hovv yeelde vnto prescribeth rule prince prelats refourme enormity custome vvere neuer auncient vvord god stapleton answere horne directly precisely whether durandus worke taketh laye prince head church ye saye doth purpose doe ye alleage yf ye say doth bokes shal sone conuince boke praye ye speake ye name yt whie doe tel v boke man tel boke intituled de modo concilij celebradi made commaundemente foresayde clemente wherein thowghe spake many thinges reformation cowrte rome yet aswell boke taketh pope supreame head whole churche vide eunde librum titul alibi passim notoriouse man maye iudge care saye something againste pope without care howe ye saye ye fare much like madde dogge runneth foorth snatcheth euer commeth nigh durandus de diuinis officijs lib cap num geue one place horne maye longer stagger thys matter behold thys famouse scholeman call durandus saieth pope primacie illius raelatus papa c prelate whole church called papa say force matter great cou cel kepte franckford wherat king beame englande also presente wyth thing set forth special ad latin letter precise word marius additio adioyned vrspergensis neither anye marginall authours speake king englad ye haue al ad euer yt schismatical conuenticle yet muche better late conuocations yf article sayde conuocations comme theire handes dowbte bene condemned greate parte blasphemous heresy wel emperour saith say authority depedeth pope god immediatly vayne thinge wonte sayde pope hath superiour yf ye could proue emperour euangelist coucel lawfull generall councel would geue eare yf themperours authority depende immediatly god shewe v goddes commaundement geue rather german frenche english chose emperour prince christia europa holde succession electio yf ye ca shew v cause diuersity pope ordinance shal ye quite self lyke clerke yf ye ca shewe cause shal ye neuer able shewe v good cause pope clayme cofirmation yet yt sayeth hornem horne leaueth owte pelting shiftes barren cause must relieued ye yet againe hand councel frankford emperour certaine heresy pope clement laid emperours charge would make wise man wonder consider end ad purpose stuffe thrust neither cause yet coniecture vnlesse shoulde impute maistres folie dame heresie speciall ordinaunce god suffreth man malice beareth catholike church wexe blind speaketh heape vntruths naucler woordes freelie voluntarilie forsake renounce abiure promiseth woulde euer belieue specialiter cognosco tenere credere quod ad imperatorem non pertinet deponere nec instituere papa prout c sayde iohn holie churche rome belieued wil ye nowe see good reader wonderfull workinge god hath brought maister horne owne pope condemne newe heade churche lewys arrante heretikes yea make shorte aunswere maister horne booke call yt heresie maister horne doth stowtlie defende saying emperour shoulde aboue pope haue authority make depose pope thus ye heare maister horne contrary saying pope iohn neither deposed coulde deposed emperour meruayle nowe seing true sownde doctrine newe heades teachinge vide robertu arbor esem episcopum impressum parisiis anno maister horne emperour selfe declared heretike avvay iurisdiction onely saied vvould reforme neuerthelesse certeine day vvas much disputing f whether belonged kinge reforme till king foresaid procuratour gaue kinges determinat aunswere declaring vnto howe ought troubled bicause kinges intentio keepe rightes customes churche prelate good ad resonable reason fault iudgement good reasonable apperteined vnto determine kig bicause decree nouit c saieth kinge fraunce matter de facto hath superiour c vvhereuppon hee co cluded kinge woulde heare informatios customes whiche fully enfourmed good reasonable woulde make bee obserued vntruth vvas seuere vntruth p aemylius mencioneth suche lavve plainely contrary lavv vvhan savve hovv prelate dallied vvith faire vvordes vntruth therfo e p aemylius fovvly abused therefore selfe composuit rem sacerdotum set order matter priestes chapter charles philip de valois sixt name kinges fraunce stapleton well fisht caught frogge log tale tolde composuit rem sacerdotum touche particularsp aemilius li carolo pulchro carolus rex virtutis clementiae laude fructum que ad eum die tulit exin aduersourmore quod sacri ludouicu baeuaru belli noie decimas de sacerdotibus fracispetentipotific max iohani cu primum denegasset pactione deinde expugnatus concessisset vt parte ipse veniret caet wise reason reason al make quene england supreame head church charles french king denied pope tenthes clergy verely authour saith king empayre estimation men vertue fact yea yet sayth withall afterwarde codescede pope request meaneth horn alleage prouf dewe gouuernemet author report prouf vndewe regiment meaneth al worlde shoulde laugh skorne foloweth peter bertrad eftson paulus aemilius horn making speake theire myndes liketh tellig v first obscure dark false tale sayd bertrad trust shall drawe fayre open light pluck fro petrus bertrand paulus aemilius whose visour woulde fayne couer vgly face impudente shamelesse lie horn hath clergy doe matter contract mariage excommunication will examination men beliefes making synodical decree like matter wherfor ye shake intermedlinge matter wel perceiue saying ad two thing neither shall ludouicus emperour though affirmed clergy followe christ apostle pouerty make yowe disclaime goodly landes patrimony philip valesius frenche kinge make yowe disclaime iurisdiction gaine sweet perhaps ye answere strayne yowe farre ye deny vide libellum petri bertrandi episc du u cardinalis aduersus pe ru de cunerijs super facto prae u ecclesiae gallis naean hic l bel reperies adiuctum cum qua il g de vita thom paris anno shorte declarati matter hande clergy may vse iurisdiction foresayd matter church ecclesiasticall matter playne temporall matter frenche kinge proued dede neyther king proued yt authour sayth yt shamelesse dealinge man suche semeth seke nothing else ouerwhelme worlde wordes litle regardinge speake great many vntruthes euen without triall strayning hym owne authours incontinently opened descried answere fully large endlesse importune babling aswel otherwhere would tediouse thinge matter muche petrus bertrand prynte send learned reader desirouse see deapth thys matter originall booke nowe touche much onely shalbe sufficiente vnlettered reader see consider horne vnfaythfull wretched dealing petrus c erius one king priuie councell proponed clergy king nobilitie article wente proue prelate clergy many poynts vsurped vppon kinges iurisdiction auowched also temporall spirituall thing diuided sondred one appertayned kinge onely cleargy onely archbishop sans answered petrus proued olde newe testamet cyuil canon lawe custome fraunce tyme mynd vsed seuerall graunts priuileges receiued king predecessours spirituall temporall iurisdiction preci elie distincted one person might occupie daye seue night presence king stode vppe petrus bertrandus bisshoppe people fraunce called hedui nowe burgonions enforced matter addinge full aunswere aswell decree nouit alleaged horne sayd petrus cunerius vnto article greate nomber sayde article towche matter playne mere temporall yet suche clergy might medle withall partly lawe partly speciall priuilege partly custome certayne fault abuse fownd prelate officer petr bertrandus whiche prelate answered yf knowen woulde haue suffred promised forsee tyme come earneste amendinge redressinge redressing whereof kinge gaue tyme vntill christmas folowinge nowe horne would make thee belieue good reader prelats dalied thing refourmed accordingly kinge sharpe seuere lawe dyd amende correcte owne lawe good maister horne lawe kynge philippe made yowe say good authoritie truthe damnable article made late conuocation howe euer yt nothinge amended abuse amended good man wene angrie withall say yow nowe maister horne whole ecclesiasticall iurisdiction frenche clergie practised became yt king take yt away whie ye tounge tyed horne tell truth freelie liberally yea lewdly lie againste truth wel seing ye wynne yt maister horne hand good reader petrus bertrandus ye shal heare otherwise effecte finall resolution debate kinge made answere forsayd bishop sans demaunding resolute answere behalfe whole clergy prelate shoulde feare nothinge shoulde lose one iote tyme woulde defende theire righte customes neither woulde geue example impugne churche wherevppon bisshoppe name whole clergie gaue kinge moste humble thankes horn shamelesse dealinge howe generally agreed vppon allowed commaunded obserued chapter sigismund friderike emperours stapleton maister horne goddes sake remember self ye haue taken hande proue fekenha quene englade owght supreame head churche englande pope remeber pray weighty fekenham beside longe imprisonment standeth daunger losse lyfe also goe one rowndly matter bringe fytte co uenient proufe perswade withalm horne impertinete proufes weighty matter ye rune thre leaues following doinges emperours sigismonde friderike maximilian length busie rufle greate turmoyle againste pope ye come kinge henry owne dayes nowe howe litle doinges emperours proue supreamacie cause ecclesiasticalcocernig themperour sigismundus euerie childe may see beginne sigismond heare tyme great mayne schisme called councell constantia three pope deposed martine st r emperor meanes chosen heare booke reformatio offred themperour abuse matter ecclesiastical al boke one word either catholike faythe horne heresy onely reherseth vp certayne abuse woulde haue amended matter nowe hande sayth expressely church rome beareth principalyte chief rule christes church deriued principally god ordinaunce vide petru de aliaco impres basill secondarely coucels doth relieue horne heare farder themperour prince would suffer pope traslate councell basile place finally pope eugenius deposed foresayd councell basile serueth purpose yea shameles impudencie yow thus vaunte selfe horn gospel co demned cou cel co stantia alleaged tom concil pa edit vlt vppo doings two councels codemne great apostle wiccliffe horrible heretyke consequently al geneuical doctrine practised england ye must remember themperour councel deposed pope bishop doe fynde theire sentence definityue session councel basill selfe alleaged sentece definitiue themperour theis deposition matter religion ye shall fynd ergo bisshops head themperour ye nothing nearer deposition eugenius yetcocernig prete sed deposition pope eugenius ievvel reply pag acknowledged pope primacy ye haue nowe lost goodly schismaticall argumentes ye haue book brought nilus otherwise grecian rebellion sayd primacy vide theodorichi de nyem norimberg impr de schis lib ca vvhiche churche might quiet calamity ready fall pope eugenius sent frenche king desire take vvay vntruth maker pragmatical lawe acknovvleaged pope primacy pragmaticall lavve vvhom king ansvvered maketh rather agaynst though horne sayed last argument pope eugenius deposed yet nowe pope styll thother set place faine geue ouer though prince would obeye eugenius dissoluing councell basile yet nowe dissolued emperour friderike also answere euer french king made eugenius touching sayed basile councell councell allowed catholike church eugenius successour nicolaus allowe ye shewe selfe hys pragmatical sanction charles predecessour made whiche requeste pope eugenius would reuoke contained matter horne doe attribute prince nowe neyther gouernement like nowe defend pragmaticall hath cusanus vtterly ouerthrowe new primacy ad one lyne geue pawne mate whole boke lo plainly excluded al price ad laye magistrats whatsoeuer pardy ecclesiastical person like pronou ceth assuredly decreed also blasphemours paie either somme money limited suffer death men knowe decree thought good prince state empire al preacher persones high feastes preache vnto people thereof faithfully done maximilian sette forth decree taking avvaie foresaied ecclesiastical greuaunces vvherein declareth orth grat though clemencie haue suffered pope clergie herein father frederik yet withstanding sith liberality worshippe seruice god hath fallen decaie apperteineth vnto dutie god hath chosen vnto emperial throne rome amongest moste great business peace warres also looke aboute vigilantlie church anye generall councell councell schismaticall assemblie procured pope iulius fewe cardinalles whome depriued ecclesiasticall honour called onely meanes frenche king despite pope iulius making league venetian mouing genu rebelle againste maximilian doubted dede said league offended pope whiche waie take pietr messia vita di massimiliano seeinge matter growe schisme rased conuenticle remoued pise millaine agreed pope iulius also leo successoure conuenticle dissanulled generall councell holden laterane rome whiche councell length wel schismaticall cardinalles prince condescended thus euer thing defectuouse faulty make much maketh faulte refourmed thinges done orderlye none tell v sabellicus many beganne abhorre pope courtes c telling v withal sabellicus appere workes large semeth manifest vntruth neither aenead lib course time shoulde found neither rebus venetis anye otherwhere yet finde therefore vntill tell v shamefull accusation layed whome doe iustlie aunswere sauoureth shrewdly lie yet true proue el pope euill man courte licentiously ordered whereof inferre horne therfore prince england must supreame gouernour contrarie side may reason thus pope liueth man miraculouse holinesse excellente learning way reprehensible court also diligently refourmed moste godly ordered know rome witnesse ergo quenes maiestie prince ought supreme gouernour al cause ecclesiasticall clergie vvas onely diuines also vvisest expert best learned ciuil canon lavves vvas hath bene sence tonstall bisshoppe duresme stokesley bisshop london gardiner bisshop vvynton thirlebie bisshoppe vvestminster norvvich old maister bonner vvho succeded stok sley see lodon many others vvhose aduise consent vvas time also learned booke made publisshed de vera differentia regiae potestatis ecclesiasticae vvhiche doubte yee haue sene long sithen neither vvas vntruth vvas mere nouelty nevv deuise please king vvithal opinio vvas ad iudgemet lerned vntruth ciuilians canonistes th iudgement vvhiche horne defendeth const q ciuilias canonist vvhe clergy faulty negliget appertaineth themperor cal general councelles reformation churche cause philippus deciu famous lavvyer affirmeth glossator vppon canon principe affirmeth prince haue iurisdiction diuers sortes within churche ouer cleargy stubbourne ambitious subuerters faith falsaries maker schismes contemners excommunication yea also wherein euer ecclesiasticall povver faileth vveake decree meaneth vvhere povver church vvorde doctrine preuaileth therein must prince authority iurisdiction take order plaine prouis decree vvordes decree follovv seculer prince haue vntruth false tra slation nonnunqua somtimes oftentimes vvithin church highest authority may fence power ecclesiastical discipline church povver prince necessary sauing thing vvhich priest able vvorde doctrine povver prince may diuerse readinges imperet impetret commaund obteine terrour discipline heauenlie kingdome dothe oftentimes preuaile goe forvvarde earthlie kingdome vvithin churche dooe againste faithe discipline maye broughte vnder rigoure prince povver prince may lay vppon neckes proude discipline whiche profite churche hable exercise bestowe force authoritiethe prince shall geue accompt god church discipline thereof whereby deserue woorship let prince worlde wel knowe duety shall rendre accopt god churche vvhiche haue taken christe preserue vvether peace discipline churche encreased faithfull prince loosed doth exacte accompt vvho hath deliuered churche committed povver chapter kinge henry late souerayne stapleton cocernig doinges king ry lengthe course tyme horne hath prosequuted deuolued owre owne dayes doinges kinge henry eight confirmation whereof hath fetched fro partes world long many yet al impertinente argumentes belyke nowe farewell make v vppe plausible conclusion loke narrowly substancially handling proufes wil perhappe lyke good oratour winding vp matter leaue reader heartes good effectuall probation vehemente impressio perswasion surmised primacie hathe perchaunce reserued beste dishe last lyke good expert captaine set strongeste reason authority tanquam triarios milites order horne temporall lawyer realme diuine countriman lawyer sti keth breake araye course tyme one lyuing aboute yeares fowre hundred yeares sythence let v cosider proufes whether doth according accustomable wonte rather featly floute hym bring reader matter purpose nowe proue v horne king henrie taken called supreame head churche england lawfully whie pray youcocernig couocations promisse make costitution without king consente fol mary say ye conuocation promised hym theire priesthod woulde doe nothing theire councelles withowte consente horne take promise great weight dothe consideration estimation priesthod weighe deaply nowe ye wil mynde long ere ye haue done ye wil tell fekenham none al priestes one onely prieste christe yet ye say promise made truthe yt vnlesse ye proue promise honeste lawful vtterly deny promise relieue one braunche vnlawfull supreamacie king henry practised therefore thowghe doinge tolerable probable yet vnlesse ye went proufe ye shall wynne litle fekenhams handes content passe ouer residewe vsurped supreamacie tyme demaud one thing ye haue hitherto browght perswade reasonable man one pointe bishoppes determyne nothing theire synodes forcible vnlesse prince agree also yt suerlye one thing bishoppes voluntarely desired good catholyke prince ioyne themm horn hath proued boke consent necessarie yea submitted sometimes iudgmente theire doinges theire great humility notable prince ye haue shewed withall case yt conueniente donne ye full ill wynde vp conclusion vppon ye forseeing shewe v tricke newe thetorike fyne grammer turning conuenit opo tet making yt conueniente yt muste one ye belyke take better handfaste nowe wil ye see sure handfaste good reader suerly first fast whe telleth v owt decius ad owt glose cano lawm horn sampsos post vvil fall ovvn heade prince may cal cou cels case haue iurisdictio church matter wherin haue alredy sayde inowgh slenderly loosely geare hangeth assertion yt ope eye trow sticketh faster diuine lawyer therefore bringeth isidorus extraordinary yeares almost owt race course yt semeth anker hold cause aswell whole allegation producted also one peace set first page whole boke sure marke direct reader yt sampsons poste horne buyld boke vppo take good head horne yt true sampsons poste bring whole howse vpon head yt doth dedeconcerning isidorus wherunto good reader seing horne hath chosen notable allegation eied setting two notable place woulde wishe thee also geue good eye thereunto see anye way possible make say horne allegatio goeth prince cyuill worldlye power shoulde assiste maynteyne churche doctrine allegation directly rowndly proueth contrarye whiche ye doe alleage yt yt proueth ecclesiasticall authoritie cyuill cheif principall cause ecclesiasticall effecte whole tendeth nothing else sayde vide destructoriu vttiorum impress norinberg part cap qui eoru potestati suam ecclesiam tradidit defendendam prince shoulde defend churche stande ripping vp wordes diuersity reading old copy haue hath committed churche defended theire power hath deliuered committed seameth stande translation vnhansomly saye nothing credere committere one latin let goe finde faulte translation yl application yf ye brought authority proue prince defende churche whiche ende respecte writen woulde say nothing ye bleare eies make v blinde shoulde imagine saying isidore23 q c principe principe seculi nonnunquam intra ecclesiam potestati adeptae culmina tenent king supreame head churche assente necessarie synodes bishop coucelles wil say cotrary wil much better gathered allegatio firste wordes woderfully acrase newe primacy somwhat also honesty peruersly traslating nonunqua somtime oftetimes let yt nonnunquam sepe let oftetymes haue highest authoritye churche vnlesse haue yt styll called supreame heades cause ecclesiastical theis word make good argumet againste primacy vt per eande potestatem ecclesiasticam disciplina muniant cateru intra ecclesiam potestates necessariae non essent nisi vt quod non preualent sacerdotes efficere per doctrinae sermone potestas hoc imperet per disciplinae terrorem et mox vt qui intra ecclesiam positi cotra fide disciplina agunt rigore principum co arantur horne cause whie haue high authority either somtimes oftetimes isidore straytwayes sheweth cause may self translate fence theire power ecclesiastical discipline ye heare scope final purpose allegation prince authority matter ecclesiasticall defende churche therefore sayde yt sutely reade tradidit defendendam tradidit comittenda cause emperours call selues caput ecclesiae heades churche sed aduocatos ecclesiae aduocates churche self tel themperour friderike goe forth isidorus first aske horne make prince heades churche haue muche doe matter ecclesiasticall bishop decree nothing shoulde auaylable withowt theyre special ratification setting forth doctrine ye content tyme priestes shalbe priestes may sweare priesthod theire aldermanship eldership whether suche authority prince absolutelie necessarie churche yf ye say conclud self ad whole boke yf ye say yea conclude truthe againste authour sayeth suche authority prince church necessarie punishe contemne worde doctrine fayth discipline churche whome haue receiued horne worde doctrine faythe discipline churche apostle theire successours bishoppes prince suppose ye saie prince must ye graunt matter primacy resteth clergy prince selues haue receiued theire faith ad matter faith discipline churche must also obey case requireth set forth doctrine worde wyth theire temporal sworde whiche suffer throwghe theire slacknes faythe disciplyne churche loosed god horn booke manner ansvvered ovvn allegation hath committed churche defended theire power wil exacte accompte authour isidore writeth self li cap ecclesiastical history proueth holie father confirme lo see horne iudgement isidorus aboue yeres past howe iumpe agreeth assertion catholiques directly ouerthroweth therfore sure principle stokesley gardiner thirlbie bonner euident falsehood whiche practise alleaging witness man may iudge fidelitie haue handled rest throughout whole booke ignoraunte one reuerent father sincerely thinke true impute vnto whereas vpright iudgement shoulde come man owne free choise stained spotted either hope priuate lucre honoure feare great losse one two thing forceably carieth men away professing owne conscience stoppe men saying vttering otherwise would gladly haue vttered sithens put hope al promotion agreed king made iudge lesse accompte disagreeing certaine loose bothe good life also good name shew worlde shoulde haue bene put deathe name traitours whiche thing true subiectes doe chieflie abhorre yet knowe suche sorte suffered great many notable learning vertue fisher bishoppe rochester syr thomas great number carthusian beside diuerse estate knowe also matter sifted tryed learning hath bene since know secrete snake adder broode induced king minde doctours named againste willes condescended therevnto howe broughte foorthe witness heresy feare deathe saied doe longer foresaid impedimente laie theyr waye state worlde otherwise without feare deathe might vtter minde freely knoweth liued see day freedome theire woordes deedes protested pope king head churche vnder christ neuer hearde horne owne brother arryued gardiner bishope winchester chauncelour england saied wel learned grounded much repet recat authority nowe better lerned longer studie better grounded longer experience doctour gardiner moste side one matter yet suspected kinge secrete conference pope vnto hym hearde readen peter denying maister went wepte bitterlie causyng reader staye wept selfe full bitterlie saied ego exiui sed non dum fleui amare haue gone yet haue wepte bytterlie nowe doctour answereth vnder name prince co teyned highe priestes actes parliament doe disagree calling bisshoppes eduardi cap clerkes peeres lande peeres realme say saieth lotharius kinge fountayne iurisdiction meane lotharius doth churche ciuill magistrate vnder kinge said quintinus saieth gladium pontifex vtru que gestat exercet alterum rex solus quem pontifex etiam desertus suis hostes licite stringit pope hath swordes temporall spiritual iurisdiction yet king alone vseth one teporal pope may notwithstading yf forsake vse also tel qui tinus saith probauimus ecclesiam deo militantem se noluisse temere negotijs secularibus implicare temporalem que iurisdictionem principibus sponte reliquisse vvhy speculator saith al realm king iurisdictio tam que libenter tam que animo prompto facili vt regu propria videatur id circo scriptum est speculatore quod quicquid est regno id esse intelligitur de iurisdictione regis haue proued militant church doth vpo good cause intermedle seculer affaire yea rather geueth ouer prince temporall iurisdiction gladly willinglye yt seemeth appertayne prince onely ecclesia vtru que gladiu tenet vtramque pariter habet iurisdictione therefore speculatour writeth euer kingdome vnderstanded kinges iurisdiction persuaded spirituall temporall iurisdiction stode contrarie one one man might exercise quintinus hiself misliketh opinion saith euen said place nouimus vtrum que gladium solo ecclesiae datum hoc est ecclesiae pontificem habere ius potestatem spiritualia simul omnia temporalia que ex ijs decernere statuere ex causa posse cuius decretis standum gibere deformem flagitiosissim quidam postea tam infenso nebulone speaketh speculator church ad prince seculer hath swordes iurisdictions vpon occasion doth vehemently inueighe petrus de cugnerio whome haue spoke stifflye stand frech clergy teporall iurisdictio prouoked king philip valesius much laye plucke away fro clergie calleth misshapen parson body wicked say al one knaue thoughe name terrible thowgh would seeme great wisedome carrie al realme vpo shulders yet euer lawghing stock durst shame great challege shew hiself abrode wont peter de cugnerioquintin declareth horn li story kig philip valesius rehersed called tong pierre de coyner would say peter lurketh corner wil ye heare horne authour quin inus expoudeth coposuit sacerdotum king set order matter priest wil ye heare also sharpe law made auouch saith king pronuciauit ecclesia meus sep yue st vntruths orn lesse en lynes feuda eporalia quae que bona propria sibi possidere posse que illa iurisdictione habere gaue sentece pronouced church might possesse fealtes temporal thing ad haue iurisdictio therein much first entrauce quitinus wherin beside shame ye must take worshipful glose vpo coposuit sacerdotu first ye see vvere commenteth saying thus reason vvherefore leaful prince vvhiles determine thing vvhich concerne church least honesty mother meaneth church thing violated least tranquilly troubled specially vvhom committed meaning church minister stapleton duabus regulis co cluda prior est semper fidei peccati materia ius ecclesiasticum attendendum est fore ciuili tumque cessat omne iuris imperatorij mandatum aboletur leaue one horne peuishe pinching paring miserable mayming marring authours authour horne geueth two rule first authority matter church saying matter fayth synne lawe church euer obserued determine thinges touchinge church seyng ye haue heard determination toucheth fayth synne vsed generally sometymes quietnes church horn diuision pag b thing chiefly ecclesiasticall matter namely call conuocate councelles saith quintinus opinion saith many learned men emperour may conuocate general councel often cause whan pope cardinalles noted suspicio doo forslowe ad ceasse either lacke skil peraduenture euil meaning el whan schisme costatinus saith called first nicene coucel hovv farre true hath large ben shevved secod book three general coucels gratianus theodosius martianus themperours
