shoulde one loke enioy pardon hauing recourse deputy say woulde knowe whether thys prince shoulde counted inferiour subiecte meane defende renowmed auncient father golden mouth foolish blast lewde horners mouth nede seeke defence wordes alleaged fekenham horne quite ouerblowen owne blast telling v allegation yea truely said chrysostome king hath administratio earthly thing beside power hath authority matter also ministery sayth horne earthly outwarde ergo say fekenham kinge supreame head cause ecclesiasticall spiritual say cause nay one cause mere spirituall ecclesiasticall hauing nothing doe worldly earthly cause thus ye see howe wel theis two father gregory nazianzene ad iohn chrysostome two greate pillers greke church may easely drawen without great force helpe fekenhams cause nowe way may noted horne al great reading want reading fyndeth fekenham hath wonderfully ouershotte selfe hath ouersight lost ioly triumphante matter might haue haue triumphed vppon fekeham might haue sayd pray fekeham iulian wicked apostata sheepe christes flock renegate panyme cruel persequutour christian shewe reuerece holy aulters reuerently submit head vnder priestes hand much like rhetorik might horn yf either readinge remembraunce woulde haue serued haue vttered fekenham say truth horn must yelde confesse ye haue founde one companion yea one emperour say neither reuerenced aulters priestes hand ye doe therfore dede lo obiectio yf come time would haue dressed fekenham trust seing faulte found amended hand ye wil fynd great matter neither could greatly semeth scribe fault putting iulianum valentem diuision fol novv sith al obiections hitherto ye haue brought foorthe vntruth impudent hath bene sayd vvel appereth nothinge al eyther made selfe maketh vvhitte time yee dravve conclusion bicause good conclusion follovve euil premiss yee vvere dryuen conclude finishe vp obiection vvith like patchinge vvresting vntruth slaunderous falsifying authours ye therefore wil beare person case ye good ad catholike could part cotent ye enioyed bishoprike stil ad amply catholik prelats horne diuision pag b conclusion yet insufficient rest fain adioyne peece thereunto first vvould learne vvhere augustine hath vvoords al sixe bookes iulian istis cede mihi cedes haue shevve vvhere haue hovve ye follovve augustine hovv dare impudetly say ye preache teache vvhen ye istis cede non caedes yelde thou shalt strike whippe vntruth copy haue vvordes fekeham hath put haue put vvordes istis cede mihi non cedes yelde thou shalt yelde yet corrupting sentence maketh serue teache preache preach yeld thow shalt yelde doth horne reuell fekenha hath like answere first denieth place augustine may good sequele gathered bishop may make lawes vse al cohibitiue iurisdiction hauing fekenham fowle euident faulte pretext maye couered thinketh false dealing owne frendes wil take deape dissembler yea rather abhorre open slaunderer belier father manifest mangler alterer peruerter corrupter augustine stede istis cede non caedes yelde thou shalt strike whip hath put istis cede mihi cedes yelde thow shalt yelde saith belike fekenham sticke corrupte maketh flatte thus vseth corrupt maketh neither fro self selfe rolleth augustine sentence layth forth fekeha euil dealing augustin doth pelagius brittayn monke finally though battel wone ful conquest made vpon poore fekenham calleth vpon yelde relente mary sir terrible blaste dede blowen maister horne mouth farewell blustering tempest sturred vp newe aeolus seemeth fekenham must nedes ouerblowen vehemency yt yet seeke see foundation original cause broyle al likelihodde fekenham hath founde good apparance great aduantage corrupting wordes augustin man lightly doltish vse foule sluttish shift without cofort hope matter according old saying cui bono nay saith horn corrupting sentence serueth whit fekenhas purpose doth horne would fekenha deale fondly ope falshod staine honesty ad whippe traslate yelde without benefit cause suerly worthy aswel loue twise whipped falshod ad ons folly therefore accusation eue tale cui bono vtterly incredible yet yf falsly folishly demeaned self seing toucheth part substance questio lieth betwixt ad playe yf folish yet vehemet oratour ad haue sauced oratory ouer much gal ad egernes al blowing blustering great hil bringeth forth nothing poore aesop mouse yet say epistola numerate vel ab ipsa sede petri ipsa est petra quam non vincunt superbae inferorum portae psalm contra partem donati epistola ad optatum ab innocentio sozimo toto orbe christiano danati epistola dictum epistola patres non humana sed diuina decreuere sententia vt quicquid de disiunctis remotisque prouincijs ageretur non prius ducerent finie dum nisi ad huius sedis notitiam perueniret vbi tota huius authoritate iusta quae fuerit pronunciatio firmaretur pelagians horne augustine writinge againste donatistes saith principality peter apostleship preferred bishoprike augustine vseth bringe againste donatistes authority sea rome singular principal authoritye y yt augustine writinge againste saide donatistes sayeth sea peter rocke proude gate hel ouercome let v come litle pelagians complaint nowe present prisoner tower much contrary promise made premiss true lyke moste true openly commited many witness denied honour may easily iudge wisedome discretion charitie haue hene vsed poore man q maiesties prisonner l committed dare boldly affirme well vsed straunge see suche behauiour openly shewed table man surely mine owne parte neuer vsed neither openly priuately man table whole life humble sute therefore vnto honour proufe trial may trueth herein deseruings hath bene whole time mine abode due search examination hereof doubt shal fall matter betwixt v either much simplicitie trueth el greate crafte falsehood either honest vertuouse godly el dishonest vitiouse vngodly vsage either much light learning knowledge el grosse ignoraunce palpable darkenesse let fall light whiche side shall happe vppon triall examination made doubt honour shall haue full shewe sufficient proufe made euery thing hath passed betweene v may deniall made shifte short time long time may possibly endure euery thing openly committed done diuerse manie beyng knowledge witnesse thereof horne challenge promise breache syxe pointes truely knovve rumour spredde seruauntes othervvise yee subscribed article yet euer herde thing hereof savve reporte booke published suche rumour vvere spredde seruauntes shoulde haue named might receiue condigne punishment therefore seconde rumour recantation say likevvise vnderstoode nothinge ovvne reporte booke therfore referring authour punished accordingly thinke punishment ought light vppon selfe thirdly chardge changinge religion ix time yee xix time saide vntruth euident slaunderous truely vppon proufe vnconstat affirming denying fevve time good experience oft haue vvitnes fourthly touchinge abusing denny yee misreporte gentleman thinge euer vvas spoken suche vvere vvas herde say retourne home vvas abroade preachinge vvhan suche scoffinge talke vvas betvvixte occasion talke ministred parte denny partely vvay merie talke betvvixt tvvaine partly sturred vp vnseemely vvords yet none hearinge last daie vvhan restraigned liberty much table prouoke saide gentleman calling epicure fasted ye saied fearing least denny like younge man shoulde geue euill vvordes againe vvilled say nothing selfe vvoulde ansvveare matter mine ansvveare vvas meruailed vvhy vvould cal epicure thought eate fleashe neuer fishe saied might vntruth ioined vvith grosse errour vvelfast vvith fleashe vvith fishe vvere vsed abstinency saied denny vvhere euerie daie vveeke vntruthe slaunderous al know feckenha vvitnesse three meales fridaie gentleman vvas contented three day vveeke vvith one meale daie neuer eate aboue tvvo vntrue either denny vvas man vtterly vnknovhen beinge conuersant togeather one house quarter yeere famil ar company yea sought many time play bovvles vvalke parke mery togeather also vntrue hearde abused coulde like therein vntruely dooe surmise shoulde procure denny meanes abuse yee malitiousely conceiue fiftely restrainte liberty vvhiche cal close imprisonment haue ben talkes betvvixt denny vvithin one hovvre knovve right vvel restrainte vvas vppon occasion vppon seemelie behauiour aboute matter vvhereof ye make mention least shoulde haue prooued self lier fevve vvoordes calmed storme seemed vvoulde arise betvvixt dennie entred talke vvith matter religion vvas vvont doo dailie talke vvas venial mortal sinne haue forgotte occasion sure haue remembraunce monkish iebusites cal iesuites vntruth slaunderous ievvish may remember crosse came gaue occasion talke matter proued vntruth heretical sinne venial could remitted ceremonie yea sinne vntruth like maner plaine hereticall selfe mortal yet venial purged merites christe onelie al sinnes vvere neuer mortal vvere neuerthelesse venial sauing al sinne againste holy ghoste vvhiche irremissible saying pointes vvhich condened ye sel rage ye onely railed bishop sarisburie saying vvas vtterlie vnlearned neuer hable ansvvere hardinges booke also openly called almoste plaine termes heretique said doctrine whiche preached yet ye vvould neuer heare erroneous filthy blasphemous filthely blasphemous mouth coulde raile vntruth doctrine hath affynite vvith god truthe god truthe vvherupon staie saied alonely vvere vnmann rlie vvordes spoken mine ovvne table therfore vvould tha say opely vnto tolde dinner vvoulde shevve minde betvvixt shortly dinner came vp calling gallory house adioining chamber put remebraunce vvhiche oftentimes admonished outragious talke mine absence vsed oftentimes opely table vvhereof sondrie time geue vvarning might breede peril selfe blame offence others bicause foud stil co tinuace misorder yea muche vehemet many time mine absence presence therefore vvilled thenceforth absteine conferring vvith anie man vvise addinge haue chamber al thing necessary vvhat meate vvold competently appoint ovvne diet vvhich ye accordinglie although restraine comming mie table goe much large doon yet keper vvhich vvas ovvn man faire gallory adioyning cha ber opening mie parke seruaut chamber self next ye leades faire large vvhich ye might vvalke haue prospect ouer parkes gardeins orchardes therevvith thrise vveake least vvhiles laie vvaltham vvith one appointed vvalked abroade parkes garden orchard call close emprisonment sixthly touching complaint honourable vvherby vvere remitted prisoner againe tovver vvhat vvas honour vvel declare pleasure beinge suer haue broken promise vvith hitherto vttering opinio lavves realm haue said vvhich ye shevved anie time priuate conference ye haue anie cause challenge behalfe conclude premiss maie appeare honourable tast vvhat sinceritie againe quarelling vntruthe fekenham hath point belyed shedule spread abrode vvil stand al coteyned therin belying spreading booke vvas chieflie recouer credit vvith faction vvho haue saied conceiued doubt reuolt confirme grounded vntruthe catholike faith errour errour herevvith bringe suche obloquie hatred lastlie impugne barke q maiesties vntruthe slaunderous neither fekenham catholikes doe impugne quenes lavvfull authority onely suche novve proued vnlavvfully attributed hignes lavvfull due authoritie vvhich complices dailie labour subuert vvhich matter referre considered graue vvisdome moste honourable finis chapter certaine priuate matter betwene feke ham horne certaine especial heresy auouched horne wherby conclude concludeth himselfe plaine heretike stapleton last parte standeth moste vppon mutuall accusation fekenham fynding selfe greaued missused horne table noted incontinencie gluttonie hypocrisie rumour spread abrode horne seruantes subscription recantation finally contrary horne promise made hym suffer domage hurte wordes passed betwixt first restrained libertie accustomable horne kepte close prisoner vj wekes afterward procurement remitted towre horne side denieth euer priuie rumour complayneth fast vppon fekenham disorder calling deny epicure owne table openly calling self almost plaine termes heretike putteth fekeham remembraunce certaine talke passed betwene man may fast aswell fleshe fishe mortall deadly synne matter restraynte liberty sayth came vppon owne disorder coplayning vpon councell brake promisse matter priuately passed betwene beinge one neither present yet sithence fully vnderstanding certainty must leaue fekenhams owne defence time shal serue sauing muche say haue bene credibly
